ï»¿A [Little Princess]125-little princess

1

[Sara]18-sara

Once on a dark winter 's day , when the yellow fog hung so thick and heavy in [the streets of [London]1-london]126-the streets of london that the lamps were lighted and the shop windows blazed with gas as they do at night , [an odd - looking little girl]127-an odd - looking little girl sat in [a cab]128-a cab with [[her]127-an odd - looking little girl father]129-her father and was driven rather slowly through [the big thoroughfares]130-the big thoroughfares .

[She]127-an odd - looking little girl sat with [her]127-an odd - looking little girl feet tucked under [her]127-an odd - looking little girl , and leaned against [[her]127-an odd - looking little girl father]129-her father , who held [her]127-an odd - looking little girl in [his]129-her father arm , as [she]127-an odd - looking little girl stared out of the window at [the passing people]132-the passing people with a queer old - fashioned thoughtfulness in [her]127-an odd - looking little girl big eyes .

[She]127-an odd - looking little girl was such [a little girl]133-a little girl that [one]134-one did not expect to see such a look on [her]127-an odd - looking little girl small face . It would have been an old look for [a child of twelve]135-a child of twelve , and [Sara Crewe]18-sara was only seven . The fact was , however , that [she]18-sara was always dreaming and thinking odd things and could not [herself]18-sara remember any time when [she]18-sara had not been thinking things about [grown - up people]136-grown - up people and [the world]137-the world [they]136-grown - up people belonged to . [She]18-sara felt as if [she]18-sara had lived a long , long time .

At this moment [she]18-sara was remembering the voyage [she]18-sara had just made from [Bombay]2-bombay with [[her]18-sara father]129-her father , [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe . [She]18-sara was thinking of [the big ship]139-the big ship , of [the Lascars passing silently to and fro on]140-the lascars passing silently to and fro on [it]139-the big ship , of [the children playing about on the hot deck]141-the children playing about on the hot deck , and of [[some young officers]142-some young officers ' wives who used to try to make [her]18-sara talk to [them]142-some young officers and laugh at the things [she]18-sara said]143-some young officers ' wives who used to try to make her talk to them and laugh at the things she said .

Principally , [she]18-sara was thinking of what a queer thing it was that at one time [one]134-one was in [India]3-india in the blazing sun , and then in [the middle of [the ocean]146-the ocean]145-the middle of the ocean , and then driving in [a strange vehicle]147-a strange vehicle through [strange streets]148-strange streets where the day was as dark as the night . [She]18-sara found this so puzzling that [she]18-sara moved closer to [[her]18-sara father]129-her father .

" [Papa]20-papa , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said in a low , mysterious little voice which was almost a whisper , " [papa]1809-papa . "[18-sara]

" What is it , [darling]1810-darling ? "[19-captain crewe] [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe answered , holding [her]18-sara closer and looking down into [her]18-sara face . " What is [Sara]18-sara thinking of ? "[19-captain crewe]

" Is this [the place]1811-the place ? "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara whispered , cuddling still closer to [him]129-her father . " Is it , [papa]1809-papa ? "[18-sara]

" Yes , [little Sara]18-sara , it is . [We]1813-we have reached [it]1811-the place at last . "[129-her father] And though [she]18-sara was only seven years old , [she]18-sara knew that [he]129-her father felt sad when [he]129-her father said it .

It seemed to [her]18-sara many years since [he]129-her father had begun to prepare [her]18-sara mind for " [the place]1811-the place , "[18-sara] as [she]18-sara always called [it]150-it . [[Her]18-sara mother]151-her mother had died when [she]18-sara was born , so [she]18-sara had never known or missed [her]151-her mother . [[Her]18-sara young , handsome , rich , petting father]152-her young , handsome , rich , petting father seemed to be [the only relation [she]18-sara had in [the world]137-the world]153-the only relation she had in the world . [They]155-they had always played together and been fond of [each other]156-each other . [She]18-sara only knew [he]152-her young , handsome , rich , petting father was rich because [she]18-sara had heard [people]157-people say so when [they]157-people thought [she]18-sara was not listening , and [she]18-sara had also heard [them]157-people say that when [she]18-sara grew up [she]18-sara would be rich , too . [She]18-sara did not know all that being rich meant . [She]18-sara had always lived in [a beautiful bungalow]158-a beautiful bungalow , and had been used to seeing [many servants who made salaams to [her]18-sara]159-many servants who made salaams to her and called [her]18-sara " [Missee Sahib]21-missee sahib , "[159-many servants who made salaams to her] and gave [her]18-sara [her]18-sara own way in everything . [She]18-sara had had toys and pets and [an ayah who worshipped [her]18-sara]160-an ayah who worshipped her , and [she]18-sara had gradually learned that [people who were rich]161-people who were rich had these things . That , however , was all [she]18-sara knew about it .

During [her]18-sara short life only one thing had troubled [her]18-sara , and that thing was " the place "[18-sara] [she]18-sara was to be taken to some day . [The climate of [India]3-india]162-the climate of india was very bad for [children]163-children , and as soon as possible [they]163-children were sent away from [it]162-the climate of india generally to [England]4-england and to [school]164-school . [She]18-sara had seen [other children]165-other children go away , and had heard [[their]165-other children fathers]166-their fathers and [mothers]167-mothers talk about the letters [they]165-other children received from [them]165-other children . [She]18-sara had known that [she]18-sara would be obliged to go also , and though sometimes [[her]18-sara father]129-her father 's stories of the voyage and [the new country]169-the new country had attracted [her]18-sara , [she]18-sara had been troubled by the thought that [he]129-her father could not stay with [her]18-sara .

" Could n't [you]129-her father go to [that place]1815-that place with [me]18-sara , [papa]1809-papa ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara had asked when [she]18-sara was five years old . " Could n't [you]129-her father go to [school]164-school , too ? [I]18-sara would help [you]129-her father with [your]129-her father lessons . "[18-sara]

" But [you]18-sara will not have to stay for a very long time , [little Sara]18-sara , "[129-her father] [he]129-her father had always said . " [You]18-sara will go to [a nice house]1818-a nice house where there will be a lot of [little girls]1819-little girls , and [you]18-sara will play together , and [I]129-her father will send [you]18-sara plenty of books , and [you]18-sara will grow so fast that it will seem scarcely a year before [you]18-sara are big enough and clever enough to come back and take care of [papa]1809-papa . "[129-her father]

[She]18-sara had liked to think of that . To keep [the house]170-the house for [[her]18-sara father]129-her father ; to ride with [him]129-her father , and sit at the head of [his]129-her father table when [he]129-her father had dinner parties ; to talk to [him]129-her father and read [his]129-her father books that would be what [she]18-sara would like most in [the world]137-the world , and if [one]134-one must go away to " [the place "[18-sara] in [England]4-england]1821-the place " in england to attain it , [she]18-sara must make up [her]18-sara mind to go . [She]18-sara did not care very much for [other little girls]174-other little girls , but if [she]18-sara had plenty of books [she]18-sara could console [herself]18-sara . [She]18-sara liked books more than anything else , and was , in fact , always inventing stories of beautiful things and telling them to [herself]18-sara . Sometimes [she]18-sara had told them to [[her]18-sara father]129-her father , and [he]129-her father had liked them as much as [she]18-sara did .

" Well , [papa]1809-papa , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said softly , " if [we]1823-we are [here]1824-here [I]18-sara suppose [we]1823-we must be resigned . "[18-sara]

[He]129-her father laughed at [her]18-sara old - fashioned speech and kissed [her]18-sara . [He]129-her father was really not at all resigned [himself]129-her father , though [he]129-her father knew [he]129-her father must keep that a secret . [[His]129-her father quaint little [Sara]18-sara]176-his quaint little sara had been a great companion to [him]129-her father , and [he]129-her father felt [he]129-her father should be [a lonely fellow]177-a lonely fellow when , on [his]129-her father return to [India]3-india , [he]129-her father went into [[his]129-her father bungalow]178-his bungalow knowing [he]129-her father need not expect to see [the small figure in [its]178-his bungalow white frock come forward to meet [him]129-her father]179-the small figure in its white frock come forward to meet him . So [he]129-her father held [her]18-sara very closely in [his]129-her father arms as [the cab]180-the cab rolled into the big , dull square in which stood [the house which was [their]182-they destination]181-the house which was their destination .

[It]181-the house which was their destination was [a big , dull , brick house , exactly like all the others in [its]181-the house which was their destination row]183-a big , dull , brick house , exactly like all the others in its row , but that on the front door there shone a brass plate on which was engraved in black letters :

[MISS MINCHIN]22-miss minchin , Select Seminary for [Young Ladies]184-young ladies .

" Here [we]182-they are , [Sara]18-sara , "[19-captain crewe] said [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe , making [his]19-captain crewe voice sound as cheerful as possible . Then [he]19-captain crewe lifted [her]18-sara out of [the cab]180-the cab and [they]182-they mounted the steps and rang the bell . [Sara]18-sara often thought afterward that [the house]170-the house was somehow exactly like [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . [It]181-the house which was their destination was respectable and well furnished , but everything in [it]181-the house which was their destination was ugly ; and the very armchairs seemed to have hard bones in them . In [the hall]187-the hall everything was hard and polished even the red cheeks of the moon face on the tall clock in the corner had a severe varnished look . [The drawing room into which [they]182-they were ushered]188-the drawing room into which they were ushered was covered by a carpet with a square pattern upon it , the chairs were square , and a heavy marble timepiece stood upon the heavy marble mantel .

As [she]18-sara sat down in one of the stiff mahogany chairs , [Sara]18-sara cast one of [her]18-sara quick looks about [her]18-sara .

" [I]18-sara do n't like it , [papa]1809-papa , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " But then [I]18-sara dare say [soldiers]1826-soldiers even [brave ones]1827-brave ones do n't really LIKE going into battle . "[18-sara]

[Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe laughed outright at this . [He]19-captain crewe was young and full of fun , and [he]19-captain crewe never tired of hearing [Sara]18-sara 's queer speeches .

" Oh , [little Sara]18-sara , "[19-captain crewe] [he]19-captain crewe said . " What shall [I]19-captain crewe do when [I]19-captain crewe have [no one]1828-no one to say solemn things to [me]19-captain crewe ? [No one else]1829-no one else is as solemn as [you]18-sara are . "[19-captain crewe]

" But why do solemn things make [you]19-captain crewe laugh so ? "[18-sara] inquired [Sara]18-sara .

" Because [you]18-sara are such fun when [you]18-sara say them , "[19-captain crewe] [he]19-captain crewe answered , laughing still more . And then suddenly [he]19-captain crewe swept [her]18-sara into [his]19-captain crewe arms and kissed [her]18-sara very hard , stopping laughing all at once and looking almost as if tears had come into [his]19-captain crewe eyes .

It was just then that [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin entered [the room]189-the room . [She]22-miss minchin was very like [[her]22-miss minchin house]190-her house , [Sara]18-sara felt : tall and dull , and respectable and ugly . [She]22-miss minchin had large , cold , fishy eyes , and a large , cold , fishy smile . It spread itself into a very large smile when [she]22-miss minchin saw [Sara]18-sara and [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe . [She]18-sara had heard a great many desirable things of [the young soldier from the lady who had recommended [[her]22-miss minchin school]192-her school to [him]19-captain crewe]191-the young soldier from the lady who had recommended her school to him . Among other things , [she]18-sara had heard that [he]19-captain crewe was [a rich father who was willing to spend a great deal of money on [[his]19-captain crewe little daughter]194-his little daughter]193-a rich father who was willing to spend a great deal of money on his little daughter .

" It will be a great privilege to have charge of such [a beautiful and promising child]1830-a beautiful and promising child , [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , taking [Sara]18-sara 's hand and stroking it . " [Lady Meredith]23-lady meredith has told [me]18-sara of [her]23-lady meredith unusual cleverness . [A clever child]1831-a clever child is a great treasure in [an establishment like [mine]18-sara]1832-an establishment like mine . "[18-sara]

[Sara]18-sara stood quietly , with [her]18-sara eyes fixed upon [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's face . [She]18-sara was thinking something odd , as usual .

" Why does [she]22-miss minchin say [I]18-sara am [a beautiful child]1833-a beautiful child ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara was thinking . " [I]18-sara am not beautiful at all . [[Colonel Grange]24-colonel grange 's little girl]1834-colonel grange 's little girl , [Isobel]25-isobel , is beautiful . [She]25-isobel has dimples and rose - colored cheeks , and long hair the color of gold . [I]18-sara have short black hair and green eyes ; besides which , [I]18-sara am [a thin child]1835-a thin child and not fair in the least . [I]18-sara am [one of [the ugliest children [I]18-sara ever saw]1837-the ugliest children i ever saw]1836-one of the ugliest children i ever saw . [She]25-isobel is beginning by telling a story . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara was mistaken , however , in thinking [she]18-sara was [an ugly child]195-an ugly child . [She]18-sara was not in the least like [Isobel Grange]25-isobel , who had been [the beauty of [the regiment]197-the regiment]196-the beauty of the regiment , but [she]18-sara had an odd charm of [her]18-sara own . [She]18-sara was a slim , supple creature , rather tall for [her]18-sara age , and had an intense , attractive little face . [Her]18-sara hair was heavy and quite black and only curled at the tips ; [her]18-sara eyes were greenish gray , it is true , but they were big , wonderful eyes with long , black lashes , and though [she]18-sara [herself]18-sara did not like the color of them , [many other people]198-many other people did . Still [she]18-sara was very firm in [her]18-sara belief that [she]18-sara was [an ugly little girl]199-an ugly little girl , and [she]18-sara was not at all elated by [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's flattery .

" [I]18-sara should be telling a story if [I]18-sara said [she]18-sara was beautiful , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara thought ; " and [I]18-sara should know [I]18-sara was telling a story . [I]18-sara believe [I]18-sara am as ugly as [she]18-sara is in [my]18-sara way . What did [she]18-sara say that for ? "[18-sara]

After [she]18-sara had known [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin longer [she]18-sara learned why [she]22-miss minchin had said it . [She]18-sara discovered that [she]22-miss minchin said the same thing to [each papa]200-each papa and [mamma who brought [a child]202-a child to [[her]22-miss minchin school]192-her school]201-mamma who brought a child to her school .

[Sara]18-sara stood near [[her]18-sara father]129-her father and listened while [he]129-her father and [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin talked . [She]18-sara had been brought to [the seminary]205-the seminary because [[Lady Meredith]23-lady meredith 's two little girls]206-lady meredith 's two little girls had been educated [there]207-there , and [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe had a great respect for [Lady Meredith]23-lady meredith 's experience . [Sara]18-sara was to be what was known as " [a parlor boarder]1838-a parlor boarder , "[18-sara] and [she]18-sara was to enjoy even greater privileges than [parlor boarders]208-parlor boarders usually did . [She]18-sara was to have [[a pretty bedroom]209-a pretty bedroom and sitting room of [her]18-sara own]210-a pretty bedroom and sitting room of her own ; [she]18-sara was to have a pony and [a carriage]211-a carriage , and [a maid]212-a maid to take the place of [the ayah who had been [[her]18-sara nurse in [India]3-india]214-her nurse in india]213-the ayah who had been her nurse in india .

" [I]19-captain crewe am not in the least anxious about [her]18-sara education , "[19-captain crewe] [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe said , with [his]19-captain crewe gay laugh , as [he]19-captain crewe held [Sara]18-sara 's hand and patted it . " The difficulty will be to keep [her]18-sara from learning too fast and too much . [She]18-sara is always sitting with [her]18-sara little nose burrowing into books . [She]18-sara does n't read them , [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin ; [she]18-sara gobbles them up as if [she]18-sara were a little wolf instead of [a little girl]133-a little girl . [She]18-sara is always starving for new books to gobble , and [she]18-sara wants grown - up books great , big , fat ones French and German as well as English history and biography and [poets]1840-poets , and all sorts of things . Drag [her]18-sara away from [her]18-sara books when [she]18-sara reads too much . Make [her]18-sara ride [her]18-sara pony in [the Row]1841-the row or go out and buy a new doll . [She]18-sara ought to play more with dolls . "[19-captain crewe]

" [Papa]20-papa , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , " [you]20-papa see , if [I]18-sara went out and bought a new doll every few days [I]18-sara should have more than [I]18-sara could be fond of . [Dolls]26-dolls ought to be [intimate friends]1842-intimate friends . [Emily]27-emily is going to be [[my]18-sara intimate friend]1843-my intimate friend . "[18-sara]

[Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe looked at [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin and [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin looked at [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe .

" Who is [Emily]27-emily ? "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin inquired .

" Tell [her]27-emily , [Sara]18-sara , "[19-captain crewe] [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe said , smiling .

[Sara]18-sara 's green - gray eyes looked very solemn and quite soft as [she]18-sara answered .

" [She]27-emily is a doll [I]18-sara have n't got yet , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " [She]27-emily is a doll [papa]1809-papa is going to buy for [me]18-sara . [She]27-emily is going to be [[my]18-sara friend]1846-my friend when [papa]1809-papa is gone . [I]18-sara want [her]27-emily to talk to about [him]1809-papa . "[18-sara]

[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's large , fishy smile became very flattering indeed .

" What [an original child]1848-an original child ! "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " What [a darling little creature]1849-a darling little creature ! "[18-sara]

[She]22-miss minchin had taken a book from the desk and was turning over its leaves . [Sara]18-sara went to [her]22-miss minchin politely .

" As [[your]18-sara papa]1898-your papa has engaged [a French maid]1899-a french maid for [you]18-sara , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin began , " [I]22-miss minchin conclude that [he]1898-your papa wishes [you]18-sara to make a special study of the French language . "[22-miss minchin]

[Sara]18-sara felt a little awkward .

" [I]18-sara think [he]1898-your papa engaged [her]1899-a french maid , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , " because [he]1898-your papa [he]1898-your papa thought [I]18-sara would like [her]1899-a french maid , [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . "[18-sara]

" [I]22-miss minchin am afraid , "[22-miss minchin] said [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin , with a slightly sour smile , " that [you]18-sara have been [a very spoiled little girl]1900-a very spoiled little girl and always imagine that things are done because [you]18-sara like them . If [Sara]18-sara had been older or less punctilious about being quite polite to [people]157-people , [she]18-sara could have explained [herself]18-sara in a very few words . But , as it was , [she]18-sara felt a flush rising on [her]18-sara cheeks . [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin was [a very severe and imposing person]300-a very severe and imposing person , and [she]22-miss minchin seemed so absolutely sure that [Sara]18-sara knew nothing whatever of French that [she]18-sara felt as if it would be almost rude to correct [her]22-miss minchin . The truth was that [Sara]18-sara could not remember the time when [she]18-sara had not seemed to know French . [[Her]18-sara father]129-her father had often spoken it to [her]18-sara when [she]18-sara had been [a baby]302-a baby . [[Her]18-sara mother]151-her mother had been [a French woman]304-a french woman , and [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe had loved [her]151-her mother language , so it happened that [Sara]18-sara had always heard and been familiar with it .

" [I]18-sara [I]18-sara have never really learned French , but but "[18-sara] [she]18-sara began , trying shyly to make [herself]18-sara clear .

One of [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's chief secret annoyances was that [she]22-miss minchin did not speak French [herself]22-miss minchin , and was desirous of concealing the irritating fact . [She]22-miss minchin , therefore , had no intention of discussing the matter and laying [herself]22-miss minchin open to innocent questioning by [a new little pupil]305-a new little pupil .

" That is enough , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said with polite tartness . " If [you]18-sara have not learned , [you]18-sara must begin at once . [The French master]1902-the french master , [Monsieur Dufarge]35-monsieur dufarge , will be here in a few minutes . Take this book and look at it until [he]1902-the french master arrives . "[22-miss minchin]

[Sara]18-sara 's cheeks felt warm . [She]18-sara went back to [her]18-sara seat and opened the book . [She]18-sara looked at the first page with a grave face . [She]18-sara knew it would be rude to smile , and [she]18-sara was very determined not to be rude . But it was very odd to find [herself]18-sara expected to study a page which told [her]18-sara that " [le pere]1903-le pere "[22-miss minchin] meant " [the father]1904-the father , "[22-miss minchin] and " [la mere]1905-la mere "[22-miss minchin] meant " [the mother]1906-the mother . "[22-miss minchin]

[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin glanced toward [her]18-sara scrutinizingly .

" [You]18-sara look rather cross , [Sara]18-sara , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said . " [I]22-miss minchin am sorry [you]18-sara do not like the idea of learning French . "[22-miss minchin]

" [I]18-sara am very fond of it , "[18-sara] answered [Sara]18-sara , thinking [she]18-sara would try again ; " but "[18-sara]

" [You]18-sara must not say ' but ' when [you]18-sara are told to do things , "[22-miss minchin] said [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . " Look at [your]18-sara book again . "[22-miss minchin]

And [Sara]18-sara did so , and did not smile , even when [she]18-sara found that " le fils "[18-sara] meant " [the son]1907-the son , "[18-sara] and " le frere "[18-sara] meant " [the brother]1908-the brother . "[18-sara]

" When [Monsieur Dufarge]35-monsieur dufarge comes , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara thought , " [I]18-sara can make [him]35-monsieur dufarge understand . "[18-sara]

[Monsieur Dufarge]35-monsieur dufarge arrived very shortly afterward . [He]35-monsieur dufarge was [a very nice , intelligent , middle - aged Frenchman]306-a very nice , intelligent , middle - aged frenchman , and [he]35-monsieur dufarge looked interested when [his]35-monsieur dufarge eyes fell upon [Sara]18-sara trying politely to seem absorbed in [her]18-sara little book of phrases .

" Is this a new pupil for [me]35-monsieur dufarge , [madame]1909-madame ? "[35-monsieur dufarge] [he]35-monsieur dufarge said to [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . " [I]35-monsieur dufarge hope that is [my]35-monsieur dufarge good fortune . "[35-monsieur dufarge]

" [[Her]18-sara papa]283-her papa [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe is very anxious that [she]18-sara should begin the language . " [I]35-monsieur dufarge am sorry of that , [mademoiselle]18-sara , "[35-monsieur dufarge] [he]35-monsieur dufarge said kindly to [Sara]18-sara . " Perhaps , when [we]1911-we begin to study together , [I]35-monsieur dufarge may show [you]18-sara that it is a charming tongue . "[35-monsieur dufarge]

[Little Sara]18-sara rose in [her]18-sara seat . [She]18-sara was beginning to feel rather desperate , as if [she]18-sara were almost in disgrace . [She]18-sara looked up into [Monsieur Dufarge]35-monsieur dufarge 's face with [her]18-sara big , green - gray eyes , and they were quite innocently appealing . [She]18-sara knew that [he]35-monsieur dufarge would understand as soon as [she]18-sara spoke . [She]18-sara began to explain quite simply in pretty and fluent French . [Madame]38-madame pascal had not understood . [She]38-madame pascal had not learned French exactly not out of books but [[her]38-madame pascal papa]283-her papa and [other people]308-other people had always spoken it to [her]38-madame pascal , and [she]38-madame pascal had read it and written it as [she]38-madame pascal had read and written English . [[Her]38-madame pascal papa]283-her papa loved it , and [she]38-madame pascal loved it because [he]283-her papa did . [[Her]38-madame pascal dear]310-her dear mamma , who had died when [she]38-madame pascal was born , had been French . [She]38-madame pascal would be glad to learn anything [monsieur]311-monsieur would teach [her]38-madame pascal , but what [she]38-madame pascal had tried to explain to [madame]1909-madame was that [she]38-madame pascal already knew the words in this book and [she]38-madame pascal held out the little book of phrases .

When [she]38-madame pascal began to speak [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin started quite violently and sat staring at [her]38-madame pascal over [her]22-miss minchin eyeglasses , almost indignantly , until [she]38-madame pascal had finished . [Monsieur Dufarge]35-monsieur dufarge began to smile , and [his]35-monsieur dufarge smile was one of great pleasure . When [she]38-madame pascal had finished , [he]35-monsieur dufarge took the phrase book from [her]38-madame pascal , with a look almost affectionate . But [he]35-monsieur dufarge spoke to [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin .

" Ah , [madame]1909-madame , "[35-monsieur dufarge] [he]35-monsieur dufarge said , " there is not much [I]35-monsieur dufarge can teach [her]22-miss minchin . [She]22-miss minchin has not LEARNED French ; [she]22-miss minchin is French . [Her]22-miss minchin accent is exquisite . "[35-monsieur dufarge]

" [You]18-sara ought to have told [me]22-miss minchin , "[22-miss minchin] exclaimed [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin , much mortified , turning to [Sara]18-sara .

" [I]18-sara [I]18-sara tried , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " [I]18-sara [I]18-sara suppose [I]18-sara did not begin right . "[18-sara]

[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin knew [she]22-miss minchin had tried , and that it had not been [her]22-miss minchin fault that [she]22-miss minchin was not allowed to explain . " Silence , [young ladies]184-young ladies ! "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said severely , rapping upon the desk . " Silence at once ! "[22-miss minchin]

And [she]22-miss minchin began from that minute to feel rather a grudge against [[her]22-miss minchin show pupil]315-her show pupil .

3

Ermengarde

On that first morning , when [Sara]18-sara sat at [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's side , aware that [the whole schoolroom]316-the whole schoolroom was devoting itself to observing [her]18-sara , [she]18-sara had noticed very soon [one little girl , about [her]18-sara own age , who looked at [her]18-sara very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes]317-one little girl , about her own age , who looked at her very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes . [She]317-one little girl , about her own age , who looked at her very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes was [a fat child who did not look as if [she]317-one little girl , about her own age , who looked at her very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes were in the least clever , but [she]317-one little girl , about her own age , who looked at her very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes had a good - naturedly pouting mouth]318-a fat child who did not look as if she were in the least clever , but she had a good - naturedly pouting mouth . [Her]317-one little girl , about her own age , who looked at her very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes flaxen hair was braided in a tight pigtail , tied with a ribbon , and [she]317-one little girl , about her own age , who looked at her very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes had pulled this pigtail around [her]317-one little girl , about her own age , who looked at her very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes neck , and was biting the end of the ribbon , resting [her]317-one little girl , about her own age , who looked at her very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes elbows on the desk , as [she]317-one little girl , about her own age , who looked at her very hard with a pair of light , rather dull , blue eyes stared wonderingly at [the new pupil]319-the new pupil . When [Monsieur Dufarge]35-monsieur dufarge began to speak to [Sara]18-sara , [she]18-sara looked a little frightened ; and when [Sara]18-sara stepped forward and , looking at [him]35-monsieur dufarge with the innocent , appealing eyes , answered [him]35-monsieur dufarge , without any warning , in French , [the fat little girl]320-the fat little girl gave a startled jump , and grew quite red in [her]320-the fat little girl awed amazement . Having wept hopeless tears for weeks in [her]18-sara efforts to remember that " [la mere]1905-la mere "[134-one] meant " [the mother]1906-the mother , "[134-one] and " [le pere]1903-le pere , "[134-one] " [the father]1904-the father , "[134-one] when [one]134-one spoke sensible English it was almost too much for [her]18-sara suddenly to find [herself]18-sara listening to [a child [her]18-sara own age who seemed not only quite familiar with these words , but apparently knew any number of others , and could mix them up with verbs as if they were mere trifles]322-a child her own age who seemed not only quite familiar with these words , but apparently knew any number of others , and could mix them up with verbs as if they were mere trifles .

[She]18-sara stared so hard and bit the ribbon on [her]18-sara pigtail so fast that [she]18-sara attracted the attention of [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin , who , feeling extremely cross at the moment , immediately pounced upon [her]18-sara .

" [Miss St. John]39-miss st. john ! "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin exclaimed severely . " What do [you]39-miss st. john mean by such conduct ? Remove [your]39-miss st. john elbows ! Upon which [Miss St. John]39-miss st. john gave another jump , and when [Lavinia]30-lavinia and [Jessie]33-jessie tittered [she]18-sara became redder than ever so red , indeed , that [she]18-sara almost looked as if tears were coming into [her]18-sara poor , dull , childish eyes ; and [Sara]18-sara saw [her]18-sara and was so sorry for [her]18-sara that [she]18-sara began rather to like [her]18-sara and want to be [[her]18-sara friend]279-her friend . It was a way of [hers]18-sara always to want to spring into any fray in which [someone]1856-someone was made uncomfortable or unhappy .

" If [Sara]18-sara had been [a boy]1918-a boy and lived a few centuries ago , "[129-her father] [[her]18-sara father]129-her father used to say , ' [she]18-sara would have gone about [the country]326-the country with [her]18-sara sword drawn , rescuing and defending [everyone in distress]327-everyone in distress . [She]18-sara always wants to fight when [she]18-sara sees [people in trouble]328-people in trouble . "[18-sara]

So [she]18-sara took rather a fancy to fat , slow , [little Miss St. John]39-miss st. john , and kept glancing toward [her]18-sara through the morning . [She]18-sara saw that lessons were no easy matter to [her]18-sara , and that there was no danger of [her]18-sara ever being spoiled by being treated as [a show pupil]329-a show pupil . [Her]18-sara French lesson was a pathetic thing . [Her]18-sara pronunciation made even [Monsieur Dufarge]35-monsieur dufarge smile in spite of [himself]35-monsieur dufarge , and [Lavinia]30-lavinia and [Jessie]33-jessie and [the more fortunate girls]330-the more fortunate girls either giggled or looked at [her]18-sara in wondering disdain . But [Sara]18-sara did not laugh . [She]18-sara tried to look as if [she]18-sara did not hear when [Miss St. John]39-miss st. john called " [le bon pain]1919-le bon pain , "[39-miss st. john] " lee bong pang . "[18-sara] [She]18-sara had a fine , hot little temper of [her]18-sara own , and it made [her]18-sara feel rather savage when [she]18-sara heard the titters and saw [the poor , stupid , distressed child]331-the poor , stupid , distressed child 's face .

" It is n't funny , really , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said between [her]18-sara teeth , as [she]18-sara bent over [her]18-sara book . " [They]294-the pupils ought not to laugh . "[18-sara]

When lessons were over and [the pupils]294-the pupils gathered together in groups to talk , [Sara]18-sara looked for [Miss St. John]39-miss st. john , and finding [her]39-miss st. john bundled rather disconsolately in a window - seat , [she]18-sara walked over to [her]39-miss st. john and spoke . [She]18-sara only said the kind of thing [little girls]1819-little girls always say to [each other]156-each other by way of beginning an acquaintance , but there was something friendly about [Sara]18-sara , and [people]157-people always felt it .

" What is [your]39-miss st. john name ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said .

To explain [Miss St. John]39-miss st. john 's amazement one must recall that [a new pupil]336-a new pupil is , for a short time , a somewhat uncertain thing ; and of [this new pupil]337-this new pupil [the entire school]338-the entire school had talked the night before until [it]338-the entire school fell asleep quite exhausted by excitement and contradictory stories . " [My]18-sara name 's [Ermengarde St. John]40-ermengarde , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara answered .

" [Mine]18-sara is [Sara Crewe]18-sara , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " [Yours]18-sara is very pretty . It sounds like a story book . "[18-sara]

" Do [you]18-sara like it ? "[40-ermengarde] fluttered [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde . " [I]40-ermengarde [I]40-ermengarde like [yours]18-sara . "[40-ermengarde]

[Miss St. John]39-miss st. john 's chief trouble in life was that [she]39-miss st. john had [a clever father]343-a clever father . Sometimes this seemed to [her]39-miss st. john a dreadful calamity . [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was a severe trial to [Mr. St. John]41-mr. st. john . " Good heavens ! "[343-a clever father]

If [her]39-miss st. john Aunt [Eliza]42-eliza had been slow to learn and quick to forget a thing entirely when [she]42-eliza had learned it , [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was strikingly like [her]42-eliza . " [She]40-ermengarde must be MADE to learn , "[129-her father] [[her]39-miss st. john father]129-her father said to [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin .

[Consequently Ermengarde]40-ermengarde spent the greater part of [her]40-ermengarde life in disgrace or in tears . [She]40-ermengarde learned things and forgot them ; or , if [she]40-ermengarde remembered them , [she]40-ermengarde did not understand them . " [You]18-sara can speak French , ca n't [you]18-sara ? "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said respectfully .

[Sara]18-sara got on to the window - seat , which was a big , deep one , and , tucking up [her]18-sara feet , sat with [her]18-sara hands clasped round [her]18-sara knees .

" Oh , no , [I]40-ermengarde could n't , "[40-ermengarde] said [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde . " [I]40-ermengarde NEVER could speak it ! "[40-ermengarde]

" Why ? "[18-sara] inquired [Sara]18-sara , curiously .

" [You]18-sara heard [me]40-ermengarde just now , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said . " [I]40-ermengarde 'm always like that . [I]40-ermengarde ca n't SAY the words . They 're so queer . "[40-ermengarde]

[She]40-ermengarde paused a moment , and then added with a touch of awe in [her]40-ermengarde voice , " [You]18-sara are CLEVER , are n't [you]18-sara ? "[40-ermengarde]

[Sara]18-sara looked out of the window into [the dingy square]351-the dingy square , where the sparrows were hopping and twittering on the wet , iron railings and the sooty branches of the trees . [She]18-sara reflected a few moments . [She]18-sara had heard it said very often that [she]18-sara was " clever , "[18-sara] and [she]18-sara wondered if [she]18-sara was and IF [she]18-sara was , how it had happened .

" [I]18-sara do n't know , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " [I]18-sara ca n't tell . "[18-sara] Then , seeing a mournful look on the round , chubby face , [she]18-sara gave a little laugh and changed the subject .

" Would [you]18-sara like to see [Emily]27-emily ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara inquired .

" Who is [Emily]27-emily ? "[40-ermengarde] [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde asked , just as [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin had done .

" Come up to [[my]18-sara room]1921-my room and see , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , holding out [her]18-sara hand .

" Yes , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara answered . [They]352-they had reached [the passage leading to [Sara]18-sara 's room]355-the passage leading to sara 's room by this time , and [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde stopped short , staring , and quite losing [her]40-ermengarde breath .

" Why , [anyone]1925-anyone can make up things , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " Have [you]18-sara never tried ? "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara put [her]18-sara hand warningly on [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde 's .

" Let [us]1926-us go very quietly to the door , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara whispered , " and then [I]18-sara will open it quite suddenly ; perhaps [we]1926-us may catch [her]18-sara . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara was half laughing , but there was a touch of mysterious hope in [her]18-sara eyes which fascinated [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde , though [she]18-sara had not the remotest idea what it meant , or whom it was [she]18-sara wanted to " catch , "[18-sara] or why [she]18-sara wanted to catch [her]18-sara . Whatsoever [she]18-sara meant , [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was sure it was something delightfully exciting . So , quite thrilled with expectation , [she]40-ermengarde followed [her]40-ermengarde on tiptoe along [the passage]356-the passage . [They]357-they made not the least noise until [they]357-they reached the door . Then [Sara]18-sara suddenly turned the handle , and threw it wide open . Its opening revealed [the room]189-the room quite neat and quiet , a fire gently burning in the grate , and a wonderful doll sitting in a chair by it , apparently reading a book .

" Oh , [she]18-sara got back to [her]18-sara seat before [we]357-they could see [her]18-sara ! "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara explained . " Of course [they]357-they always do . [They]357-they are as quick as lightning . "[18-sara]

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde looked from [her]18-sara to the doll and back again .

" Can [she]18-sara walk ? "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde asked breathlessly .

" Yes , "[18-sara] answered [Sara]18-sara . " At least [I]18-sara believe [she]18-sara can . At least [I]18-sara PRETEND [I]18-sara believe [she]18-sara can . And that makes it seem as if it were true . Have [you]18-sara never pretended things ? "[18-sara]

" No , "[40-ermengarde] said [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde . " Never . [I]40-ermengarde tell [me]40-ermengarde about it . "[40-ermengarde]

[She]40-ermengarde was so bewitched by [this odd , new companion]359-this odd , new companion that [she]40-ermengarde actually stared at [Sara]18-sara instead of at [Emily]27-emily notwithstanding that [Emily]27-emily was [the most attractive doll person [she]40-ermengarde had ever seen]360-the most attractive doll person she had ever seen .

" Let [us]1927-us sit down , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , " and [I]18-sara will tell [you]27-emily . It 's so easy that when [you]27-emily begin [you]27-emily ca n't stop . [You]27-emily just go on and on doing it always . And it 's beautiful . [Emily]27-emily , [you]27-emily must listen . This is [Ermengarde St. John]40-ermengarde , [Emily]27-emily . " Oh , may [I]40-ermengarde ? "[40-ermengarde] said [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde . " May [I]40-ermengarde , really ? [She]27-emily is beautiful ! "[40-ermengarde] And [Emily]27-emily was put into [her]40-ermengarde arms .

Never in [her]40-ermengarde dull , short life had [Miss St. John]39-miss st. john dreamed of such an hour as the one [she]40-ermengarde spent with [the queer new pupil]361-the queer new pupil before [they]362-they heard the lunch - bell ring and were obliged to go [downstairs]265-downstairs .

[Sara]18-sara sat upon the hearth - rug and told [her]18-sara strange things . [She]18-sara sat rather huddled up , and [her]18-sara green eyes shone and [her]18-sara cheeks flushed . [She]18-sara told stories of the voyage , and stories of [India]3-india ; but what fascinated [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde the most was [her]18-sara fancy about [the dolls who walked and talked]364-the dolls who walked and talked , and who could do anything [they]364-the dolls who walked and talked chose when [the human beings]365-the human beings were out of [the room]189-the room , but who must keep [their]364-the dolls who walked and talked powers a secret and so flew back to [their]364-the dolls who walked and talked places " like lightning "[18-sara] when [people]157-people returned to [the room]189-the room .

" [WE]1928-we could n't do it , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , seriously . " [You]40-ermengarde see , it 's a kind of magic . "[18-sara]

Once , when [she]18-sara was relating the story of the search for [Emily]27-emily , [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde saw [her]18-sara face suddenly change . A cloud seemed to pass over it and put out the light in [her]18-sara shining eyes . [She]18-sara drew [her]18-sara breath in so sharply that it made a funny , sad little sound , and then [she]18-sara shut [her]18-sara lips and held them tightly closed , as if [she]18-sara was determined either to do or NOT to do something . [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde had an idea that if [she]18-sara had been like [any other little girl]369-any other little girl , [she]18-sara might have suddenly burst out sobbing and crying . But [she]18-sara did not .

" Have [you]40-ermengarde a a pain ? "[40-ermengarde] [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde ventured .

" Yes , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara answered , after a moment 's silence . " But it is not in [my]18-sara body . "[18-sara] Then [she]18-sara added something in a low voice which [she]18-sara tried to keep quite steady , and it was this : " Do [you]40-ermengarde love [[your]40-ermengarde father]1929-your father more than anything else in all [the whole world]1930-the whole world ? "[18-sara]

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde 's mouth fell open a little . [She]40-ermengarde knew that it would be far from behaving like [a respectable child]370-a respectable child at [a select seminary]371-a select seminary to say that it had never occurred to [you]372-you that [you]372-you COULD love [[your]372-you father]1929-your father , that [you]372-you would do anything desperate to avoid being left alone in [[his]1929-your father society]374-his society for ten minutes . [She]40-ermengarde was , indeed , greatly embarrassed .

" [I]40-ermengarde [I]40-ermengarde scarcely ever see [him]1929-your father , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde stammered . " [He]1929-your father is always in [the library]1931-the library reading things . "[40-ermengarde]

" [I]18-sara love [mine]18-sara more than all [the world]137-the world ten times over , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara said . " That is what [my]18-sara pain is . [He]1929-your father has gone away . "[18-sara]

[She]40-ermengarde put [her]40-ermengarde head quietly down on [her]40-ermengarde little , huddled - up knees , and sat very still for a few minutes .

" [She]40-ermengarde 's going to cry out loud , "[40-ermengarde] thought [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde , fearfully .

But [she]40-ermengarde did not . [Her]40-ermengarde short , black locks tumbled about [her]40-ermengarde ears , and [she]40-ermengarde sat still . Then [she]40-ermengarde spoke without lifting [her]40-ermengarde head .

" [I]40-ermengarde promised [him]1929-your father [I]40-ermengarde would bear it , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said . " And [I]40-ermengarde will . [You]40-ermengarde have to bear things . Think what [soldiers]1826-soldiers bear ! [Papa]20-papa is [a soldier]1934-a soldier . If there was a war [he]20-papa would have to bear marching and thirstiness and , perhaps , deep wounds . And [he]20-papa would never say a word not one word . "[40-ermengarde]

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde could only gaze at [her]40-ermengarde , but [she]40-ermengarde felt that [she]40-ermengarde was beginning to adore [her]40-ermengarde . [She]40-ermengarde was so wonderful and different from [anyone else]375-anyone else .

Presently , [she]40-ermengarde lifted [her]40-ermengarde face and shook back [her]40-ermengarde black locks , with a queer little smile .

" If [I]40-ermengarde go on talking and talking , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said , " and telling [you]40-ermengarde things about pretending , [I]40-ermengarde shall bear it better . [You]40-ermengarde do n't forget , but [you]40-ermengarde bear it better . "[40-ermengarde]

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde did not know why a lump came into [her]40-ermengarde throat and [her]40-ermengarde eyes felt as if tears were in them .

" [Lavinia]30-lavinia and [Jessie]33-jessie are ' [best friends]1935-best friends , ' "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said rather huskily . " [I]40-ermengarde wish [we]1936-we could be ' [best friends]1935-best friends . ' Would [you]40-ermengarde have [me]40-ermengarde for [yours]40-ermengarde ? "[40-ermengarde]

4

[Lottie]31-lottie

If [Sara]18-sara had been [a different kind of child]376-a different kind of child , the life [she]18-sara led at [[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's Select Seminary]377-miss minchin 's select seminary for the next few years would not have been at all good for [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara was treated more as if [she]18-sara were [a distinguished guest at [the establishment]274-the establishment]378-a distinguished guest at the establishment than as if [she]18-sara were [a mere little girl]380-a mere little girl . If [she]18-sara had been [a self - opinionated , domineering child]381-a self - opinionated , domineering child , [she]18-sara might have become disagreeable enough to be unbearable through being so much indulged and flattered . If [she]18-sara had been [an indolent child]382-an indolent child , [she]18-sara would have learned nothing . Privately [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin disliked [her]18-sara , but [she]22-miss minchin was far too worldly [a woman]383-a woman to do or say anything which might make [such a desirable pupil]384-such a desirable pupil wish to leave [[her]22-miss minchin school]192-her school . [She]22-miss minchin knew quite well that if [Sara]18-sara wrote to [[her]18-sara papa]283-her papa to tell [him]283-her papa [she]18-sara was uncomfortable or unhappy , [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe would remove [her]18-sara at once . [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's opinion was that if [a child]202-a child were continually praised and never forbidden to do what [she]202-a child liked , [she]202-a child would be sure to be fond of [the place where [she]202-a child was so treated]388-the place where she was so treated . Accordingly , [Sara]18-sara was praised for [her]18-sara quickness at [her]18-sara lessons , for [her]18-sara good manners , for [her]18-sara amiability to [[her]18-sara fellow pupils]389-her fellow pupils , for [her]18-sara generosity if [she]18-sara gave sixpence to [a beggar]390-a beggar out of [her]18-sara full little purse ; the simplest thing [she]18-sara did was treated as if it were a virtue , and if [she]18-sara had not had a disposition and a clever little brain , [she]18-sara might have been [a very self - satisfied young person]391-a very self - satisfied young person . But the clever little brain told [her]18-sara a great many sensible and true things about [herself]18-sara and [her]18-sara circumstances , and now and then [she]18-sara talked these things over to [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde as time went on .

" Things happen to [people]157-people by accident , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara used to say . " A lot of nice accidents have happened to [me]18-sara . It just HAPPENED that [I]18-sara always liked lessons and books , and could remember things when [I]18-sara learned them . It just happened that [I]18-sara was born with [a father who was beautiful and nice and clever]1942-a father who was beautiful and nice and clever , and could give [me]18-sara everything [I]18-sara liked . Perhaps [I]18-sara have not really a good temper at all , but if [you]1943-you have everything [you]1943-you want and [everyone]1944-everyone is kind to [you]1943-you , how can [you]1943-you help but be good - tempered ? [I]18-sara do n't know "[18-sara] looking quite serious " how [I]18-sara shall ever find out whether [I]18-sara am really [a nice child]1945-a nice child or [a horrid one]1946-a horrid one . Perhaps [I]18-sara 'm [a HIDEOUS child]1947-a hideous child , and [no one]1828-no one will ever know , just because [I]18-sara never have any trials . "[18-sara]

" [Lavinia]30-lavinia has no trials , "[40-ermengarde] said [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde , stolidly , " and [she]30-lavinia is horrid enough . "[40-ermengarde]

[Sara]18-sara rubbed the end of [her]18-sara little nose reflectively , as [she]18-sara thought the matter over .

" Well , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said at last , " perhaps perhaps that is because [Lavinia]30-lavinia is GROWING . "[18-sara] This was the result of a charitable recollection of having heard [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin say that [Lavinia]30-lavinia was growing so fast that [she]22-miss minchin believed it affected [her]22-miss minchin health and temper .

[Lavinia]30-lavinia , in fact , was spiteful . [She]30-lavinia was inordinately jealous of [Sara]18-sara . Until [the new pupil]319-the new pupil 's arrival , [she]30-lavinia had felt [herself]30-lavinia [the leader in [the school]349-the school]393-the leader in the school . [She]30-lavinia had led because [she]30-lavinia was capable of making [herself]30-lavinia extremely disagreeable if [the others]395-the others did not follow [her]30-lavinia . [She]30-lavinia domineered over [the little children]396-the little children , and assumed grand airs with those big enough to be [[her]30-lavinia companions]397-her companions . [She]30-lavinia was rather pretty , and had been [the best - dressed pupil in the procession]398-the best - dressed pupil in the procession when [the Select Seminary]399-the select seminary walked out two by two , until [Sara]18-sara 's velvet coats and sable muffs appeared , combined with drooping ostrich feathers , and were led by [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin at the head of the line . This , at the beginning , had been bitter enough ; but as time went on it became apparent that [Sara]18-sara was [a leader]400-a leader , too , and not because [she]18-sara could make [herself]18-sara disagreeable , but because [she]18-sara never did .

" There 's one thing about [Sara Crewe]18-sara , "[33-jessie] [Jessie]33-jessie had enraged [[her]33-jessie " best friend]1949-her " best friend "[30-lavinia] by saying honestly , ' [she]30-lavinia 's never ' grand ' about [herself]30-lavinia the least bit , and [you]18-sara know [she]30-lavinia might be , [Lavvie]44-lavvie . " ' [Dear Sara]18-sara must come into [the drawing room]1950-the drawing room and talk to [Mrs. Musgrave]45-mrs. musgrave about [India]3-india , ' "[30-lavinia] mimicked [Lavinia]30-lavinia , in [her]30-lavinia most highly flavored imitation of [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . " [She]30-lavinia 's always doing something silly , "[30-lavinia] snapped [Lavinia]30-lavinia . " [[My]30-lavinia mamma]1874-my mamma says that way of [hers]1874-my mamma of pretending things is silly . [She]1874-my mamma says [she]1874-my mamma will grow up eccentric . "[30-lavinia]

It was quite true that [Sara]18-sara was never " grand . "[33-jessie] [She]18-sara was [a friendly little soul]402-a friendly little soul , and shared [her]18-sara privileges and belongings with a free hand . [The little ones]403-the little ones , who were accustomed to being disdained and ordered out of the way by [mature ladies aged ten and twelve]404-mature ladies aged ten and twelve , were never made to cry by [this most envied of [them]403-the little ones all]405-this most envied of them all . [She]18-sara was [a motherly young person]406-a motherly young person , and when [people]157-people fell down and scraped [their]157-people knees , [she]18-sara ran and helped [them]157-people up and patted [them]157-people , or found in [her]18-sara pocket a bonbon or some other article of a soothing nature . [She]18-sara never pushed [them]157-people out of [her]18-sara way or alluded to [their]157-people years as a humiliation and a blot upon [their]157-people small characters .

" If [you]30-lavinia are four [you]30-lavinia are four , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said severely to [Lavinia]30-lavinia on an occasion of [her]18-sara having it must be confessed slapped [Lottie]31-lottie and called [her]18-sara " [a brat]1959-a brat ; "[18-sara] " but [you]30-lavinia will be five next year , and six the year after that . " Dear [me]30-lavinia , "[30-lavinia] said [Lavinia]30-lavinia , " how [we]1960-we can calculate ! "[30-lavinia] In fact , it was not to be denied that sixteen and four made twenty and twenty was an age [the most daring]408-the most daring were scarcely bold enough to dream of .

So [the younger children]409-the younger children adored [Sara]18-sara . More than once [she]18-sara had been known to have a tea party , made up of [these despised ones]410-these despised ones , in [[her]18-sara own room]411-her own room . And [Emily]27-emily had been played with , and [Emily]27-emily 's own tea service used the one with cups which held quite a lot of much - sweetened weak tea and had blue flowers on them . [No one]1828-no one had seen [such a very real doll]413-such a very real doll 's tea set before . From that afternoon [Sara]18-sara was regarded as [a goddess]414-a goddess and [a queen]415-a queen by [the entire alphabet class]416-the entire alphabet class .

[Lottie Legh]31-lottie worshipped [her]18-sara to such an extent that if [Sara]18-sara had not been [a motherly person]417-a motherly person , [she]18-sara would have found [her]18-sara tiresome . [Lottie]31-lottie had been sent to [school]164-school by [a rather flighty young papa who could not imagine what else to do with [her]31-lottie]419-a rather flighty young papa who could not imagine what else to do with her . [[Her]31-lottie young mother]420-her young mother had died , and as [the child]261-the child had been treated like a favorite doll or a very spoiled pet monkey or lap dog ever since the first hour of [her]261-the child life , [she]261-the child was [a very appalling little creature]422-a very appalling little creature . When [she]261-the child wanted anything or did not want anything [she]261-the child wept and howled ; and , as [she]261-the child always wanted the things [she]261-the child could not have , and did not want the things that were best for [her]261-the child , [her]261-the child shrill little voice was usually to be heard uplifted in wails in one part of [the house]170-the house or another .

[Her]261-the child strongest weapon was that in some mysterious way [she]261-the child had found out that [a very small girl who had lost [[her]424-a very small girl who had lost her mother mother]151-her mother]424-a very small girl who had lost her mother was [a person who ought to be pitied and made much of]426-a person who ought to be pitied and made much of . [She]261-the child had probably heard [some grown - up people]427-some grown - up people talking [her]261-the child over in the early days , after [[her]424-a very small girl who had lost her mother mother]151-her mother 's death . So it became [her]261-the child habit to make great use of this knowledge .

The first time [Sara]18-sara took [her]261-the child in charge was one morning when , on passing [a sitting room]429-a sitting room , [she]18-sara heard both [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin and [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin trying to suppress the angry wails of [some child who , evidently , refused to be silenced]430-some child who , evidently , refused to be silenced . [She]261-the child refused so strenuously indeed that [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin was obliged to almost shout in a stately and severe manner to make [herself]22-miss minchin heard .

" What IS [she]261-the child crying for ? "[261-the child] [she]261-the child almost yelled .

" Oh oh oh ! "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara heard ; " [I]18-sara have n't got any mam ma - a ! "[18-sara]

" Oh ! Oh ! Oh ! Oh ! Oh ! "[31-lottie] [Lottie]31-lottie howled tempestuously . " Have n't got any mam ma - a ! "[31-lottie]

" [She]261-the child ought to be whipped , "[22-miss minchin] [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin proclaimed . " [You]31-lottie SHALL be whipped , [you]31-lottie [naughty child]1962-naughty child ! "[22-miss minchin]

[Lottie]31-lottie wailed more loudly than ever . [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin began to cry . [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's voice rose until it almost thundered , then suddenly [she]22-miss minchin sprang up from [her]22-miss minchin chair in impotent indignation and flounced out of [the room]189-the room , leaving [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin to arrange the matter .

[Sara]18-sara had paused in [the hall]187-the hall , wondering if [she]18-sara ought to go into [the room]189-the room , because [she]18-sara had recently begun a friendly acquaintance with [Lottie]31-lottie and might be able to quiet [her]31-lottie . When [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin came out and saw [her]18-sara , [she]22-miss minchin looked rather annoyed . [She]22-miss minchin realized that [her]22-miss minchin voice , as heard from inside [the room]189-the room , could not have sounded either dignified or amiable .

" Oh , [Sara]18-sara ! "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin exclaimed , endeavoring to produce a suitable smile .

" [I]18-sara stopped , "[18-sara] explained [Sara]18-sara , " because [I]18-sara knew it was [Lottie]31-lottie and [I]18-sara thought , perhaps just perhaps , [I]18-sara could make [her]31-lottie be quiet . May [I]18-sara try , [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin ? "[18-sara]

" If [you]18-sara can , [you]18-sara are [a clever child]1831-a clever child , "[22-miss minchin] answered [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin , drawing in [her]22-miss minchin mouth sharply . " But [you]18-sara are clever in everything , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said in [her]22-miss minchin approving way . When [Sara]18-sara entered [the room]189-the room , [Lottie]31-lottie was lying upon the floor , screaming and kicking [her]31-lottie small fat legs violently , and [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin was bending over [her]31-lottie in consternation and despair , looking quite red and damp with heat . [Lottie]31-lottie had always found , when in [[her]31-lottie own nursery at [home]437-home]436-her own nursery at home , that kicking and screaming would always be quieted by any means [she]31-lottie insisted on . [Poor plump Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin was trying first one method , and then another .
