[Sara]18-sara went to [them]438-them quietly . [She]18-sara did not know at all what [she]18-sara was going to do , but [she]18-sara had a vague inward conviction that it would be better not to say such different kinds of things quite so helplessly and excitedly .

" [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said in a low voice , " [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin says [I]18-sara may try to make [her]22-miss minchin stop may [I]18-sara ? "[18-sara]

[Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin turned and looked at [her]18-sara hopelessly . " Oh , DO [you]18-sara think [you]18-sara can ? "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin gasped .

" [I]18-sara do n't know whether [I]18-sara CAN "[18-sara] , answered [Sara]18-sara , still in [her]18-sara half - whisper ; " but [I]18-sara will try . "[18-sara]

[Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin stumbled up from [her]22-miss minchin knees with a heavy sigh , and [Lottie]31-lottie 's fat little legs kicked as hard as ever .

" If [you]22-miss minchin will steal out of [the room]189-the room , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , " [I]18-sara will stay with [her]31-lottie . "[18-sara]

" Oh , [Sara]18-sara ! "[22-miss minchin] almost whimpered [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin . " [We]1969-we never had such [a dreadful child]1970-a dreadful child before . [I]22-miss minchin do n't believe [we]1969-we can keep [her]31-lottie . "[22-miss minchin]

But [she]22-miss minchin crept out of [the room]189-the room , and was very much relieved to find an excuse for doing it .

[Sara]18-sara stood by [the howling furious child]440-the howling furious child for a few moments , and looked down at [her]440-the howling furious child without saying anything . Then [she]18-sara sat down flat on the floor beside [her]440-the howling furious child and waited . Except for [Lottie]31-lottie 's angry screams , [the room]189-the room was quite quiet . This was a new state of affairs for [little Miss Legh]47-little miss legh , who was accustomed , when [she]47-little miss legh screamed , to hear [other people]308-other people protest and implore and command and coax by turns . To lie and kick and shriek , and find [the only person near [you]444-you]443-the only person near you not seeming to mind in the least , attracted [her]47-little miss legh attention . [She]47-little miss legh opened [her]47-little miss legh tight - shut streaming eyes to see who [this person]445-this person was . And it was only [another little girl]446-another little girl . But it was the one who owned [Emily]27-emily and all the nice things . And [she]440-the howling furious child was looking at [her]47-little miss legh steadily and as if [she]440-the howling furious child was merely thinking . Having paused for a few seconds to find this out , [Lottie]31-lottie thought [she]47-little miss legh must begin again , but the quiet of [the room]189-the room and of [Sara]18-sara 's odd , interested face made [her]47-little miss legh first howl rather half - hearted .

" [I]47-little miss legh have n't [any ma ma ma - a]1971-any ma ma ma - a ! "[47-little miss legh] [she]47-little miss legh announced ; but [her]47-little miss legh voice was not so strong .

[Sara]18-sara looked at [her]18-sara still more steadily , but with a sort of understanding in [her]18-sara eyes .

" Neither have [I]18-sara , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said .

This was so unexpected that it was astounding . [Lottie]31-lottie actually dropped [her]31-lottie legs , gave a wriggle , and lay and stared . A new idea will stop [a crying child]448-a crying child when nothing else will . Also it was true that while [Lottie]31-lottie disliked [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin , who was cross , and [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin , who was foolishly indulgent , [she]31-lottie rather liked [Sara]18-sara , little as [she]31-lottie knew [her]18-sara . [She]31-lottie did not want to give up [her]31-lottie grievance , but [her]31-lottie thoughts were distracted from it , so [she]31-lottie wriggled again , and , after a sulky sob , said , " Where is [she]449-her mamma ? "[31-lottie]

[Sara]18-sara paused a moment . Because [she]18-sara had been told that [[her]18-sara mamma]449-her mamma was in [heaven]450-heaven , [she]18-sara had thought a great deal about the matter , and [her]18-sara thoughts had not been quite like those of [other people]308-other people .

" [She]449-her mamma went to [heaven]450-heaven , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " But [I]18-sara am sure [she]449-her mamma comes out sometimes to see [me]18-sara though [I]18-sara do n't see [her]449-her mamma . So does [yours]1973-yours . Perhaps [they]1974-they can both see [us]1975-us now . Perhaps [they]1974-they are both in [this room]1976-this room . "[18-sara]

[Lottie]31-lottie sat bolt upright , and looked about [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara was [a pretty , little , curly - headed creature]452-a pretty , little , curly - headed creature , and [her]18-sara round eyes were like wet forget - [me]0-i - nots . If [[her]18-sara mamma]449-her mamma had seen [her]18-sara during the last half - hour , [she]449-her mamma might not have thought [her]18-sara the kind of child who ought to be related to [an angel]454-an angel .

[Sara]18-sara went on talking . Perhaps [some people]455-some people might think that what [she]18-sara said was rather like a fairy story , but it was all so real to [her]18-sara own imagination that [Lottie]31-lottie began to listen in spite of [herself]18-sara . [She]18-sara had been told that [[her]18-sara mamma]449-her mamma had wings and a crown , and [she]18-sara had been shown pictures of [ladies in beautiful white nightgowns , who were said to be angels]457-ladies in beautiful white nightgowns , who were said to be angels . But [Sara]18-sara seemed to be telling a real story about [a lovely country where [real people]459-real people were]458-a lovely country where real people were .

" There are fields and [fields of flowers]1977-fields of flowers , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , forgetting [herself]18-sara , as usual , when [she]18-sara began , and talking rather as if [she]18-sara were in a dream , " fields and [fields of lilies]1978-fields of lilies and when the soft wind blows over [them]1978-fields of lilies it wafts the scent of them into the air and [everybody]270-everybody always breathes it , because the soft wind is always blowing . And [little children]1980-little children run about in [the lily fields]1981-the lily fields and gather armfuls of [them]1981-the lily fields , and laugh and make little wreaths . And [the streets]1982-the streets are shining . And [people]157-people are never tired , however far [they]157-people walk . [They]157-people can float anywhere [they]157-people like . And there are walls made of pearl and gold all round [the city]1984-the city , but they are low enough for [the people]1985-the people to go and lean on [them]157-people , and look down onto the earth and smile , and send beautiful messages . "[18-sara]

Whatsoever story [she]18-sara had begun to tell , [Lottie]31-lottie would , no doubt , have stopped crying , and been fascinated into listening ; but there was no denying that this story was prettier than most others . [She]31-lottie dragged [herself]31-lottie close to [Sara]18-sara , and drank in every word until the end came far too soon . When it did come , [she]31-lottie was so sorry that [she]31-lottie put up [her]31-lottie lip ominously .

" [I]31-lottie want to go [there]207-there , "[31-lottie] [she]31-lottie cried . " [I]31-lottie have n't [any mamma in [this school]1988-this school]1987-any mamma in this school . "[31-lottie]

[Sara]18-sara saw the danger signal , and came out of [her]18-sara dream . [She]18-sara took hold of the chubby hand and pulled [her]31-lottie close to [her]18-sara side with a coaxing little laugh .

" [I]18-sara will be [[your]18-sara mamma]1989-your mamma , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " [We]1990-we will play that [you]18-sara are [[my]18-sara little girl]1991-my little girl . And [Emily]27-emily shall be [[your]18-sara sister]1992-your sister . "[18-sara]

[Lottie]31-lottie 's dimples all began to show [themselves]460-themselves .

" Shall [she]27-emily ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said .

" Yes , "[18-sara] answered [Sara]18-sara , jumping to [her]18-sara feet . " Let [us]1990-we go and tell [her]27-emily . And then [I]18-sara will wash [your]18-sara face and brush [your]18-sara hair . "[18-sara]

To which [Lottie]31-lottie agreed quite cheerfully , and trotted out of [the room]189-the room and [upstairs]266-upstairs with [her]18-sara , without seeming even to remember that the whole of the last hour 's tragedy had been caused by the fact that [she]18-sara had refused to be washed and brushed for lunch and [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin had been called in to use [her]22-miss minchin majestic authority .

And from that time [Sara]18-sara was [an adopted mother]463-an adopted mother .

5

[Becky]48-becky

Of course the greatest power [Sara]18-sara possessed and the one which gained [her]18-sara even more followers than [her]18-sara luxuries and the fact that [she]18-sara was " [the show pupil]1993-the show pupil , "[18-sara] the power that [Lavinia]30-lavinia and [certain other girls]464-certain other girls were most envious of , and at the same time most fascinated by in spite of [themselves]464-certain other girls , was [her]18-sara power of telling stories and of making everything [she]18-sara talked about seem like a story , whether it was one or not .

[Anyone who has been at school with [a teller of stories]466-a teller of stories]465-anyone who has been at school with a teller of stories knows what the wonder means how [he]467-he or [she]468-she is followed about and besought in a whisper to relate romances ; how [groups]469-groups gather round and hang on the outskirts of [the favored party]470-the favored party in the hope of being allowed to join in and listen . [Sara]18-sara not only could tell stories , but [she]18-sara adored telling them . When [she]18-sara sat or stood in the midst of a circle and began to invent wonderful things , [her]18-sara green eyes grew big and shining , [her]18-sara cheeks flushed , and , without knowing that [she]18-sara was doing it , [she]18-sara began to act and made what [she]18-sara told lovely or alarming by the raising or dropping of [her]18-sara voice , the bend and sway of [her]18-sara slim body , and the dramatic movement of [her]18-sara hands . [She]18-sara forgot that [she]18-sara was talking to [listening children]471-listening children ; [she]18-sara saw and lived with [the fairy folk]472-the fairy folk , or [the kings]473-the kings and [queens]474-queens and [beautiful ladies]475-beautiful ladies , whose adventures [she]18-sara was narrating . Sometimes when [she]18-sara had finished [her]18-sara story , [she]18-sara was quite out of breath with excitement , and would lay [her]18-sara hand on [her]18-sara thin , little , quick - rising chest , and half laugh as if at [herself]18-sara .

" When [I]18-sara am telling it , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara would say , " it does n't seem as if it was only made up . It seems more real than [you]1994-you are more real than [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom . [I]18-sara feel as if [I]18-sara were [all the people in the story one after the other]1996-all the people in the story one after the other . It is queer . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara had been at [[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's school]476-miss minchin 's school about two years when , one foggy winter 's afternoon , as [she]18-sara was getting out of [[her]18-sara carriage]477-her carriage , comfortably wrapped up in [her]18-sara warmest velvets and furs and looking very much grander than [she]18-sara knew , [she]18-sara caught sight , as [she]18-sara crossed [the pavement]478-the pavement , of [a dingy little figure standing on the area steps]479-a dingy little figure standing on the area steps , and stretching its neck so that its wide - open eyes might peer at [her]18-sara through the railings . Something in the eagerness and timidity of the smudgy face made [her]18-sara look at it , and when [she]18-sara looked [she]18-sara smiled because it was [her]18-sara way to smile at [people]157-people .

But [the owner of the smudgy face and the wide - open eyes]481-the owner of the smudgy face and the wide - open eyes evidently was afraid that [she]18-sara ought not to have been caught looking at [pupils of importance]482-pupils of importance . [She]18-sara dodged out of sight like [a jack - in - the - box]483-a jack - in - the - box and scurried back into [the kitchen]484-the kitchen , disappearing so suddenly that if [she]18-sara had not been such [a poor little forlorn thing]485-a poor little forlorn thing , [Sara]18-sara would have laughed in spite of [herself]18-sara . That very evening , as [Sara]18-sara was sitting in the midst of [a group of listeners in a corner of [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom]486-a group of listeners in a corner of the schoolroom telling one of [her]18-sara stories , [the very same figure]488-the very same figure timidly entered [the room]189-the room , carrying a coal box much too heavy for [her]18-sara , and knelt down upon the hearth rug to replenish the fire and sweep up the ashes .

[She]18-sara was cleaner than [she]18-sara had been when [she]18-sara peeped through the area railings , but [she]18-sara looked just as frightened . [She]18-sara was evidently afraid to look at [the children]490-the children or seem to be listening . [She]18-sara put on pieces of coal cautiously with [her]18-sara fingers so that [she]18-sara might make no disturbing noise , and [she]18-sara swept about the fire irons very softly . But [Sara]18-sara saw in two minutes that [she]18-sara was deeply interested in what was going on , and that [she]18-sara was doing [her]18-sara work slowly in the hope of catching a word here and there . And realizing this , [she]18-sara raised [her]18-sara voice and spoke more clearly .

" [The Mermaids]1997-the mermaids swam softly about in [the crystal - green water]1998-the crystal - green water , and dragged after [them]1997-the mermaids a fishing - net woven of deep - sea pearls , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " [The Princess]1999-the princess sat on the white rock and watched [them]1997-the mermaids . "[18-sara]

It was a wonderful story about [a princess who was loved by [a Prince Merman]492-a prince merman , and went to live with [him]492-a prince merman in [shining caves under [the sea]1880-the sea]493-shining caves under the sea]491-a princess who was loved by a prince merman , and went to live with him in shining caves under the sea .

The small drudge before the grate swept the hearth once and then swept it again . Having done it twice , [she]18-sara did it three times ; and , as [she]18-sara was doing it the third time , the sound of the story so lured [her]18-sara to listen that [she]18-sara fell under the spell and actually forgot that [she]18-sara had no right to listen at all , and also forgot everything else . [She]18-sara sat down upon [her]18-sara heels as [she]18-sara knelt on the hearth rug , and the brush hung idly in [her]18-sara fingers . The voice of [the storyteller]495-the storyteller went on and drew [her]18-sara with it into [winding grottos under [the sea]1880-the sea , glowing with soft , clear blue light , and paved with pure golden sands]496-winding grottos under the sea , glowing with soft , clear blue light , and paved with pure golden sands . Strange sea flowers and grasses waved about [her]18-sara , and far away faint singing and music echoed .

The hearth brush fell from the work - roughened hand , and [Lavinia Herbert]30-lavinia looked round .

" [That girl]2000-that girl has been listening , "[30-lavinia] [she]30-lavinia said .

[The culprit]498-the culprit snatched up [her]498-the culprit brush , and scrambled to [her]498-the culprit feet . [She]498-the culprit caught at the coal box and simply scuttled out of [the room]189-the room like a frightened rabbit .

[Sara]18-sara felt rather hot - tempered .

" [I]18-sara knew [she]2000-that girl was listening , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " Why should n't [she]2000-that girl ? "[18-sara]

[Lavinia]30-lavinia tossed [her]30-lavinia head with great elegance .

" Well , "[30-lavinia] [she]30-lavinia remarked , " [I]30-lavinia do not know whether [[your]18-sara mamma]1989-your mamma would like [you]18-sara to tell stories to [servant girls]2002-servant girls , but [I]30-lavinia know [[MY]30-lavinia mamma]1874-my mamma would n't like [ME]30-lavinia to do it . "[30-lavinia]

" [[My]18-sara mamma]1874-my mamma ! "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , looking odd . " [I]18-sara do n't believe [she]1874-my mamma would mind in the least . [She]1874-my mamma knows that stories belong to [everybody]270-everybody . "[18-sara]

" [I]30-lavinia thought , "[30-lavinia] retorted [Lavinia]30-lavinia , in severe recollection , " that [[your]18-sara mamma]1989-your mamma was dead . How can [she]1874-my mamma know things ? "[30-lavinia]

" Do [you]30-lavinia think [she]1874-my mamma DOESN'T know things ? "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , in [her]18-sara stern little voice . Sometimes [she]18-sara had a rather stern little voice .

" [[Sara]18-sara 's mamma]2007-sara 's mamma knows everything , "[31-lottie] piped in [Lottie]31-lottie . " So does [[my]31-lottie mamma]1874-my mamma ' cept [Sara]18-sara is [[my]31-lottie mamma]1874-my mamma at [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's [[my]31-lottie other one]2010-my other one knows everything . [The streets]1982-the streets are shining , and there are [fields]2012-fields and [fields of lilies]1978-fields of lilies , and [everybody]270-everybody gathers them . [Sara]18-sara tells [me]31-lottie when [she]18-sara puts [me]31-lottie to bed . "[31-lottie]

" [You]18-sara wicked thing , "[30-lavinia] said [Lavinia]30-lavinia , turning on [Sara]18-sara ; " making fairy stories about heaven . "[30-lavinia]

" There are much more splendid stories in [Revelation]49-revelation , "[18-sara] returned [Sara]18-sara . " Just look and see ! How do [you]2015-you know [mine]31-lottie are fairy stories ? But [I]18-sara can tell [you]2015-you "[18-sara] with a fine bit of unheavenly temper " [you]2015-you will never find out whether [they]2016-they are or not if [you]2015-you 're not kinder to [people]157-people than [you]2015-you are now . Come along , [Lottie]31-lottie . "[18-sara] And [she]18-sara marched out of [the room]189-the room , rather hoping that [she]18-sara might see [the little servant]501-the little servant again somewhere , but [she]18-sara found no trace of [her]501-the little servant when [she]18-sara got into [the hall]187-the hall .

" Who is that little girl who makes the fires ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara asked [Mariette]32-mariette that night .

[Mariette]32-mariette broke forth into a flow of description .

Ah , indeed , [Mademoiselle Sara]18-sara might well ask . [She]18-sara was [a forlorn little thing who had just taken the place of [scullery maid]504-scullery maid]503-a forlorn little thing who had just taken the place of scullery maid though , as to being [scullery maid]504-scullery maid , [she]18-sara was everything else besides . [She]18-sara blacked boots and grates , and carried heavy coal - scuttles up and down [stairs]506-stairs , and scrubbed floors and cleaned windows , and was ordered about by [everybody]270-everybody . [She]18-sara was fourteen years old , but was so stunted in growth that [she]18-sara looked about twelve . In truth , [Mariette]32-mariette was sorry for [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara was so timid that if [one]134-one chanced to speak to [her]18-sara it appeared as if [her]18-sara poor , frightened eyes would jump out of [her]18-sara head .

" What is [her]18-sara name ? "[18-sara] asked [Sara]18-sara , who had sat by the table , with [her]18-sara chin on [her]18-sara hands , as [she]18-sara listened absorbedly to the recital .

[Her]18-sara name was [Becky]48-becky . [Mariette]32-mariette heard [everyone below - stairs]509-everyone below - stairs calling , " [Becky]48-becky , do this , "[509-everyone below - stairs] and " [Becky]48-becky , do that , "[509-everyone below - stairs] every five minutes in the day .

[Sara]18-sara sat and looked into the fire , reflecting on [Becky]48-becky for some time after [Mariette]32-mariette left [her]18-sara . [She]32-mariette made up a story of which [Becky]48-becky was [the ill - used heroine]510-the ill - used heroine . [She]32-mariette thought [she]48-becky looked as if [she]48-becky had never had quite enough to eat . [Her]48-becky very eyes were hungry . [She]32-mariette hoped [she]32-mariette should see [her]18-sara again , but though [she]32-mariette caught sight of [her]18-sara carrying things up or down [stairs]506-stairs on several occasions , [she]18-sara always seemed in such a hurry and so afraid of being seen that it was impossible to speak to [her]18-sara .

But a few weeks later , on another foggy afternoon , when [she]32-mariette entered [[her]32-mariette sitting room]258-her sitting room [she]32-mariette found [herself]32-mariette confronting a rather pathetic picture . In [[her]32-mariette own special and pet easy - chair before the bright fire]513-her own special and pet easy - chair before the bright fire , [Becky]48-becky with a coal smudge on [her]32-mariette nose and several on [her]32-mariette apron , with [her]32-mariette poor little cap hanging half off [her]32-mariette head , and an empty coal box on the floor near [her]32-mariette sat fast asleep , tired out beyond even the endurance of [her]32-mariette hard - working young body . [She]32-mariette had been sent up to put [the bedrooms]514-the bedrooms in order for the evening . There were a great many of [them]514-the bedrooms , and [she]32-mariette had been running about all day . [[Sara]18-sara 's rooms [she]32-mariette had saved until the last]515-sara 's rooms she had saved until the last . They were not like [the other rooms]516-the other rooms , which were plain and bare . [Ordinary pupils]517-ordinary pupils were expected to be satisfied with mere necessaries . [[Sara]18-sara 's comfortable sitting room]518-sara 's comfortable sitting room seemed a bower of luxury to [the scullery maid]519-the scullery maid , though [it]518-sara 's comfortable sitting room was , in fact , merely [a nice , bright little room]520-a nice , bright little room . But there were pictures and books in [it]518-sara 's comfortable sitting room , and curious things from [India]3-india ; there was a sofa and the low , soft chair ; [Emily]27-emily sat in a chair of [her]27-emily own , with the air of [a presiding goddess]521-a presiding goddess , and there was always a glowing fire and a polished grate . [Becky]48-becky saved it until the end of [her]48-becky afternoon 's work , because it rested [her]48-becky to go into it , and [she]48-becky always hoped to snatch a few minutes to sit down in the soft chair and look about [her]48-becky , and think about the wonderful good fortune of [the child who owned such surroundings]522-the child who owned such surroundings and who went out on the cold days in beautiful hats and [coats one]523-coats one tried to catch a glimpse of through the area railing .

On this afternoon , when [she]32-mariette had sat down , the sensation of relief to [her]32-mariette short , aching legs had been so wonderful and delightful that it had seemed to soothe [her]32-mariette whole body , and the glow of warmth and comfort from the fire had crept over [her]32-mariette like a spell , until , as [she]32-mariette looked at the red coals , a tired , slow smile stole over [her]32-mariette smudged face , [her]32-mariette head nodded forward without [her]32-mariette being aware of it , [her]32-mariette eyes drooped , and [she]32-mariette fell fast asleep . [She]32-mariette had really been only about ten minutes in [the room]189-the room when [Sara]18-sara entered , but [she]32-mariette was in as deep a sleep as if [she]32-mariette had been , like [the Sleeping Beauty]525-the sleeping beauty , slumbering for a hundred years . But [she]32-mariette did not look poor [Becky]48-becky like [a Sleeping Beauty]526-a sleeping beauty at all . [She]32-mariette looked only like [an ugly , stunted , worn - out little scullery drudge]527-an ugly , stunted , worn - out little scullery drudge .

[Sara]18-sara seemed as much unlike [her]18-sara as if [she]18-sara were a creature from [another world]528-another world .

On this particular afternoon [she]32-mariette had been taking [her]32-mariette dancing lesson , and the afternoon on which [the dancing master]529-the dancing master appeared was rather a grand occasion at [the seminary]205-the seminary , though it occurred every week . [The pupils]294-the pupils were attired in [their]294-the pupils prettiest frocks , and as [Sara]18-sara danced particularly well , [she]18-sara was very much brought forward , and [Mariette]32-mariette was requested to make [her]18-sara as diaphanous and fine as possible .

Today a frock the color of a rose had been put on [her]18-sara , and [Mariette]32-mariette had bought some real buds and made [her]18-sara a wreath to wear on [her]18-sara black locks . [She]18-sara had been learning a new , delightful dance in which [she]18-sara had been skimming and flying about [the room]189-the room , like a large rose - colored butterfly , and the enjoyment and exercise had brought a brilliant , happy glow into [her]18-sara face .

When [she]18-sara entered [the room]189-the room , [she]18-sara floated in with a few of the butterfly steps and there sat [Becky]48-becky , nodding [her]48-becky cap sideways off [her]48-becky head .

" Oh ! "[18-sara] cried [Sara]18-sara , softly , when [she]18-sara saw [her]48-becky . " That poor thing ! "[18-sara]

It did not occur to [her]18-sara to feel cross at finding [her]18-sara pet chair occupied by the small , dingy figure . To tell the truth , [she]18-sara was quite glad to find it there . When [the ill - used heroine of [her]18-sara story]534-the ill - used heroine of her story wakened , [she]18-sara could talk to [her]48-becky . [She]18-sara crept toward [her]48-becky quietly , and stood looking at [her]48-becky . [Becky]48-becky gave a little snore .

" [I]18-sara wish [she]48-becky 'd waken [herself]48-becky , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara said . " [I]18-sara do n't like to waken [her]48-becky . But [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin would be cross if [she]48-becky found out . [I]18-sara 'll just wait a few minutes . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara took a seat on the edge of the table , and sat swinging [her]18-sara slim , rose - colored legs , and wondering what it would be best to do . [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin might come in at any moment , and if [she]22-miss minchin did , [Becky]48-becky would be sure to be scolded .

" But [she]48-becky is so tired , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara thought . " [She]48-becky is so tired ! "[18-sara]

A piece of flaming coal ended [her]18-sara perplexity for [her]18-sara that very moment . It broke off from a large lump and fell on to the fender . [Becky]48-becky started , and opened [her]48-becky eyes with a frightened gasp . [She]48-becky did not know [she]48-becky had fallen asleep . [She]48-becky had only sat down for one moment and felt the beautiful glow and here [she]48-becky found [herself]48-becky staring in wild alarm at the wonderful pupil , who sat perched quite near [her]48-becky , like a rose - colored fairy , with interested eyes .

[She]18-sara sprang up and clutched at [her]18-sara cap . [She]18-sara felt it dangling over [her]18-sara ear , and tried wildly to put it straight . Oh , [she]18-sara had got [herself]18-sara into trouble now with a vengeance ! To have impudently fallen asleep on [such a young lady]535-such a young lady 's chair ! [She]18-sara would be turned out of doors without wages .

[She]18-sara made a sound like a big breathless sob .

" Oh , [miss]2018-miss ! Oh , [miss]2018-miss ! "[18-sara] [she]18-sara stuttered . " [I]18-sara arst [yer]2018-miss pardon , [miss]2018-miss ! Oh , [I]18-sara do , [miss]2018-miss ! "[18-sara]

[Sara]18-sara jumped down , and came quite close to [her]18-sara .

" Do n't be frightened , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , quite as if [she]18-sara had been speaking to [a little girl like [herself]18-sara]536-a little girl like herself . " It does n't matter the least bit . "[18-sara]

" [I]48-becky did n't go to do it , [miss]2018-miss , "[48-becky] protested [Becky]48-becky . " It was the warm fire an ' [me]48-becky bein ' so tired . It it WASN'T impertience ! "[48-becky]

[Sara]18-sara broke into a friendly little laugh , and put [her]18-sara hand on [her]18-sara shoulder .

" [You]48-becky were tired , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said ; " [you]48-becky could not help it . [You]48-becky are not really awake yet . "[18-sara]

How poor [Becky]48-becky stared at [her]18-sara ! In fact , [she]48-becky had never heard such a nice , friendly sound in [anyone]1925-anyone 's voice before . [She]48-becky was used to being ordered about and scolded , and having [her]48-becky ears boxed . " Ai n't ai n't [yer]18-sara angry , [miss]2018-miss ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara gasped . " Ai n't [yer]18-sara goin' to tell [the missus]2024-the missus ? "[18-sara]

6

[The Diamond Mines]6-the diamond mines

Not very long after this a very exciting thing happened . Not only [Sara]18-sara , but [the entire school]338-the entire school , found it exciting , and made it the chief subject of conversation for weeks after it occurred . In one of [his]543-he letters [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe told a most interesting story . [A friend who had been at [school]164-school with [him]543-he when [he]543-he was [a boy]1918-a boy]544-a friend who had been at school with him when he was a boy had unexpectedly come to see [him]543-he in [India]3-india . [He]543-he was [the owner of [a large tract of land upon which diamonds had been found]548-a large tract of land upon which diamonds had been found]547-the owner of a large tract of land upon which diamonds had been found , and [he]543-he was engaged in developing [the mines]549-the mines . If all went as was confidently expected , [he]543-he would become possessed of such wealth as it made [one]134-one dizzy to think of ; and because [he]543-he was fond of [the friend of [his]543-he school]551-the friend of his school days , [he]543-he had given [him]551-the friend of his school an opportunity to share in this enormous fortune by becoming [a partner in [his]543-he scheme]552-a partner in his scheme . This , at least , was what [Sara]18-sara gathered from [his]543-he letters . It is true that any other business scheme , however magnificent , would have had but small attraction for [her]18-sara or for [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom ; but " [diamond mines]2060-diamond mines "[543-he] sounded so like the Arabian Nights that [no one]1828-no one could be indifferent . [Sara]18-sara thought them enchanting , and painted pictures , for [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde and [Lottie]31-lottie , of labyrinthine passages in [the bowels of [the earth]556-the earth]555-the bowels of the earth , where sparkling stones studded the walls and roofs and ceilings , and [strange , dark men]557-strange , dark men dug them out with heavy picks . [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde delighted in the story , and [Lottie]31-lottie insisted on its being retold to [her]31-lottie every evening . [Lavinia]30-lavinia was very spiteful about it , and told [Jessie]33-jessie that [she]30-lavinia did n't believe such things as diamond mines existed .

" [[My]30-lavinia mamma]1874-my mamma has a diamond ring which cost forty pounds , "[30-lavinia] [she]30-lavinia said . " And it is not a big one , either . If there were [mines full of diamonds]2062-mines full of diamonds , [people]157-people would be so rich it would be ridiculous . "[30-lavinia]

" Perhaps [Sara]18-sara will be so rich that [she]18-sara will be ridiculous , "[33-jessie] giggled [Jessie]33-jessie .

" [She]18-sara 's ridiculous without being rich , "[30-lavinia] [Lavinia]30-lavinia sniffed .

" [I]33-jessie believe [you]30-lavinia hate [her]18-sara , "[33-jessie] said [Jessie]33-jessie .

" No , [I]30-lavinia do n't , "[30-lavinia] snapped [Lavinia]30-lavinia . " But [I]30-lavinia do n't believe in mines full of diamonds . "[30-lavinia]

" Well , [people]157-people have to get them from somewhere , "[33-jessie] said [Jessie]33-jessie . " [Lavinia]30-lavinia , "[33-jessie] with a new giggle , " what do [you]30-lavinia think [Gertrude]51-gertrude says ? "[33-jessie]

" [I]30-lavinia do n't know , [I]30-lavinia 'm sure ; and [I]30-lavinia do n't care if it 's something more about that everlasting [Sara]18-sara . "[30-lavinia]

" Well , it is . One of [her]18-sara ' pretends ' is that [she]18-sara is [a princess]2033-a princess . [She]18-sara plays it all the time even in [school]164-school . " [She]18-sara says it has nothing to do with what [you]2067-you look like , or what [you]2067-you have . It has only to do with what [you]2067-you THINK of , and what [you]2067-you DO . "[33-jessie]

Lessons for the day were over , and [they]558-they were sitting before the schoolroom fire , enjoying the time [they]558-they liked best . [She]18-sara was so far away from [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom that it was not agreeable to be dragged back suddenly by a howl from [Lottie]31-lottie . "[30-lavinia]

[Sara]18-sara started toward [her]30-lavinia . [She]18-sara looked as if [she]18-sara were going to box [her]18-sara ears . Perhaps [she]18-sara was . [Her]30-lavinia trick of pretending things was the joy of [her]30-lavinia life . [She]30-lavinia never spoke of it to girls [she]30-lavinia was not fond of . [Her]30-lavinia new " pretend "[30-lavinia] about being [a princess]2033-a princess was very near to [her]30-lavinia heart , and [she]30-lavinia was shy and sensitive about it . [She]30-lavinia had meant it to be rather a secret , and here was [Lavinia]30-lavinia deriding it before nearly all [the school]349-the school . [She]30-lavinia felt the blood rush up into [her]30-lavinia face and tingle in [her]30-lavinia ears . [She]30-lavinia only just saved [herself]30-lavinia . If [you]580-you were [a princess]2033-a princess , [you]580-you did not fly into rages . [Her]30-lavinia hand dropped , and [she]30-lavinia stood quite still a moment . When [she]30-lavinia spoke it was in a quiet , steady voice ; [she]30-lavinia held [her]30-lavinia head up , and [everybody]270-everybody listened to [her]30-lavinia .

" It 's true , "[30-lavinia] [she]30-lavinia said . " Sometimes [I]30-lavinia do pretend [I]30-lavinia am [a princess]2033-a princess . [I]30-lavinia pretend [I]30-lavinia am [a princess]2033-a princess , so that [I]30-lavinia can try and behave like [one]134-one . "[30-lavinia]

[Lavinia]30-lavinia could not think of exactly the right thing to say . Several times [she]30-lavinia had found that [she]30-lavinia could not think of a satisfactory reply when [she]30-lavinia was dealing with [Sara]18-sara . The reason for this was that , somehow , the rest always seemed to be vaguely in sympathy with [[her]30-lavinia opponent]583-her opponent . [She]30-lavinia saw now that [they]584-they were pricking up [their]584-they ears interestedly . The truth was , [they]584-they liked [princesses]2083-princesses , and [they]584-they all hoped [they]584-they might hear something more definite about [this one]586-this one , and drew nearer [Sara]18-sara accordingly .

[Lavinia]30-lavinia could only invent one remark , and it fell rather flat .

" Dear [me]30-lavinia , "[30-lavinia] [she]30-lavinia said , " [I]30-lavinia hope , when [you]2091-you ascend the throne , [you]2091-you wo n't forget [us]2092-us ! "[30-lavinia]

" [I]18-sara wo n't , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , and [she]18-sara did not utter another word , but stood quite still , and stared at [her]18-sara steadily as [she]18-sara saw [her]18-sara take [Jessie]33-jessie 's arm and turn away .

After this , [the girls who were jealous of [her]18-sara]587-the girls who were jealous of her used to speak of [her]18-sara as " [Princess Sara]18-sara "[587-the girls who were jealous of her] whenever [they]587-the girls who were jealous of her wished to be particularly disdainful , and [those who were fond of [her]18-sara]588-those who were fond of her gave [her]18-sara the name among [themselves]588-those who were fond of her as a term of affection . [No one]1828-no one called [her]18-sara " [princess]2093-princess "[18-sara] instead of " [Sara]18-sara , "[18-sara] but [[her]18-sara adorers]590-her adorers were much pleased with the picturesqueness and grandeur of the title , and [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin , hearing of it , mentioned it more than once to [visiting parents]591-visiting parents , feeling that it rather suggested [a sort of royal boarding school]592-a sort of royal boarding school .

To [Becky]48-becky it seemed the most appropriate thing in [the world]137-the world . The acquaintance begun on the foggy afternoon when [she]18-sara had jumped up terrified from [her]18-sara sleep in the comfortable chair , had ripened and grown , though it must be confessed that [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin and [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin knew very little about it . [They]590-her adorers were aware that [Sara]18-sara was " kind "[18-sara] to [the scullery maid]519-the scullery maid , but [they]590-her adorers knew nothing of certain delightful moments snatched perilously when , the [upstairs rooms]595-upstairs rooms being set in order with lightning rapidity , [[Sara]18-sara 's sitting room]596-sara 's sitting room was reached , and the heavy coal box set down with a sigh of joy . At such times stories were told by installments , things of a satisfying nature were either produced and eaten or hastily tucked into pockets to be disposed of at night , when [Becky]48-becky went [upstairs]266-upstairs to [[her]48-becky attic]598-her attic to bed .

" But [I]48-becky has to eat 'em careful , [miss]2018-miss , "[48-becky] [she]48-becky said once ; " 'cos if [I]48-becky leaves crumbs the rats come out to get 'em . "[48-becky]

" [Rats]2095-rats ! "[18-sara] exclaimed [Sara]18-sara , in horror . " Are there [RATS]54-rats [there]207-there ? "[18-sara]

" Lots of 'em , [miss]2018-miss , "[48-becky] [Becky]48-becky answered in quite a matter - of - fact manner . " There mostly is rats an ' mice in [attics]2098-attics . "[48-becky]

" Ugh ! "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara .

" [You]2099-you gets used to anythin ' after a bit , "[48-becky] said [Becky]48-becky . " [You]2099-you have to , [miss]2018-miss , if [you]2099-you 're born [a scullery maid]2101-a scullery maid . [I]48-becky 'd rather have rats than cockroaches . "[48-becky]

" So would [I]18-sara , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara ; " [I]18-sara suppose [you]48-becky might make [friends]1940-friends with a rat in time , but [I]18-sara do n't believe [I]18-sara should like to make [friends with a cockroach]2103-friends with a cockroach . "[18-sara]

Sometimes [Becky]48-becky did not dare to spend more than a few minutes in [the bright , warm room]599-the bright , warm room , and when this was the case perhaps only a few words could be exchanged , and a small purchase slipped into the old - fashioned pocket [Becky]48-becky carried under [her]48-becky dress skirt , tied round [her]48-becky waist with a band of tape . The search for and discovery of satisfying things to eat which could be packed into small compass , added a new interest to [Sara]18-sara 's existence . When [she]18-sara drove or walked out , [she]18-sara used to look into shop windows eagerly . The first time it occurred to [her]18-sara to bring [home]437-home two or three little meat pies , [she]18-sara felt that [she]18-sara had hit upon a discovery . When [she]18-sara exhibited them , [Becky]48-becky 's eyes quite sparkled .

" Oh , [miss]2018-miss ! "[18-sara] [she]18-sara murmured . " [Them]2105-them will be nice an ' fillin . ' It 's fillin'ness that 's best . Sponge cake 's a ' evenly thing , but it melts away like if [you]2018-miss understand , [miss]2018-miss . These 'll just STAY in [yer]2018-miss stummick . "[18-sara]

" Well , "[18-sara] hesitated [Sara]18-sara , " [I]18-sara do n't think it would be good if [they]2105-them stayed always , but [I]18-sara do believe they will be satisfying . "[18-sara]

They were satisfying and so were beef sandwiches , bought at [a cook - shop]601-a cook - shop and so were rolls and Bologna sausage . In time , [Becky]48-becky began to lose [her]48-becky hungry , tired feeling , and the coal box did not seem so unbearably heavy .

However heavy it was , and whatsoever the temper of [the cook]2053-the cook , and the hardness of the work heaped upon [her]18-sara shoulders , [she]18-sara had always the chance of the afternoon to look forward to the chance that [Miss Sara]18-sara would be able to be in [[her]18-sara sitting room]258-her sitting room . In fact , the mere seeing of [Miss Sara]18-sara would have been enough without meat pies . If there was time only for a few words , they were always friendly , merry words that put heart into one ; and if there was time for more , then there was an installment of a story to be told , or some other thing [one]134-one remembered afterward and sometimes lay awake in [one]134-one 's bed in [the attic]606-the attic to think over . [Sara]18-sara who was only doing what [she]18-sara unconsciously liked better than anything else , [Nature]56-nature having made [her]18-sara for [a giver]607-a giver had not the least idea what [she]18-sara meant to [poor [Becky]48-becky]608-poor becky , and how wonderful [a benefactor]609-a benefactor [she]18-sara seemed . If [Nature]56-nature has made [you]610-your for [a giver]607-a giver , [your]610-your hands are born open , and so is [your]610-your heart ; and though there may be times when [your]610-your hands are empty , [your]610-your heart is always full , and [you]610-your can give things out of that warm things , kind things , sweet things help and comfort and laughter and sometimes gay , kind laughter is the best help of all .

[Becky]48-becky had scarcely known what laughter was through all [her]48-becky poor , little hard - driven life . [Sara]18-sara made [her]48-becky laugh , and laughed with [her]48-becky ; and , though neither of [them]612-them quite knew it , the laughter was as " fillin ' "[18-sara] as the meat pies .

A few weeks before [Sara]18-sara 's eleventh birthday a letter came to [her]18-sara from [[her]18-sara father]129-her father , which did not seem to be written in such boyish high spirits as usual . [He]129-her father was not very well , and was evidently overweighted by the business connected with [the diamond mines]614-the diamond mines .

" [You]18-sara see , [little Sara]18-sara , "[129-her father] [he]129-her father wrote , " [[your]18-sara daddy]1862-your daddy is not [a businessman]2108-a businessman at all , and figures and documents bother [him]129-her father . [He]129-her father does not really understand them , and all this seems so enormous . Perhaps , if [I]129-her father was not feverish [I]129-her father should not be awake , tossing about , one half of the night and spend the other half in troublesome dreams . If [[my]129-her father little missus]2109-my little missus were here , [I]129-her father dare say [she]2109-my little missus would give [me]129-her father some solemn , good advice . [You]18-sara would , would n't [you]18-sara , [Little Missus]57-little missus ? "[129-her father]

One of [his]129-her father many jokes had been to call [her]615-her [his]129-her father " little missus "[615-her] because [she]615-her had such an old - fashioned air .

[He]129-her father had made wonderful preparations for [her]615-her birthday . Among other things , a new doll had been ordered in [Paris]7-paris , and [her]615-her wardrobe was to be , indeed , a marvel of splendid perfection . When [she]615-her had replied to the letter asking [her]615-her if the doll would be an acceptable present , [Sara]18-sara had been very quaint .

" [I]18-sara am getting very old , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara wrote ; " [you]18-sara see , [I]18-sara shall never live to have another doll given [me]18-sara . This will be [my]18-sara last doll . There is something solemn about it . If [I]18-sara could write poetry , [I]18-sara am sure a poem about ' [A Last Doll]2110-a last doll ' would be very nice . But [I]18-sara can not write poetry . [I]18-sara have tried , and it made [me]18-sara laugh . It did not sound like [Watts]58-watts or [Coleridge]59-coleridge or Shakespeare at all . [No one]1828-no one could ever take [Emily]27-emily 's place , but [I]18-sara should respect the Last Doll very much ; and [I]18-sara am sure [the school]349-the school would love it . [They]349-the school all like [dolls]1886-dolls , though some of [the big ones]2114-the big ones [the almost fifteen ones]2115-the almost fifteen ones pretend [they]2115-the almost fifteen ones are too grown up . "[18-sara]

[Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe had a splitting headache when [he]19-captain crewe read this letter in [[his]19-captain crewe bungalow in [India]3-india]616-his bungalow in india . " Oh , "[19-captain crewe] [he]19-captain crewe said , ' [she]617-she 's better fun every year [she]617-she lives . What would n't [I]0-i give to have [her]617-she little arms round [my]0-i neck this minute ! What WOULDN'T [I]0-i give ! "[0-i]

The birthday was to be celebrated by great festivities . [The schoolroom]269-the schoolroom was to be decorated , and there was to be a party . The boxes containing the presents were to be opened with great ceremony , and there was to be a glittering feast spread in [[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's sacred room]620-miss minchin 's sacred room . When the day arrived [the whole house]1867-the whole house was in a whirl of excitement . How the morning passed [nobody]622-nobody quite knew , because there seemed such preparations to be made . [The schoolroom]269-the schoolroom was being decked with garlands of holly ; the desks had been moved away , and red covers had been put on the forms which were arrayed round [the room]189-the room against the wall .

When [Sara]18-sara went into [[her]18-sara sitting room]258-her sitting room in the morning , [she]18-sara found on the table a small , dumpy package , tied up in a piece of brown paper . [She]18-sara knew it was a present , and [she]18-sara thought [she]18-sara could guess whom it came from . [She]18-sara opened it quite tenderly . It was a square pincushion , made of not quite clean red flannel , and black pins had been stuck carefully into it to form the words , " [Menny hapy]2116-menny hapy returns . "[18-sara]

" Oh ! "[18-sara] cried [Sara]18-sara , with a warm feeling in [her]18-sara heart . " What pains [she]48-becky has taken ! [I]18-sara like it so , it it makes [me]18-sara feel sorrowful . "[18-sara]

" [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin ! "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said to [herself]18-sara " How CAN it be ! "[18-sara]

" Now , [young ladies]184-young ladies , [I]22-miss minchin have a few words to say to [you]184-young ladies , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin announced .

[Sara]18-sara felt rather uncomfortable . As this was [her]18-sara party , it was probable that the speech was about [her]18-sara . It is not agreeable to stand in [a schoolroom]646-a schoolroom and have a speech made about [you]647-you .

" The diamond mines , "[33-jessie] giggled [Jessie]33-jessie , in a whisper .

" When [[her]18-sara dear papa]2139-her dear papa , [Captain Crewe]19-captain crewe , brought [her]18-sara from [India]3-india and gave [her]18-sara into [my]22-miss minchin care , "[22-miss minchin] the speech proceeded , " [he]19-captain crewe said to [me]22-miss minchin , in a jesting way , ' [I]22-miss minchin am afraid [she]18-sara will be very rich , [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . ' [Sara]18-sara has become [[my]22-miss minchin most accomplished pupil]2141-my most accomplished pupil . [Her]18-sara French and [her]18-sara dancing are a credit to [the seminary]205-the seminary . " This moment ! "[22-miss minchin] was the fierce answer . " Do n't sit staring like a goose . Go ! "[22-miss minchin]

[Poor Miss Amelia]69-poor miss amelia was accustomed to being called a goose . [She]69-poor miss amelia knew , in fact , that [she]69-poor miss amelia was rather a goose , and that it was left to geese to do a great many disagreeable things . It was a somewhat embarrassing thing to go into the midst of [a room full of [delighted children]689-delighted children]688-a room full of delighted children , and tell [the giver of the feast]690-the giver of the feast that [she]69-poor miss amelia had suddenly been transformed into [a little beggar]691-a little beggar , and must go [upstairs]266-upstairs and put on an old black frock which was too small for [her]69-poor miss amelia . But the thing must be done . This was evidently not the time when questions might be asked .

[She]69-poor miss amelia rubbed [her]69-poor miss amelia eyes with [her]69-poor miss amelia handkerchief until they looked quite red . After which [she]69-poor miss amelia got up and went out of [the room]189-the room , without venturing to say another word . When [[her]69-poor miss amelia older sister]694-her older sister looked and spoke as [she]694-her older sister had done just now , the wisest course to pursue was to obey orders without any comment . [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin walked across [the room]189-the room . [She]22-miss minchin spoke to [herself]22-miss minchin aloud without knowing that [she]22-miss minchin was doing it . During the last year the story of [the diamond mines]614-the diamond mines had suggested all sorts of possibilities to [her]22-miss minchin . [Even proprietors of [seminaries]698-seminaries]697-even proprietors of seminaries might make fortunes in stocks , with the aid of [owners of mines]699-owners of mines . And now , instead of looking forward to gains , [she]22-miss minchin was left to look back upon losses .

" [The Princess Sara]18-sara , indeed ! "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said . " [The child]261-the child has been pampered as if [she]261-the child were [a QUEEN]415-a queen . "[22-miss minchin] [She]22-miss minchin was sweeping angrily past the corner table as [she]22-miss minchin said it , and the next moment [she]22-miss minchin started at the sound of a loud , sobbing sniff which issued from under the cover .

" What is that ! "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin exclaimed angrily . The loud , sobbing sniff was heard again , and [she]22-miss minchin stooped and raised the hanging folds of the table cover .

" How DARE [you]22-miss minchin ! "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin cried out . " How dare [you]22-miss minchin ! Come out immediately ! "[22-miss minchin]

It was poor [Becky]48-becky who crawled out , and [her]48-becky cap was knocked on one side , and [her]48-becky face was red with repressed crying .

" If [you]22-miss minchin please , ' m it 's [me]22-miss minchin , [mum]2218-mum , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin explained . " [I]22-miss minchin know [I]22-miss minchin had n't ought to . "[702-the very scullery maid]

" It 's exactly like the ones in the stories , "[48-becky] [she]48-becky wailed . " Them pore princess ones that was drove into [the world]137-the world . "[48-becky]

[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin had never looked quite so still and hard as [she]22-miss minchin did when [Sara]18-sara came to [her]22-miss minchin , a few hours later , in response to a message [she]18-sara had sent [her]22-miss minchin .

Even by that time it seemed to [Sara]18-sara as if the birthday party had either been a dream or a thing which had happened years ago , and had happened in the life of [quite another little girl]706-quite another little girl .

Every sign of the festivities had been swept away ; the holly had been removed from [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom walls , and the forms and desks put back into their places . [[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's sitting room]708-miss minchin 's sitting room looked as it always did all traces of the feast were gone , and [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin had resumed [her]22-miss minchin usual dress . " Tell [Sara]18-sara to come to [[my]22-miss minchin room]1921-my room , "[22-miss minchin] [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin had said to [[her]22-miss minchin sister]260-her sister . " [Sister]1865-sister , "[22-miss minchin] replied [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin , ' [she]260-her sister is [the strangest child [I]0-i ever saw]712-the strangest child i ever saw . [Her]260-her sister eyes seemed to get bigger and bigger , and [she]260-her sister went quite pale . [Several of [the other children]717-the other children]716-several of the other children began to cry , but [she]260-her sister did not seem to hear [them]716-several of the other children or to be alive to anything but just what [I]0-i was saying . "[157-people]

Nobody but [Sara]18-sara [herself]18-sara ever knew what had happened in [[her]18-sara room]1957-her room after [she]18-sara had run [upstairs]266-upstairs and locked [her]18-sara door . In fact , [she]18-sara [herself]18-sara scarcely remembered anything but that [she]18-sara walked up and down , saying over and over again to [herself]18-sara in a voice which did not seem [her]18-sara own , " [[My]18-sara papa]2236-my papa is dead ! [[My]18-sara papa]2236-my papa is dead ! "[18-sara]

Once [she]18-sara stopped before [Emily]27-emily , who sat watching [her]18-sara from [her]27-emily chair , and cried out wildly , " [Emily]27-emily ! Do [you]27-emily hear ? Do [you]27-emily hear [papa]1809-papa is dead ? [He]1809-papa is dead in [India]3-india thousands of miles away . "[18-sara]

When [she]18-sara came into [[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's sitting room]708-miss minchin 's sitting room in answer to [her]22-miss minchin summons , [her]18-sara face was white and [her]18-sara eyes had dark rings around them . [Her]18-sara mouth was set as if [she]18-sara did not wish it to reveal what [she]18-sara had suffered and was suffering . [She]18-sara did not look in the least like [the rose - colored butterfly child who had flown about from one of [[her]18-sara treasures]724-her treasures to the other in [the decorated schoolroom]725-the decorated schoolroom]723-the rose - colored butterfly child who had flown about from one of her treasures to the other in the decorated schoolroom . [She]18-sara looked instead a strange , desolate , almost grotesque little figure .

[She]18-sara had put on , without [Mariette]32-mariette 's help , the cast - aside black - velvet frock . It was too short and tight , and [her]18-sara slender legs looked long and thin , showing themselves from beneath the brief skirt . As [she]18-sara had not found a piece of black ribbon , [her]18-sara short , thick , black hair tumbled loosely about [her]18-sara face and contrasted strongly with its pallor . [She]18-sara held [Emily]27-emily tightly in one arm , and [Emily]27-emily was swathed in a piece of black material .

" Put down [your]18-sara doll , "[22-miss minchin] said [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . " What do [you]18-sara mean by bringing [her]18-sara [here]1824-here ? "[22-miss minchin]

" No , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara answered . " [I]18-sara will not put [her]18-sara down . [She]18-sara is all [I]18-sara have . [[My]18-sara papa]2236-my papa gave [her]18-sara to [me]18-sara . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara had always made [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin feel secretly uncomfortable , and [she]18-sara did so now . [She]18-sara did not speak with rudeness so much as with a cold steadiness with which [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin felt it difficult to cope perhaps because [she]22-miss minchin knew [she]22-miss minchin was doing a heartless and inhuman thing .

" [You]18-sara will have no time for dolls in future , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said . " [You]18-sara will have to work and improve [yourself]18-sara and make [yourself]18-sara useful . "[22-miss minchin]

[Sara]18-sara kept [her]18-sara big , strange eyes fixed on [her]22-miss minchin , and said not a word .

" Everything will be very different now , "[22-miss minchin] [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin went on . " [I]22-miss minchin suppose [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin has explained matters to [you]18-sara . "[22-miss minchin]

"[22-miss minchin]

" [I]18-sara understand , "[18-sara] answered [Sara]18-sara , in a low tone ; and there was a sound as if [she]18-sara had gulped down something which rose in [her]18-sara throat . " [I]18-sara understand . "[18-sara]

If [she]18-sara had cried and sobbed and seemed frightened , [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin might almost have had more patience with [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara was [a woman who liked to domineer and feel [her]18-sara power]726-a woman who liked to domineer and feel her power , and as [she]18-sara looked at [Sara]18-sara 's pale little steadfast face and heard [her]22-miss minchin proud little voice , [she]18-sara quite felt as if [her]22-miss minchin might was being set at naught .

" Do n't put on grand airs , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " The time for that sort of thing is past . [You]18-sara are not [a princess]2033-a princess any longer . [Sara]18-sara stood still just a moment , looking at [her]22-miss minchin . In [her]18-sara young soul , [she]18-sara was thinking deep and strange things . Then [she]18-sara turned to leave [the room]189-the room .

[Sara]18-sara paused , and all the deep , strange thoughts surged up in [her]18-sara breast .

[Sara]18-sara made two or three steps toward [her]22-miss minchin . [Her]22-miss minchin thin little chest heaved up and down , and [she]22-miss minchin spoke in a strange un - childishly fierce way .

" [You]18-sara are not kind , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said . " [You]18-sara are NOT kind , and it is NOT [a home]2257-a home . "[22-miss minchin] And [she]22-miss minchin had turned and run out of [the room]189-the room before [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin could stop [her]22-miss minchin or do anything but stare after [her]22-miss minchin with stony anger .

[She]22-miss minchin went up the stairs slowly , but panting for breath and [she]22-miss minchin held [Emily]27-emily tightly against [her]22-miss minchin side .

" [I]22-miss minchin wish [she]27-emily could talk , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said to [herself]22-miss minchin . " If [she]27-emily could speak if [she]27-emily could speak ! "[22-miss minchin]

[She]22-miss minchin meant to go to [[her]22-miss minchin room]1957-her room and lie down on the tiger - skin , with [her]22-miss minchin cheek upon the great cat 's head , and look into the fire and think and think and think . But just before [she]22-miss minchin reached [the landing]731-the landing [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin came out of the door and closed it behind [her]22-miss minchin , and stood before it , looking nervous and awkward . The truth was that [she]22-miss minchin felt secretly ashamed of the thing [she]22-miss minchin had been ordered to do .

" [You]18-sara [you]18-sara are not to go in [there]207-there , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said .

" Not go in ? "[18-sara] exclaimed [Sara]18-sara , and [she]18-sara fell back a pace .

" That is not [[your]18-sara room]2211-your room now , "[22-miss minchin] [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin answered , reddening a little .

Somehow , all at once , [Sara]18-sara understood . [She]18-sara realized that this was the beginning of the change [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin had spoken of .

" Where is [[my]18-sara room]1921-my room ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara asked , hoping very much that [her]18-sara voice did not shake .

" [You]18-sara are to sleep in [the attic next to [Becky]48-becky]2262-the attic next to becky . "[18-sara]

[Sara]18-sara knew where it was . [Becky]48-becky had told [her]18-sara about it . [She]18-sara turned , and mounted up [two flights of stairs]732-two flights of stairs . [The last one]733-the last one was narrow , and covered with shabby strips of old carpet . [She]18-sara felt as if [she]18-sara were walking away and leaving far behind [her]18-sara the world in which [that other child]734-that other child , who no longer seemed [herself]734-that other child , had lived . [This child]735-this child , in [her]735-this child short , tight old frock , climbing the stairs to [the attic]606-the attic , was quite [a different creature]737-a different creature .

When [she]18-sara reached the attic door and opened it , [her]18-sara heart gave a dreary little thump . Then [she]18-sara shut the door and stood against it and looked about [her]18-sara .

Yes , this was [another world]528-another world . [The room]189-the room had a slanting roof and was whitewashed . The whitewash was dingy and had fallen off in places . There was a rusty grate , an old iron bedstead , and a hard bed covered with a faded coverlet . Some pieces of furniture too much worn to be used [downstairs]265-downstairs had been sent up . Under the skylight in the roof , which showed nothing but an oblong piece of dull gray sky , there stood an old battered red footstool . [Sara]18-sara went to it and sat down . [She]18-sara seldom cried . [She]18-sara did not cry now . [She]18-sara laid [Emily]27-emily across [her]18-sara knees and put [her]18-sara face down upon [her]18-sara and [her]18-sara arms around [her]18-sara , and sat there , [her]18-sara little black head resting on the black draperies , not saying one word , not making one sound .

And as [she]18-sara sat in this silence there came a low tap at the door such a low , humble one that [she]18-sara did not at first hear it , and , indeed , was not roused until the door was timidly pushed open and a poor tear - smeared face appeared peeping round [it]741-it . It was [Becky]48-becky 's face , and [Becky]48-becky had been crying furtively for hours and rubbing [her]48-becky eyes with [her]48-becky kitchen apron until [she]48-becky looked strange indeed .

" Oh , [miss]2018-miss , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said under [her]18-sara breath . " Might [I]18-sara would [you]2018-miss allow [me]18-sara jest to come in ? "[18-sara]

[Sara]18-sara lifted [her]18-sara head and looked at [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara tried to begin a smile , and somehow [she]18-sara could not . Suddenly and it was all through the loving mournfulness of [Becky]48-becky 's streaming eyes [her]48-becky face looked more like [a child]202-a child 's not so much too old for [her]48-becky years . [She]18-sara held out [her]18-sara hand and gave a little sob .

" Oh , [Becky]48-becky , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " [I]18-sara told [you]48-becky [we]2264-we were just the same only [two little girls]2265-two little girls just [two little girls]2265-two little girls . [You]48-becky see how true it is . There 's no difference now . [I]18-sara 'm not [a princess]2033-a princess anymore . "[18-sara]

[Becky]48-becky ran to [her]18-sara and caught [her]18-sara hand , and hugged it to [her]48-becky breast , kneeling beside [her]18-sara and sobbing with love and pain .

" Yes , [miss]2018-miss , [you]48-becky are , "[48-becky] [she]48-becky cried , and [her]48-becky words were all broken . " Whats'ever ' appens to [[you whats'ever]2269-you whats'ever]2269-you whats'ever [you]48-becky 'd be [a princess]2033-a princess all the same an ' nothin' could n't make [you]48-becky nothin' different . "[48-becky]

8

In [the Attic]606-the attic

The first night [she]18-sara spent in [[her]18-sara attic]598-her attic was a thing [Sara]18-sara never forgot . During its passing [she]18-sara lived through a wild , unchildlike woe of which [she]18-sara never spoke to [anyone]1925-anyone about [her]18-sara . There was [no one who would have understood]746-no one who would have understood . It was , indeed , well for [her]18-sara that as [she]18-sara lay awake in the darkness [her]18-sara mind was forcibly distracted , now and then , by the strangeness of [her]18-sara surroundings . It was , perhaps , well for [her]18-sara that [she]18-sara was reminded by [her]18-sara small body of material things . If this had not been so , the anguish of [her]18-sara young mind might have been too great for [a child to bear]747-a child to bear . But , really , while the night was passing [she]18-sara scarcely knew that [she]18-sara had a body at all or remembered any other thing than one .

" [[My]18-sara papa]2236-my papa is dead ! "[18-sara] [she]18-sara kept whispering to [herself]18-sara . " [[My]18-sara papa]2236-my papa is dead ! "[18-sara]

It was not until long afterward that [she]18-sara realized that [her]18-sara bed had been so hard that [she]18-sara turned over and over in [it]748-it to find a place to rest , that the darkness seemed more intense than any [she]18-sara had ever known , and that the wind howled over the roof among the chimneys like something which wailed aloud . Then there was something worse . This was certain scufflings and scratchings and squeakings in the walls and behind the skirting boards . [She]18-sara knew what they meant , because [Becky]48-becky had described [them]749-them . [They]749-them meant rats and mice who were either fighting with each other or playing together . Once or twice [she]18-sara even heard sharp - toed feet scurrying across the floor , and [she]18-sara remembered in those after days , when [she]18-sara recalled things , that when first [she]18-sara heard them [she]18-sara started up in bed and sat trembling , and when [she]18-sara lay down again covered [her]18-sara head with the bedclothes .

The change in [her]18-sara life did not come about gradually , but was made all at once .

" [She]18-sara must begin as [she]18-sara is to go on , "[22-miss minchin] [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin said to [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin . " [She]18-sara must be taught at once what [she]18-sara is to expect . "[22-miss minchin]

[Mariette]32-mariette had left [the house]170-the house the next morning . The glimpse [Sara]18-sara caught of [[her]18-sara sitting room]258-her sitting room , as [she]18-sara passed [its]258-her sitting room open door , showed [her]18-sara that everything had been changed . [Her]18-sara ornaments and luxuries had been removed , and a bed had been placed in a corner to transform [it]258-her sitting room into [[a new pupil]336-a new pupil 's bedroom]753-a new pupil 's bedroom .

When [she]18-sara went down to breakfast [she]18-sara saw that [her]18-sara seat at [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's side was occupied by [Lavinia]30-lavinia , and [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin spoke to [her]18-sara coldly .

" [You]18-sara will begin [your]18-sara new duties , [Sara]18-sara , "[22-miss minchin] [she]22-miss minchin said , " by taking [your]18-sara seat with [the younger children]409-the younger children at a smaller table . [You]18-sara must keep [them]409-the younger children quiet , and see that [they]409-the younger children behave well and do not waste [their]409-the younger children food . [You]18-sara ought to have been down earlier . [Lottie]31-lottie has already upset [her]31-lottie tea . "[22-miss minchin]

That was the beginning , and from day to day the duties given to [her]18-sara were added to . [She]18-sara taught [the younger children]409-the younger children French and heard [their]409-the younger children other lessons , and these were the least of [her]18-sara labors . It was found that [she]18-sara could be made use of in numberless directions . [She]18-sara could be sent on errands at any time and in all weathers . [She]18-sara could be told to do things [other people]308-other people neglected . [The cook]2053-the cook and [the housemaids]757-the housemaids took [their]758-their tone from [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin , and rather enjoyed ordering about [the " young one "[757-the housemaids] who had been made so much fuss over for so long]759-the " young one " who had been made so much fuss over for so long . [They]758-their were not [servants of the best class]760-servants of the best class , and had neither good manners nor good tempers , and it was frequently convenient to have at hand [someone on whom blame could be laid]761-someone on whom blame could be laid .

During the first month or two , [Sara]18-sara thought that [her]18-sara willingness to do things as well as [she]18-sara could , and [her]18-sara silence under reproof , might soften those who drove [her]18-sara so hard . In [her]18-sara proud little heart [she]18-sara wanted [them]758-their to see that [she]18-sara was trying to earn [her]18-sara living and not accepting charity . But the time came when [she]18-sara saw that [no one]1828-no one was softened at all ; and the more willing [she]18-sara was to do as [she]18-sara was told , the more domineering and exacting [careless housemaids]763-careless housemaids became , and the more ready [a scolding cook]764-a scolding cook was to blame [her]18-sara .

If [she]18-sara had been older , [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin would have given [her]18-sara [the bigger girls]765-the bigger girls to teach and saved money by dismissing [an instructress]766-an instructress ; but while [she]18-sara remained and looked like [a child]202-a child , [she]18-sara could be made more useful as a sort of [little superior errand girl]768-little superior errand girl and [maid of all work]769-maid of all work . [An ordinary errand boy]770-an ordinary errand boy would not have been so clever and reliable . [Sara]18-sara could be trusted with difficult commissions and complicated messages . [She]18-sara could even go and pay bills , and [she]18-sara combined with this the ability to dust [a room]771-a room well and to set things in order .

[Her]18-sara own lessons became things of the past . [She]18-sara was taught nothing , and only after long and busy days spent in running [here]1824-here and there at [everybody]270-everybody 's orders was [she]18-sara grudgingly allowed to go into [the deserted schoolroom]774-the deserted schoolroom , with a pile of old books , and study alone at night .

" If [I]18-sara do not remind [myself]18-sara of the things [I]18-sara have learned , perhaps [I]18-sara may forget them , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said to [herself]18-sara . " [I]18-sara am almost [a scullery maid]2101-a scullery maid , and if [I]18-sara am [a scullery maid who knows nothing]2275-a scullery maid who knows nothing , [I]18-sara shall be like poor [Becky]48-becky . One of the most curious things in [her]18-sara new existence was [her]18-sara changed position among [the pupils]294-the pupils . Instead of being a sort of [small royal personage among [them]294-the pupils]776-small royal personage among them , [she]18-sara no longer seemed to be one of [their]294-the pupils number at all . [She]18-sara was kept so constantly at work that [she]18-sara scarcely ever had an opportunity of speaking to [any of [them]294-the pupils]777-any of them , and [she]18-sara could not avoid seeing that [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin preferred that [she]18-sara should live a life apart from that of [the occupants of [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom]778-the occupants of the schoolroom .

" [I]780-that lady will not have [her]18-sara forming intimacies and talking to [the other children]717-the other children , "[780-that lady] [that lady]780-that lady said . " [Girls]2278-girls like a grievance , and if [she]18-sara begins to tell romantic stories about [herself]18-sara , [she]18-sara will become [an ill - used heroine]2279-an ill - used heroine , and [parents]401-parents will be given a wrong impression . It is better that [she]18-sara should live a separate life one suited to [her]18-sara circumstances . [I]780-that lady am giving [her]18-sara a [home]437-home , and that is more than [she]18-sara has any right to expect from [me]780-that lady . "[780-that lady]

[Sara]18-sara did not expect much , and was far too proud to try to continue to be intimate with [girls who evidently felt rather awkward and uncertain about [her]18-sara . The fact was that [[Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's pupils]782-miss minchin 's pupils]781-girls who evidently felt rather awkward and uncertain about her . the fact was that miss minchin 's pupils were a set of [dull , matter - of - fact young people]783-dull , matter - of - fact young people . [They]782-miss minchin 's pupils were accustomed to being rich and comfortable , and as [Sara]18-sara 's frocks grew shorter and shabbier and queerer - looking , and it became an established fact that [she]18-sara wore shoes with holes in them and was sent out to buy groceries and carry [them]784-them through [the streets]1982-the streets in a basket on [her]18-sara arm when [the cook]2053-the cook wanted [them]784-them in a hurry , [they]782-miss minchin 's pupils felt rather as if , when [they]782-miss minchin 's pupils spoke to [her]18-sara , [they]782-miss minchin 's pupils were addressing [an under servant]787-an under servant .

" To think that [she]18-sara was [the girl with the diamond mines]2282-the girl with the diamond mines , "[30-lavinia] [Lavinia]30-lavinia commented . " [She]18-sara does look an object . "[30-lavinia]

" [I]18-sara am , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , promptly , when [she]18-sara heard of this . " That 's what [I]18-sara look at [some people]455-some people for . [I]18-sara like to know about [them]455-some people . [I]18-sara think [them]455-some people over afterward . "[18-sara]

The truth was that [she]18-sara had saved [herself]18-sara annoyance several times by keeping [her]18-sara eye on [Lavinia]30-lavinia , who was quite ready to make mischief , and would have been rather pleased to have made it for [the ex - show pupil]788-the ex - show pupil .

[Sara]18-sara never made any mischief [herself]18-sara , or interfered with [anyone]1925-anyone . [She]18-sara worked like [a drudge]790-a drudge ; [she]18-sara tramped through [the wet streets]791-the wet streets , carrying parcels and baskets ; [she]18-sara labored with the childish inattention of [the little ones]403-the little ones ' French lessons ; as [she]18-sara became shabbier and more forlorn - looking , [she]18-sara was told that [she]18-sara had better take [her]18-sara meals [downstairs]265-downstairs ; [she]18-sara was treated as if [she]18-sara was [nobody]622-nobody 's concern , and [her]18-sara heart grew proud and sore , but [she]18-sara never told [anyone]1925-anyone what [she]18-sara felt .

" [Soldiers]1826-soldiers do n't complain , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara would say between [her]18-sara small , shut teeth , " [I]18-sara am not going to do it ; [I]18-sara will pretend this is part of a war . "[18-sara]

But there were hours when [her]18-sara child heart might almost have broken with loneliness but for [three people]796-three people .

The first , it must be owned , was [Becky]48-becky just [Becky]48-becky . Throughout all that first night spent in [the garret]797-the garret , [she]18-sara had felt a vague comfort in knowing that on the other side of the wall in which the rats scuffled and squeaked there was [another young human creature]798-another young human creature . And during the nights that followed the sense of comfort grew . [They]796-three people had little chance to speak to [each other]156-each other during the day . [Each]800-each had [her]800-each own tasks to perform , and any attempt at conversation would have been regarded as a tendency to loiter and lose time . " Do n't mind [me]48-becky , [miss]2018-miss , "[48-becky] [Becky]48-becky whispered during the first morning , " if [I]48-becky do n't say nothin' polite . "[48-becky]

But before daybreak [she]18-sara used to slip into [[Sara]18-sara 's attic]801-sara 's attic and button [her]18-sara dress and give [her]18-sara such help as [she]18-sara required before [she]18-sara went [downstairs]265-downstairs to light the kitchen fire . And when night came [Sara]18-sara always heard the humble knock at [her]18-sara door which meant that [[her]18-sara handmaid]803-her handmaid was ready to help [her]18-sara again if [she]18-sara was needed . During the first weeks of [her]18-sara grief [Sara]18-sara felt as if [she]18-sara were too stupefied to talk , so it happened that some time passed before [they]804-they saw [each other]156-each other much or exchanged visits . [Becky]48-becky 's heart told [her]48-becky that it was best that [people in trouble]328-people in trouble should be left alone .

[The second of [the trio of comforters]808-the trio of comforters]807-the second of the trio of comforters was [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde , but odd things happened before [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde found [her]40-ermengarde place .

When [Sara]18-sara 's mind seemed to awaken again to the life about [her]18-sara , [she]18-sara realized that [she]18-sara had forgotten that [an Ermengarde]809-an ermengarde lived in [the world]137-the world . [The two]264-the two had always been [friends]1940-friends , but [Sara]18-sara had felt as if [she]18-sara were years the older . It could not be contested that [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was as dull as [she]40-ermengarde was affectionate . [She]40-ermengarde clung to [Sara]18-sara in a simple , helpless way ; [she]40-ermengarde brought [her]40-ermengarde lessons to [her]18-sara that [she]18-sara might be helped ; [she]40-ermengarde listened to [her]18-sara every word and besieged [her]18-sara with requests for stories . But [she]40-ermengarde had nothing interesting to say [herself]40-ermengarde , and [she]40-ermengarde loathed books of every description . [She]40-ermengarde was , in fact , [not a person one would remember when [one]134-one was caught in the storm of a great trouble]813-not a person one would remember when one was caught in the storm of a great trouble , and [Sara]18-sara forgot [her]40-ermengarde .

It had been all the easier to forget [her]40-ermengarde because [she]40-ermengarde had been suddenly called [home]437-home for a few weeks . When [she]40-ermengarde came back [she]40-ermengarde did not see [Sara]18-sara for a day or two , and when [she]40-ermengarde met [her]18-sara for the first time [she]40-ermengarde encountered [her]18-sara coming down [a corridor]816-a corridor with [her]18-sara arms full of garments which were to be taken [downstairs]265-downstairs to be mended . [Sara]18-sara [herself]18-sara had already been taught to mend them . [She]18-sara looked pale and unlike [herself]18-sara , and [she]18-sara was attired in the queer , outgrown frock whose shortness showed so much thin black leg .

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was too slow [a girl to be equal to such a situation]818-a girl to be equal to such a situation . [She]40-ermengarde could not think of anything to say . [She]40-ermengarde knew what had happened , but , somehow , [she]40-ermengarde had never imagined [Sara]18-sara could look like this so odd and poor and almost like [a servant]819-a servant . "[40-ermengarde]

" Yes , "[18-sara] answered [Sara]18-sara , and suddenly a strange thought passed through [her]18-sara mind and made [her]18-sara face flush . Then [Sara]18-sara was guilty of an injustice . Just at that moment [her]18-sara torn heart swelled within [her]18-sara , and [she]18-sara felt that if [anyone]1925-anyone was as stupid as that , [one]134-one had better get away from [her]18-sara .
