[She]40-ermengarde was always awkward , and the more [she]40-ermengarde felt , the more stupid [she]40-ermengarde was given to being .

But the sudden thought which had flashed upon [her]40-ermengarde had made [her]40-ermengarde over - sensitive .

" [She]40-ermengarde is like [the others]395-the others , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara had thought . " [She]40-ermengarde does not really want to talk to [me]18-sara . [She]40-ermengarde knows [no one]1828-no one does . "[18-sara]

So for several weeks a barrier stood between [them]823-they . At that time it was noticed that [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was more stupid than ever , and that [she]40-ermengarde looked listless and unhappy . [She]40-ermengarde used to sit in the window - seat , huddled in a heap , and stare out of the window without speaking . " Well , "[40-ermengarde] said [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde , " [I]40-ermengarde 'm miserable and [no one]1828-no one need interfere . That night , when [Sara]18-sara went to [[her]18-sara attic]598-her attic , [she]18-sara was later than usual . " [Nobody]622-nobody goes [there]207-there but [myself]18-sara , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara thought quickly , " but [someone]1856-someone has lighted a candle . "[18-sara]

" [I]40-ermengarde could n't bear it any more , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said . So tonight , when [I]40-ermengarde was crying under the bedclothes , [I]40-ermengarde thought all at once of creeping up here and just begging [you]40-ermengarde to let [us]835-they be [friends]1940-friends again . "[40-ermengarde]

" [You]40-ermengarde are nicer than [I]18-sara am , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " [I]18-sara was too proud to try and make [friends]1940-friends . [You]40-ermengarde see , now that [trials]2298-they have come , [they]2298-they have shown that [I]18-sara am NOT [a nice child]1945-a nice child . [I]18-sara was afraid [they]2298-they would . Perhaps "[18-sara] wrinkling [her]18-sara forehead wisely " that is what [they]2298-they were sent for . "[40-ermengarde]

" [I]40-ermengarde do n't see any good in [them]2298-they , "[40-ermengarde] said [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde stoutly .

" Neither do [I]18-sara to speak the truth , "[18-sara] admitted [Sara]18-sara , frankly . " But [I]18-sara suppose there MIGHT be good in things , even if [we]2300-we do n't see it . [There]207-there MIGHT "[18-sara] doubtfully " be good in [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . "[40-ermengarde]

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde looked round [the attic]606-the attic with a rather fearsome curiosity .

" [Sara]18-sara , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said , " do [you]18-sara think [you]18-sara can bear living [here]1824-here ? "[40-ermengarde]

[Sara]18-sara looked round also .

" If [I]18-sara pretend it 's quite different , [I]18-sara can , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara answered ; " or if [I]18-sara pretend it is a place in a story . "[18-sara]

[She]40-ermengarde spoke slowly . [Her]18-sara imagination was beginning to work for [her]18-sara . It had not worked for [her]18-sara at all since [her]18-sara troubles had come upon [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara had felt as if it had been stunned .

" [Other people]308-other people have lived in worse places . Think of [the Count of [Monte Cristo]8-monte cristo in [the dungeons of [the Chateau d'If]2306-the chateau d'if]2305-the dungeons of the chateau d'if]2304-the count of monte cristo in the dungeons of the chateau d'if . " [The Bastille]52-the bastille , "[40-ermengarde] half whispered [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde , watching [her]18-sara and beginning to be fascinated . [She]40-ermengarde remembered stories of the French Revolution which [Sara]18-sara had been able to fix in [her]18-sara mind by [her]18-sara dramatic relation of [them]838-them . [No one]1828-no one but [Sara]18-sara could have done it .

A well - known glow came into [Sara]18-sara 's eyes .

" Yes , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , hugging [her]18-sara knees , " that will be a good place to pretend about . [I]18-sara am [a prisoner in [the Bastille]52-the bastille]2308-a prisoner in the bastille . [I]18-sara have been [here]1824-here for years and years and years ; and [everybody]270-everybody has forgotten about [me]18-sara . [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin is [the jailer]2311-the jailer and [Becky]48-becky "[18-sara] a sudden light adding itself to the glow in [her]18-sara eyes " [Becky]48-becky is [the prisoner in [the next cell]2313-the next cell]2312-the prisoner in the next cell . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara turned to [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde , looking quite like [the old Sara]840-the old sara .

" [I]18-sara shall pretend that , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said ; " and it will be a great comfort . "[18-sara]

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was at once enraptured and awed .

" And will [you]18-sara tell [me]40-ermengarde all about it ? "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said . " Yes , "[18-sara] answered [Sara]18-sara , nodding . " [Adversity]71-adversity tries [people]157-people , and [mine]18-sara has tried [you]18-sara and proved how nice [you]18-sara are . "[18-sara]

9

Melchisedec

[The third person in the trio]841-the third person in the trio was [Lottie]31-lottie . [She]31-lottie was a small thing and did not know what adversity meant , and was much bewildered by the alteration [she]31-lottie saw in [[her]31-lottie young adopted mother]842-her young adopted mother . [She]31-lottie had heard it rumored that strange things had happened to [Sara]18-sara , but [she]31-lottie could not understand why [she]31-lottie looked different why [she]31-lottie wore an old black frock and came into [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom only to teach instead of to sit in [[her]31-lottie place of honor]844-her place of honor and learn lessons [herself]31-lottie . There had been much whispering among [the little ones]403-the little ones when it had been discovered that [Sara]18-sara no longer lived in [the rooms in which [Emily]27-emily had so long sat in state]846-the rooms in which emily had so long sat in state . [Lottie]31-lottie 's chief difficulty was that [Sara]18-sara said so little when [one]134-one asked [her]18-sara questions . At seven mysteries must be made very clear if [one]134-one is to understand them .

" Are [you]18-sara very poor now , [Sara]18-sara ? "[31-lottie] [she]31-lottie had asked confidentially the first morning [[her]31-lottie friend]279-her friend took charge of [the small French class]850-the small french class . " Are [you]18-sara as poor as [a beggar]390-a beggar ? "[31-lottie] [She]31-lottie thrust a fat hand into [the slim one]851-the slim one and opened round , tearful eyes . " [I]31-lottie do n't want [you]18-sara to be as poor as [a beggar]390-a beggar . "[31-lottie]

[She]31-lottie looked as if [she]31-lottie was going to cry . And [Sara]18-sara hurriedly consoled [her]31-lottie .

" [Beggars]2320-beggars have nowhere to live , "[31-lottie] [she]31-lottie said courageously . " [I]31-lottie have a place to live in . "[31-lottie]

" Where do [you]18-sara live ? "[31-lottie] persisted [Lottie]31-lottie . " [The new girl]2321-the new girl sleeps in [[your]18-sara room]2211-your room , and it is n't pretty any more . "[31-lottie]

" [I]18-sara live in [another room]2323-another room , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara .

" Is it a nice one ? "[31-lottie] inquired [Lottie]31-lottie . " [I]31-lottie want to go and see it . "[31-lottie]

" [You]31-lottie must not talk , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin is looking at [us]2324-us . [She]22-miss minchin will be angry with [me]18-sara for letting [you]31-lottie whisper . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara had found out already that [she]18-sara was to be held accountable for everything which was objected to . If [the children]490-the children were not attentive , if [they]490-the children talked , if [they]490-the children were restless , it was [she]18-sara who would be reproved .

But [Lottie]31-lottie was [a determined little person]853-a determined little person . If [Sara]18-sara would not tell [her]31-lottie where [she]31-lottie lived , [she]31-lottie would find out in some other way . [She]18-sara talked to [[her]18-sara small companions]854-her small companions and hung about [the elder girls]855-the elder girls and listened when [they]855-the elder girls were gossiping ; and acting upon certain information [they]855-the elder girls had unconsciously let drop , [she]18-sara started late one afternoon on a voyage of discovery , climbing stairs [she]18-sara had never known the existence of , until [she]18-sara reached [the attic floor]856-the attic floor . There [she]18-sara found two doors near each other , and opening one , [she]18-sara saw [[her]18-sara beloved]857-her beloved [Sara]18-sara standing upon an old table and looking out of a window .

" [Sara]18-sara ! "[18-sara] [she]18-sara cried , aghast . " [Mamma Sara]18-sara ! "[18-sara] [She]18-sara was aghast because [the attic]606-the attic was so bare and ugly and seemed so far away from [all the world]859-all the world . [Her]18-sara short legs had seemed to have been mounting hundreds of stairs .

[Sara]18-sara turned round at the sound of [her]18-sara voice . It was [her]18-sara turn to be aghast . What would happen now ? If [Lottie]31-lottie began to cry and [any one]860-any one chanced to hear , [they]861-they were both lost . [She]18-sara jumped down from [her]18-sara table and ran to [the child]261-the child .

" Do n't cry and make a noise , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara implored . " [I]18-sara shall be scolded if [you]31-lottie do , and [I]18-sara have been scolded all day . It 's it 's not such [a bad room]2325-a bad room , [Lottie]31-lottie . "[18-sara]

" Is n't it ? "[31-lottie] gasped [Lottie]31-lottie , and as [she]31-lottie looked round it [she]31-lottie bit [her]31-lottie lip . [She]261-the child was [a spoiled child]863-a spoiled child yet , but [she]261-the child was fond enough of [[her]261-the child adopted parent]563-her adopted parent to make an effort to control [herself]261-the child for [her]261-the child sake . Then , somehow , it was quite possible that [any place in which [Sara]18-sara lived]865-any place in which sara lived might turn out to be nice . " Why is n't it , [Sara]18-sara ? "[31-lottie] [she]31-lottie almost whispered .

[Sara]18-sara hugged [her]31-lottie close and tried to laugh . There was a sort of comfort in the warmth of the plump , childish body . [She]31-lottie had had a hard day and had been staring out of the windows with hot eyes .

" [You]18-sara can see all sorts of things [you]18-sara ca n't see [downstairs]265-downstairs , "[31-lottie] [she]31-lottie said .

" What sort of things ? "[31-lottie] demanded [Lottie]31-lottie , with that curiosity [Sara]18-sara could always awaken even in [bigger girls]866-bigger girls .

" Chimneys quite close to [us]2327-us with smoke curling up in wreaths and clouds and going up into the sky and sparrows hopping about and talking to each other just as if [they]867-they were [people]157-people and other attic windows where heads may pop out any minute and [you]18-sara can wonder who [they]867-they belong to . And it all feels as high up as if it was [another world]528-another world . "[31-lottie]

" Oh , let [me]31-lottie see it ! "[31-lottie] cried [Lottie]31-lottie . " Lift [me]31-lottie up ! "[31-lottie]

[Sara]18-sara lifted [her]31-lottie up , and [they]867-they stood on the old table together and leaned on the edge of the flat window in the roof , and looked out .

[Anyone who has not done this]868-anyone who has not done this does not know what [a different world]869-a different world [they]868-anyone who has not done this saw . The slates spread out on either side of them and slanted down into the rain gutter - pipes . The sparrows , being at [home]437-home [there]207-there , twittered and hopped about quite without fear . Two of [them]867-they perched on the chimney top nearest and quarrelled with [each other]156-each other fiercely until one pecked the other and drove [him]873-him away . The garret window next to [theirs]867-they was shut because [the house next door]874-the house next door was empty .

" [I]18-sara wish [someone]1856-someone lived [there]207-there , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara said . " It is so close that if there was [a little girl in the attic]2332-a little girl in the attic , [we]867-they could talk to [each other]156-each other through the windows and climb over to see [each other]156-each other , if [we]867-they were not afraid of falling . "[18-sara]

The sky seemed so much nearer than when [one]134-one saw it from [the street]2034-the street , that [Lottie]31-lottie was enchanted . From the attic window , among the chimney pots , the things which were happening in [the world below]877-the world below seemed almost unreal . [One]134-one scarcely believed in the existence of [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin and [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin and [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom , and the roll of wheels in [the square]259-the square seemed a sound belonging to another existence .

" Oh , [Sara]18-sara ! "[31-lottie] cried [Lottie]31-lottie , cuddling in [her]18-sara guarding arm . " [I]31-lottie like [this attic]2335-this attic [I]31-lottie like [it]2335-this attic ! [It]2335-this attic is nicer than [downstairs]265-downstairs ! "[31-lottie]

" Look at that sparrow , "[18-sara] whispered [Sara]18-sara . " [I]18-sara wish [I]18-sara had some crumbs to throw to [him]882-the sparrow . "[18-sara]

" [I]31-lottie have some ! "[31-lottie] came in a little shriek from [Lottie]31-lottie . " [I]31-lottie have part of a bun in [my]31-lottie pocket ; [I]31-lottie bought it with [my]31-lottie penny yesterday , and [I]31-lottie saved a bit . "[31-lottie]

When [they]881-they threw out a few crumbs [the sparrow]882-the sparrow jumped and flew away to an adjacent chimney top . [He]882-the sparrow was evidently not accustomed to intimates in [attics]2098-attics , and unexpected crumbs startled [him]882-the sparrow . But when [Lottie]31-lottie remained quite still and [Sara]18-sara chirped very softly almost as if [she]18-sara were [a sparrow]884-a sparrow [herself]18-sara [he]882-the sparrow saw that the thing which had alarmed [him]882-the sparrow represented hospitality , after all . [He]882-the sparrow put [his]882-the sparrow head on one side , and from [his]882-the sparrow perch on the chimney looked down at the crumbs with twinkling eyes . [Lottie]31-lottie could scarcely keep still .

" Will [he]882-the sparrow come ? Will [he]882-the sparrow come ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara whispered .

" [His]882-the sparrow eyes look as if [he]882-the sparrow would , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara whispered back . " [He]882-the sparrow is thinking and thinking whether [he]882-the sparrow dare . Yes , [he]882-the sparrow will ! Yes , [he]882-the sparrow is coming ! "[18-sara]

[He]882-the sparrow flew down and hopped toward the crumbs , but stopped a few inches away from [them]885-they , putting [his]882-the sparrow head on one side again , as if reflecting on the chances that [Sara]18-sara and [Lottie]31-lottie might turn out to be big cats and jump on [him]882-the sparrow . At last [his]882-the sparrow heart told [him]882-the sparrow [they]885-they were really nicer than [they]885-they looked , and [he]882-the sparrow hopped nearer and nearer , darted at the biggest crumb with a lightning peck , seized it , and carried it away to the other side of [his]882-the sparrow chimney .

" Now [he]882-the sparrow KNOWS "[18-sara] , said [Sara]18-sara . " And [he]882-the sparrow will come back for the others . "[18-sara]

[He]882-the sparrow did come back , and even brought [a friend]886-a friend , and [the friend]887-the friend went away and brought [a relative]888-a relative , and among [them]885-they [they]885-they made a hearty meal over which [they]885-they twittered and chattered and exclaimed , stopping every now and then to put [their]885-they heads on one side and examine [Lottie]31-lottie and [Sara]18-sara . [Lottie]31-lottie was so delighted that [she]31-lottie quite forgot [her]31-lottie first shocked impression of [the attic]606-the attic . In fact , when [she]31-lottie was lifted down from the table and returned to earthly things , as it were , [Sara]18-sara was able to point out to [her]18-sara many beauties in [the room]189-the room which [she]18-sara [herself]18-sara would not have suspected the existence of .

" It is so little and so high above everything , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , " that it is almost like a nest in a tree . The slanting ceiling is so funny . See , [you]2337-you can scarcely stand up at this end of [the room]189-the room ; and when the morning begins to come [I]18-sara can lie in bed and look right up into the sky through that flat window in the roof . It is like a square patch of light . If the sun is going to shine , little pink clouds float about , and [I]18-sara feel as if [I]18-sara could touch them . And if it rains , the drops patter and patter as if [they]2339-they were saying something nice . Then if there are stars , [you]2337-you can lie and try to count how many go into [the patch]2340-the patch . It takes such a lot . And just look at that tiny , rusty grate in the corner . If it was polished and there was a fire in [it]189-the room , just think how nice it would be . [You]2337-you see , it 's really [a beautiful little room]2341-a beautiful little room . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara was walking round [the small place]891-the small place , holding [Lottie]31-lottie 's hand and making gestures which described all the beauties [she]18-sara was making [herself]18-sara see . [She]18-sara quite made [Lottie]31-lottie see [them]892-them , too . [Lottie]31-lottie could always believe in the things [Sara]18-sara made pictures of .

" [You]2337-you see , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , " there could be a thick , soft blue Indian rug on the floor ; and in that corner there could be a soft little sofa , with cushions to curl up on ; and just over it could be a shelf full of books so that [one]134-one could reach them easily ; and there could be a fur rug before the fire , and hangings on the wall to cover up the whitewash , and pictures . They would have to be little ones , but they could be beautiful ; and there could be a lamp with a deep rose - colored shade ; and a table in the middle , with things to have tea with ; and a little fat copper kettle singing on the hob ; and the bed could be quite different . It could be made soft and covered with a lovely silk coverlet . It could be beautiful . And perhaps [we]2343-we could coax the sparrows until [we]2343-we made such friends with [them]2344-them that [they]2344-them would come and peck at the window and ask to be let in . "[18-sara]

" Oh , [Sara]18-sara ! "[31-lottie] cried [Lottie]31-lottie . " [I]31-lottie should like to live [here]1824-here ! "[31-lottie]

When [Sara]18-sara had persuaded [her]18-sara to go [downstairs]265-downstairs again , and , after setting [her]18-sara on [her]18-sara way , had come back to [[her]18-sara attic]598-her attic , [she]18-sara stood in the middle of [it]598-her attic and looked about [her]18-sara . The enchantment of [her]18-sara imaginings for [Lottie]31-lottie had died away . The bed was hard and covered with its dingy quilt . The whitewashed wall showed its broken patches , the floor was cold and bare , the grate was broken and rusty , and the battered footstool , tilted sideways on [its]895-its injured leg , the only seat in [the room]189-the room . [She]18-sara sat down on [it]895-its for a few minutes and let [her]18-sara head drop in [her]18-sara hands . The mere fact that [Lottie]31-lottie had come and gone away again made things seem a little worse just as perhaps [prisoners]897-prisoners feel a little more desolate after [visitors]898-visitors come and go , leaving [them]897-prisoners behind .

" It 's [a lonely place]2346-a lonely place , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " Sometimes it 's [the loneliest place in [the world]137-the world]2347-the loneliest place in the world . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara was sitting in this way when [her]18-sara attention was attracted by a slight sound near [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara lifted [her]18-sara head to see where it came from , and if [she]18-sara had been [a nervous child]899-a nervous child [she]18-sara would have left [her]18-sara seat on the battered footstool in a great hurry . A large rat was sitting up on [his]900-he hind quarters and sniffing the air in an interested manner . Some of [Lottie]31-lottie 's crumbs had dropped upon the floor and [their]901-their scent had drawn [him]900-he out of [his]900-he hole .

[He]900-he looked so queer and so like [a gray - whiskered dwarf or gnome]902-a gray - whiskered dwarf or gnome that [Sara]18-sara was rather fascinated . [He]900-he looked at [her]18-sara with [his]900-he bright eyes , as if [he]900-he were asking a question . [He]900-he was evidently so doubtful that one of [the child]261-the child 's queer thoughts came into [her]18-sara mind .

" [I]18-sara dare say it is rather hard to be a rat , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara mused . " [Nobody]622-nobody likes [you]900-he . [People]157-people jump and run away and scream out , ' Oh , a horrid rat ! ' [I]18-sara should n't like [people]157-people to scream and jump and say , ' Oh , a horrid [Sara]18-sara ! ' the moment [they]157-people saw [me]18-sara . And set traps for [me]18-sara , and pretend [they]157-people were dinner . It 's so different to be [a sparrow]884-a sparrow . But [nobody]622-nobody asked this rat if [he]904-he wanted to be a rat when [he]904-he was made . [Nobody]622-nobody said , ' Would n't [you]904-he rather be [a sparrow]884-a sparrow ? ' "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara had sat so quietly that the rat had begun to take courage . [He]904-he was very much afraid of [her]18-sara , but perhaps [he]904-he had a heart like the sparrow and it told [him]904-he that [she]18-sara was not a thing which pounced . [He]904-he was very hungry . [He]904-he had [a wife]905-a wife and a large family in the wall , and [they]906-they had had frightfully bad luck for several days . [He]904-he had left [the children]490-the children crying bitterly , and felt [he]904-he would risk a good deal for a few crumbs , so [he]904-he cautiously dropped upon [his]904-he feet .

" Come on , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara ; " [I]18-sara 'm not a trap . [You]904-he can have [them]490-the children , poor thing ! [Prisoners in [the Bastille]2357-the bastille]2356-prisoners in the bastille used to make [friends with rats]2358-friends with rats . Suppose [I]18-sara make [friends]1940-friends with [you]904-he . "[18-sara]

How it is that animals understand things [I]0-i do not know , but it is certain that [they]908-they do understand . Perhaps there is a language which is not made of words and everything in [the world]137-the world understands it . Perhaps there is a soul hidden in everything and it can always speak , without even making a sound , to another soul . But whatsoever was the reason , [the rat]910-the rat knew from that moment that [he]904-he was safe even though [he]904-he was a rat . [He]910-the rat knew that [this young human being sitting on the red footstool]911-this young human being sitting on the red footstool would not jump up and terrify [him]910-the rat with wild , sharp noises or throw heavy objects at [him]910-the rat which , if they did not fall and crush [him]910-the rat , would send [him]910-the rat limping in [his]910-the rat scurry back to [[his]910-the rat hole]912-his hole . [He]910-the rat was really a very nice rat , and did not mean the least harm . When [he]910-the rat had stood on [his]910-the rat hind legs and sniffed the air , with [his]910-the rat bright eyes fixed on [Sara]18-sara , [he]910-the rat had hoped that [she]18-sara would understand this , and would not begin by hating [him]910-the rat as [an enemy]913-an enemy . When the mysterious thing which speaks without saying any words told [him]910-the rat that [she]18-sara would not , [he]910-the rat went softly toward the crumbs and began to eat them . As [he]910-the rat did it [he]910-the rat glanced every now and then at [Sara]18-sara , just as the sparrows had done , and [his]910-the rat expression was so very apologetic that it touched [her]18-sara heart .

[She]18-sara sat and watched [him]910-the rat without making any movement . One crumb was very much larger than the others in fact , it could scarcely be called a crumb . It was evident that [he]910-the rat wanted that piece very much , but it lay quite near the footstool and [he]910-the rat was still rather timid .

" [I]18-sara believe [he]910-the rat wants it to carry to [[his]910-the rat family]2360-his family in the wall , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara thought . " If [I]18-sara do not stir at all , perhaps [he]910-the rat will come and get it . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara scarcely allowed [herself]18-sara to breathe , [she]18-sara was so deeply interested . [The rat]910-the rat shuffled a little nearer and ate a few more crumbs , then [he]910-the rat stopped and sniffed delicately , giving a side glance at [the occupant of the footstool]915-the occupant of the footstool ; then [he]910-the rat darted at the piece of bun with something very like the sudden boldness of the sparrow , and the instant [he]910-the rat had possession of it fled back to the wall , slipped down a crack in the skirting board , and was gone .

" [I]18-sara knew [he]910-the rat wanted it for [[his]910-the rat children]2361-his children , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " [I]18-sara do believe [I]18-sara could make [friends]1940-friends with [him]910-the rat . "[18-sara]

A week or so afterward , on one of the rare nights when [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde found it safe to steal up to [the attic]606-the attic , when [she]40-ermengarde tapped on the door with the tips of [her]40-ermengarde fingers [Sara]18-sara did not come to [her]40-ermengarde for two or three minutes . There was , indeed , such a silence in [the room]189-the room at first that [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde wondered if [she]40-ermengarde could have fallen asleep . Then , to [her]40-ermengarde surprise , [she]40-ermengarde heard [her]40-ermengarde utter a little , low laugh and speak coaxingly to [someone]1856-someone .

" There ! "[40-ermengarde] [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde heard [her]40-ermengarde say . " Take it and go [home]437-home , [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec ! Go [home]437-home to [[your]40-ermengarde wife]2365-your wife ! "[40-ermengarde]

Almost immediately [Sara]18-sara opened the door , and when [she]18-sara did so [she]18-sara found [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde standing with alarmed eyes upon the threshold .

" Who who ARE [you]18-sara talking to , [Sara]18-sara ? "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde gasped out .

[Sara]18-sara drew [her]40-ermengarde in cautiously , but [she]18-sara looked as if something pleased and amused [her]40-ermengarde .

" [You]18-sara must promise not to be frightened not to scream the least bit , or [I]18-sara ca n't tell [you]18-sara , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara answered .

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde felt almost inclined to scream on the spot , but managed to control [herself]40-ermengarde . [She]40-ermengarde looked all round [the attic]606-the attic and saw [no one]1828-no one . And yet [Sara]18-sara had certainly been speaking TO [someone]1856-someone . [She]18-sara thought of [ghosts]922-ghosts .

" Is it something that will frighten [me]18-sara ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara asked timorously .

" [Some people]455-some people are afraid of [them]922-ghosts , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " [I]18-sara was at first but [I]18-sara am not now . "[18-sara]

" Was it a ghost ? "[40-ermengarde] quaked [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde .

" No , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , laughing . " It was [my]18-sara rat . "[18-sara]

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde made one bound , and landed in the middle of the little dingy bed . [She]40-ermengarde tucked [her]40-ermengarde feet under [her]40-ermengarde nightgown and the red shawl . [She]40-ermengarde did not scream , but [she]40-ermengarde gasped with fright .

" Oh ! Oh ! "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde cried under [her]40-ermengarde breath . " [A rat]2367-a rat ! A rat ! "[40-ermengarde]

" [I]18-sara was afraid [you]40-ermengarde would be frightened , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " But [you]40-ermengarde need n't be . [I]18-sara am making [him]2367-a rat tame . [He]2367-a rat actually knows [me]18-sara and comes out when [I]18-sara call [him]2367-a rat . Are [you]40-ermengarde too frightened to want to see [him]2367-a rat ? "[18-sara]

The truth was that , as the days had gone on and , with the aid of scraps brought up from [the kitchen]484-the kitchen , [her]40-ermengarde curious friendship had developed , [she]40-ermengarde had gradually forgotten that the timid creature [she]40-ermengarde was becoming familiar with was a mere rat .

At first [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was too much alarmed to do anything but huddle in a heap upon the bed and tuck up [her]40-ermengarde feet , but the sight of [Sara]18-sara 's composed little countenance and the story of [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec 's first appearance began at last to rouse [her]40-ermengarde curiosity , and [she]40-ermengarde leaned forward over the edge of the bed and watched [Sara]18-sara go and kneel down by the hole in the skirting board .

" [He]2367-a rat [he]2367-a rat wo n't run out quickly and jump on the bed , will [he]2367-a rat ? "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said .

" No , "[18-sara] answered [Sara]18-sara . " [He]2367-a rat 's as polite as [we]2368-we are . [He]2367-a rat is just like [a person]2369-a person . Now watch ! "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara began to make a low , whistling sound so low and coaxing that it could only have been heard in entire stillness . [She]18-sara did it several times , looking entirely absorbed in it . [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde thought [she]18-sara looked as if [she]18-sara were working a spell . And at last , evidently in response to it , a gray - whiskered , bright - eyed head peeped out of the hole . [Sara]18-sara had some crumbs in [her]18-sara hand . [She]18-sara dropped them , and [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec came quietly forth and ate them . A piece of larger size than the rest [he]924-he took and carried in the most businesslike manner back to [[his]924-he home]925-his home .

" [You]18-sara see , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , " that is for [[his]924-he wife]2370-his wife and [children]163-children . [He]924-he is very nice . [He]924-he only eats the little bits . After [he]924-he goes back [I]18-sara can always hear [[his]924-he family]2360-his family squeaking for joy . There are three kinds of squeaks . One kind is [the children]490-the children 's , and one is [Mrs. Melchisedec]73-melchisedec 's , and one is [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec 's own . "[18-sara]

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde began to laugh .

" Oh , [Sara]18-sara ! "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said . " [You]18-sara ARE queer but [you]18-sara are nice . "[40-ermengarde]

" [I]18-sara know [I]18-sara am queer , "[18-sara] admitted [Sara]18-sara , cheerfully ; " and [I]18-sara TRY to be nice . "[18-sara] [She]40-ermengarde rubbed [her]40-ermengarde forehead with [her]40-ermengarde little brown paw , and a puzzled , tender look came into [her]40-ermengarde face . " [Papa]20-papa always laughed at [me]40-ermengarde , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said ; " but [I]40-ermengarde liked it . If [I]40-ermengarde did n't , [I]40-ermengarde do n't believe [I]40-ermengarde could live . "[40-ermengarde] [She]40-ermengarde paused and glanced around [the attic]606-the attic . " [I]40-ermengarde 'm sure [I]40-ermengarde could n't live [here]1824-here , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde added in a low voice .

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was interested , as [she]40-ermengarde always was . " When [you]18-sara talk about things , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said , " they seem as if they grew real . " [He]2375-he IS [a person]2369-a person , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " [He]2375-he gets hungry and frightened , just as [we]2378-we do ; and [he]2375-he is married and has [children]163-children . That was why [I]18-sara gave [him]2375-he a name . "[18-sara]

[She]40-ermengarde sat down on the floor in [her]40-ermengarde favorite attitude , holding [her]40-ermengarde knees .

" Besides , "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde said , " [he]2375-he is [a Bastille rat sent to be [[my]40-ermengarde friend]1846-my friend]2381-a bastille rat sent to be my friend . " Is it [the Bastille]52-the bastille yet ? "[40-ermengarde] asked [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde , eagerly . " Do [you]18-sara always pretend [it]52-the bastille is [the Bastille]52-the bastille ? "[40-ermengarde]

" Nearly always , "[18-sara] answered [Sara]18-sara . " Sometimes [I]18-sara try to pretend [it]52-the bastille is another kind of place ; but [the Bastille]52-the bastille is generally easiest particularly when it is cold . "[18-sara]

Just at that moment [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde almost jumped off the bed , [she]40-ermengarde was so startled by a sound [she]40-ermengarde heard . It was like two distinct knocks on the wall .

" What is that ? "[40-ermengarde] [she]40-ermengarde exclaimed .

[Sara]18-sara got up from the floor and answered quite dramatically :

" It is [the prisoner in [the next cell]2313-the next cell]2312-the prisoner in the next cell . "[18-sara]

" [Becky]48-becky ! "[40-ermengarde] cried [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde , enraptured .

" Yes , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " Listen ; the two knocks meant , ' [Prisoner]2386-prisoner , are [you]48-becky there ? ' "[18-sara]

[She]40-ermengarde knocked three times on the wall [herself]40-ermengarde , as if in answer .

" That means , ' Yes , [I]40-ermengarde am here , and all is well . ' "[40-ermengarde]

Four knocks came from [Becky]48-becky 's side of the wall .

" That means , "[18-sara] explained [Sara]18-sara , " ' Then , [fellow - sufferer]2387-fellow - sufferer , [we]2388-we will sleep in peace . Good night . ' "[18-sara]

[Ermengarde]40-ermengarde quite beamed with delight .

And [she]40-ermengarde sat down again and talked until [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde forgot that [she]40-ermengarde was [a sort of escaped prisoner]927-a sort of escaped prisoner [herself]40-ermengarde , and had to be reminded by [Sara]18-sara that [she]40-ermengarde could not remain in [the Bastille]2357-the bastille all night , but must steal noiselessly [downstairs]265-downstairs again and creep back into [her]40-ermengarde deserted bed .

10

[The Indian Gentleman]930-the indian gentleman

But it was a perilous thing for [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde and [Lottie]31-lottie to make pilgrimages to [the attic]606-the attic . [They]932-they could never be quite sure when [Sara]18-sara would be [there]207-there , and [they]932-they could scarcely ever be certain that [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin would not make a tour of inspection through [the bedrooms]514-the bedrooms after [the pupils]294-the pupils were supposed to be asleep . So [their]932-they visits were rare ones , and [Sara]18-sara lived a strange and lonely life . It was a lonelier life when [she]18-sara was [downstairs]265-downstairs than when [she]18-sara was in [[her]18-sara attic]598-her attic . [She]18-sara had [no one]1828-no one to talk to ; and when [she]18-sara was sent out on errands and walked through [the streets]1982-the streets , [a forlorn little figure carrying a basket or a parcel]940-a forlorn little figure carrying a basket or a parcel , trying to hold [her]18-sara hat on when the wind was blowing , and feeling the water soak through [her]18-sara shoes when it was raining , [she]18-sara felt as if the crowds hurrying past [her]18-sara made [her]18-sara loneliness greater . When [she]18-sara had been [the Princess Sara]18-sara , driving through [the streets]1982-the streets in [her]18-sara brougham , or walking , attended by [Mariette]32-mariette , the sight of [her]18-sara bright , eager little face and picturesque coats and hats had often caused [people]157-people to look after [her]18-sara . [A happy , beautifully cared for little girl]943-a happy , beautifully cared for little girl naturally attracts attention . [Shabby , poorly dressed children]944-shabby , poorly dressed children are not rare enough and pretty enough to make [people]157-people turn around to look at [them]944-shabby , poorly dressed children and smile . [No one]1828-no one looked at [Sara]18-sara in these days , and [no one]1828-no one seemed to see [her]18-sara as [she]18-sara hurried along [the crowded pavements]948-the crowded pavements . [She]18-sara had begun to grow very fast , and , as [she]18-sara was dressed only in such clothes as the plainer remnants of [her]18-sara wardrobe would supply , [she]18-sara knew [she]18-sara looked very queer , indeed . All [her]18-sara valuable garments had been disposed of , and such as had been left for [her]18-sara use [she]18-sara was expected to wear so long as [she]18-sara could put them on at all . Sometimes , when [she]18-sara passed a shop window with a mirror in it , [she]18-sara almost laughed outright on catching a glimpse of [herself]18-sara , and sometimes [her]18-sara face went red and [she]18-sara bit [her]18-sara lip and turned away .

In the evening , when [she]18-sara passed houses whose windows were lighted up , [she]18-sara used to look into [the warm rooms]949-the warm rooms and amuse [herself]18-sara by imagining things about [the people [she]18-sara saw sitting before the fires or about the tables]950-the people she saw sitting before the fires or about the tables . It always interested [her]18-sara to catch glimpses of [rooms]951-rooms before the shutters were closed . There were [several families in [the square in which [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin lived , with which [she]22-miss minchin had become quite familiar in a way of [her]22-miss minchin own]953-the square in which miss minchin lived , with which she had become quite familiar in a way of her own]952-several families in the square in which miss minchin lived , with which she had become quite familiar in a way of her own . The one [she]22-miss minchin liked best [she]22-miss minchin called [the Large Family]954-the large family . [She]22-miss minchin called it [the Large Family]954-the large family not because [the members of [it]954-the large family]956-the members of it were big for , indeed , most of [them]952-several families in the square in which miss minchin lived , with which she had become quite familiar in a way of her own were little but because there were so many of [them]952-several families in the square in which miss minchin lived , with which she had become quite familiar in a way of her own . There were [eight children in [the Large Family]954-the large family]957-eight children in the large family , and [a stout , rosy mother]959-a stout , rosy mother , and [a stout , rosy father]960-a stout , rosy father , and [a stout , rosy grandmother]961-a stout , rosy grandmother , and [any number of [servants]963-servants]962-any number of servants . [The eight children]964-the eight children were always either being taken out to walk or to ride in perambulators by [comfortable nurses]965-comfortable nurses , or [they]964-the eight children were going to drive with [[their]964-the eight children mamma]966-their mamma , or [they]964-the eight children were flying to the door in the evening to meet [[their]964-the eight children papa]967-their papa and kiss [him]967-their papa and dance around [him]967-their papa and drag off [his]967-their papa overcoat and look in the pockets for packages , or [they]964-the eight children were crowding about the nursery windows and looking out and pushing [each other]156-each other and laughing in fact , [they]964-the eight children were always doing something enjoyable and suited to the tastes of [a large family]969-a large family . [Sara]18-sara was quite fond of [them]964-the eight children , and had given [them]964-the eight children names out of books quite romantic names . [She]18-sara called [them]964-the eight children [the Montmorencys]74-the montmorencys when [she]18-sara did not call [them]964-the eight children [the Large Family]954-the large family . [The fat , fair baby with the lace cap]971-the fat , fair baby with the lace cap was [Ethelberta Beauchamp Montmorency]75-ethelberta beauchamp montmorency ; [the next baby]972-the next baby was [Violet Cholmondeley Montmorency]76-violet cholmondeley montmorency ; [the little boy who could just stagger and who had such round legs]973-the little boy who could just stagger and who had such round legs was [Sydney Cecil Vivian Montmorency]77-sydney cecil vivian montmorency ; and then came [Lilian Evangeline Maud Marion]78-lilian evangeline maud marion , [Rosalind Gladys]79-rosalind gladys , [Guy Clarence]80-guy clarence , [Veronica Eustacia]81-veronica eustacia , and [Claude Harold Hector]82-claude harold hector .

One evening a very funny thing happened though , perhaps , in one sense it was not a funny thing at all .

[Several of [the Montmorencys]74-the montmorencys]974-several of the montmorencys were evidently going to a [children]163-children 's party , and just as [Sara]18-sara was about to pass the door [they]974-several of the montmorencys were crossing [the pavement]478-the pavement to get into [the carriage]977-the carriage which was waiting for [them]974-several of the montmorencys . [Veronica Eustacia]81-veronica eustacia and [Rosalind Gladys]79-rosalind gladys , in white - lace frocks and lovely sashes , had just got in , and [Guy Clarence]80-guy clarence , aged five , was following [them]974-several of the montmorencys . [He]80-guy clarence was such [a pretty fellow and had such rosy cheeks and blue eyes]978-a pretty fellow and had such rosy cheeks and blue eyes , and such a darling little round head covered with curls , that [Sara]18-sara forgot [her]18-sara basket and shabby cloak altogether in fact , forgot everything but that [she]18-sara wanted to look at [him]80-guy clarence for a moment . So [she]18-sara paused and looked .

It was Christmas time , and [the Large Family]954-the large family had been hearing many stories about [children who were poor and had no mammas and [papas]981-papas to fill [their]980-children who were poor and had no mammas and papas to fill their stockings and take them to the pantomime children who were , in fact , cold and thinly clad and hungry stockings and take [them]980-children who were poor and had no mammas and papas to fill their stockings and take them to the pantomime children who were , in fact , cold and thinly clad and hungry to [the pantomime children who were , in fact , cold and thinly clad and hungry]982-the pantomime children who were , in fact , cold and thinly clad and hungry]980-children who were poor and had no mammas and papas to fill their stockings and take them to the pantomime children who were , in fact , cold and thinly clad and hungry . In the stories , [kind people]983-kind people sometimes [little boys]984-little boys and [girls with tender hearts]985-girls with tender hearts invariably saw [the poor children]986-the poor children and gave [them]986-the poor children money or rich gifts , or took [them]986-the poor children [home]437-home to beautiful dinners . [Guy Clarence]80-guy clarence had been affected to tears that very afternoon by the reading of such a story , and [he]80-guy clarence had burned with a desire to find [such a poor child]988-such a poor child and give [her]988-such a poor child a certain sixpence [he]80-guy clarence possessed , and thus provide for [her]988-such a poor child for life . An entire sixpence , [he]80-guy clarence was sure , would mean affluence for evermore . As [he]80-guy clarence crossed the strip of red carpet laid across [the pavement]478-the pavement from the door to [the carriage]977-the carriage , [he]80-guy clarence had this very sixpence in the pocket of [his]80-guy clarence very short man - o - war trousers ; And just as [Rosalind Gladys]79-rosalind gladys got into [the vehicle]991-the vehicle and jumped on the seat in order to feel the cushions spring under [her]992-her , [he]80-guy clarence saw [Sara]18-sara standing on the wet pavement in [her]18-sara shabby frock and hat , with [her]18-sara old basket on [her]18-sara arm , looking at [him]80-guy clarence hungrily .

[He]80-guy clarence thought that [her]18-sara eyes looked hungry because [she]18-sara had perhaps had nothing to eat for a long time . [He]80-guy clarence did not know that they looked so because [she]18-sara was hungry for the warm , merry life [[his]80-guy clarence home]925-his home held and [his]80-guy clarence rosy face spoke of , and that [she]18-sara had a hungry wish to snatch [him]80-guy clarence in [her]18-sara arms and kiss [him]80-guy clarence . [He]80-guy clarence only knew that [she]18-sara had big eyes and a thin face and thin legs and a common basket and poor clothes . So [he]80-guy clarence put [his]80-guy clarence hand in [his]80-guy clarence pocket and found [his]80-guy clarence sixpence and walked up to [her]18-sara benignly .

" Here , [poor little girl]2390-poor little girl , "[80-guy clarence] [he]80-guy clarence said . " Here is a sixpence . [I]80-guy clarence will give it to [you]2390-poor little girl . "[80-guy clarence]

[Sara]18-sara started , and all at once realized that [she]18-sara looked exactly like [poor children [she]18-sara had seen]994-poor children she had seen , in [her]18-sara better days , waiting on [the pavement]478-the pavement to watch [her]18-sara as [she]18-sara got out of [her]18-sara brougham . And [she]18-sara had given [them]994-poor children she had seen pennies many a time . [Her]18-sara face went red and then it went pale , and for a second [she]18-sara felt as if [she]18-sara could not take the dear little sixpence .

" Oh , no ! "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " Oh , no , thank [you]80-guy clarence ; [I]18-sara must n't take it , indeed ! "[18-sara]

[Her]18-sara voice was so unlike [an ordinary street child]996-an ordinary street child 's voice and [her]18-sara manner was so like the manner of [a well - bred little person]997-a well - bred little person that [Veronica Eustacia]81-veronica eustacia whose real name was [Janet]83-janet and [Rosalind Gladys]79-rosalind gladys who was really called [Nora]84-nora leaned forward to listen .

But [Guy Clarence]80-guy clarence was not to be thwarted in [his]80-guy clarence benevolence . [He]80-guy clarence thrust the sixpence into [her]18-sara hand .

" Yes , [you]18-sara must take it , [poor little girl]2390-poor little girl ! "[80-guy clarence] [he]80-guy clarence insisted stoutly . " [You]18-sara can buy things to eat with [it]2392-it . It is a whole sixpence ! "[80-guy clarence]

There was something so honest and kind in [his]80-guy clarence face , and [he]80-guy clarence looked so likely to be heartbrokenly disappointed if [she]18-sara did not take it , that [Sara]18-sara knew [she]18-sara must not refuse [him]80-guy clarence . To be as proud as that would be a cruel thing . So [she]18-sara actually put [her]18-sara pride in [her]18-sara pocket , though it must be admitted [her]18-sara cheeks burned .

" Thank [you]80-guy clarence , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " [You]80-guy clarence are [a kind , kind little darling thing]2393-a kind , kind little darling thing . "[18-sara] And as [he]80-guy clarence scrambled joyfully into [the carriage]977-the carriage [she]18-sara went away , trying to smile , though [she]18-sara caught [her]18-sara breath quickly and [her]18-sara eyes were shining through a mist . [She]18-sara had known that [she]18-sara looked odd and shabby , but until now [she]18-sara had not known that [she]18-sara might be taken for [a beggar]390-a beggar .

As [the Large Family]954-the large family 's carriage drove away , [the children inside [it]977-the carriage]1001-the children inside it were talking with interested excitement .

" Oh , [Donald]85-donald , "[80-guy clarence] this was [Guy Clarence]80-guy clarence 's name , [Janet]83-janet exclaimed alarmedly , " why did [you]85-donald offer [that little girl]2394-that little girl [your]85-donald sixpence ? [I]83-janet 'm sure [she]2394-that little girl is not [a beggar]390-a beggar ! "[83-janet]

" [She]2394-that little girl did n't speak like [a beggar]390-a beggar ! "[84-nora] cried [Nora]84-nora . " And [her]2394-that little girl face did n't really look like [a beggar]390-a beggar 's face ! "[84-nora]

" Besides , [she]2394-that little girl did n't beg , "[83-janet] said [Janet]83-janet . " [I]83-janet was so afraid [she]2394-that little girl might be angry with [you]85-donald . [You]85-donald know , it makes [people]157-people angry to be taken for [beggars]2320-beggars when [they]157-people are not [beggars]2320-beggars . "[83-janet]

" [She]2394-that little girl was n't angry , "[85-donald] said [Donald]85-donald , a trifle dismayed , but still firm . " [She]2394-that little girl laughed a little , and [she]2394-that little girl said [I]85-donald was a kind , kind little darling thing . And [I]85-donald was ! "[85-donald] stoutly . " It was [my]85-donald whole sixpence . "[85-donald]

[Janet]83-janet and [Nora]84-nora exchanged glances .

" [A beggar girl]2401-a beggar girl would never have said that , "[83-janet] decided [Janet]83-janet . " [She]2394-that little girl would have said , ' Thank [yer]85-donald kindly , [little gentleman]2402-little gentleman thank [yer]85-donald , [sir]2403-sir ; ' and perhaps [she]2394-that little girl would have bobbed a curtsy . "[83-janet]

[Sara]18-sara knew nothing about the fact , but from that time [the Large Family]954-the large family was as profoundly interested in [her]18-sara as [she]18-sara was in it . [Faces]86-faces used to appear at the nursery windows when [she]18-sara passed , and many discussions concerning [her]18-sara were held round the fire .

" [She]18-sara is [a kind of servant at [the seminary]205-the seminary]2404-a kind of servant at the seminary , "[83-janet] [Janet]83-janet said . " [I]83-janet do n't believe [she]18-sara belongs to [anybody]2406-anybody . [I]83-janet believe [she]18-sara is [an orphan]2407-an orphan . But [she]18-sara is not [a beggar]390-a beggar , however shabby [she]18-sara looks . "[83-janet]

And afterward [she]18-sara was called by [all of [them]1003-all of them]1003-all of them , " [The - little - girl - who - is - not - a - beggar]2409-the - little - girl - who - is - not - a - beggar , "[18-sara] which was , of course , rather a long name , and sounded very funny sometimes when [the youngest ones]1004-the youngest ones said it in a hurry .

[Sara]18-sara managed to bore a hole in the sixpence and hung it on an old bit of narrow ribbon round [her]18-sara neck . [Her]18-sara affection for [the Large Family]954-the large family increased as , indeed , [her]18-sara affection for everything [she]18-sara could love increased . [She]18-sara grew fonder and fonder of [Becky]48-becky , and [she]18-sara used to look forward to the two mornings a week when [she]18-sara went into [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom to give [the little ones]403-the little ones [their]403-the little ones French lesson . [[Her]18-sara small pupils]1008-her small pupils loved [her]18-sara , and strove with each other for the privilege of standing close to [her]18-sara and insinuating [their]1008-her small pupils small hands into [hers]18-sara . It fed [her]18-sara hungry heart to feel them nestling up to [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara made such friends with the sparrows that when [she]18-sara stood upon the table , put [her]18-sara head and shoulders out of the attic window , and chirped , [she]18-sara heard almost immediately a flutter of wings and answering twitters , and a little flock of dingy town birds appeared and alighted on the slates to talk to [her]18-sara and make much of the crumbs [she]18-sara scattered . With [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec [she]18-sara had become so intimate that [he]1009-he actually brought [Mrs. Melchisedec]73-melchisedec with [him]1009-he sometimes , and now and then [one or two of [[his]1009-he children]2361-his children]1010-one or two of his children . [She]18-sara used to talk to [him]1009-he , and , somehow , [he]1009-he looked quite as if [he]1009-he understood .

There had grown in [her]18-sara mind rather a strange feeling about [Emily]27-emily , who always sat and looked on at everything . It arose in one of [her]18-sara moments of great desolateness . [She]18-sara would have liked to believe or pretend to believe that [Emily]27-emily understood and sympathized with [her]27-emily . [She]18-sara did not like to own to [herself]18-sara that [[her]18-sara only companion]1012-her only companion could feel and hear nothing . [She]18-sara used to put [her]27-emily in a chair sometimes and sit opposite to [her]27-emily on the old red footstool , and stare and pretend about [her]27-emily until [her]18-sara own eyes would grow large with something which was almost like fear particularly at night when everything was so still , when the only sound in [the attic]606-the attic was the occasional sudden scurry and squeak of [[Melchisedec]73-melchisedec 's family]1014-melchisedec 's family in the wall . One of [her]18-sara " pretends "[18-sara] was that [Emily]27-emily was [a kind of good witch who could protect [her]27-emily]1015-a kind of good witch who could protect her . Sometimes , after [she]18-sara had stared at [her]27-emily until [she]18-sara was wrought up to the highest pitch of fancifulness , [she]18-sara would ask [her]18-sara questions and find [herself]18-sara ALMOST feeling as if [she]18-sara would presently answer . But [she]18-sara never did .

" As to answering , though , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , trying to console [herself]18-sara , " [I]18-sara do n't answer very often . [I]18-sara never answer when [I]18-sara can help it . When [people]157-people are insulting [you]18-sara , there is nothing so good for [them]157-people as not to say a word just to look at [them]157-people and THINK . [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin turns pale with rage when [I]18-sara do it , [Miss Amelia]22-miss minchin looks frightened , and so do [the girls]645-the girls . When [you]18-sara will not fly into a passion [people]157-people know [you]18-sara are stronger than [they]157-people are , because [you]18-sara are strong enough to hold in [your]18-sara rage , and [they]157-people are not , and [they]157-people say stupid things [they]157-people wish [they]157-people had n't said afterward . There 's nothing so strong as rage , except what makes [you]18-sara hold it in that 's stronger . It 's a good thing not to answer [[your]18-sara enemies]2413-your enemies . [I]18-sara scarcely ever do . Perhaps [Emily]27-emily is more like [me]18-sara than [I]18-sara am like [myself]18-sara . Perhaps [she]27-emily would rather not answer [[her]27-emily friends]2414-her friends , even . [She]27-emily keeps it all in [her]27-emily heart . "[18-sara]

But though [she]1016-she tried to satisfy [herself]1016-she with these arguments , [she]1016-she did not find it easy . When , after a long , hard day , in which [she]1016-she had been sent here and there , sometimes on long errands through wind and cold and rain , [she]1016-she came in wet and hungry , and was sent out again because [nobody]622-nobody chose to remember that [she]1016-she was only [a child]202-a child , and that [her]1016-she slim legs might be tired and [her]1016-she small body might be chilled ; when [she]1016-she had been given only harsh words and cold , slighting looks for thanks ; when [the cook]2053-the cook had been vulgar and insolent ; when [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin had been in [her]22-miss minchin worst mood , and when [she]22-miss minchin had seen [the girls]645-the girls sneering among [themselves]645-the girls at [her]1016-she shabbiness then [she]22-miss minchin was not always able to comfort [her]22-miss minchin sore , proud , desolate heart with fancies when [Emily]27-emily merely sat upright in [her]27-emily old chair and stared .

One of these nights , when [she]1016-she came up to [the attic]606-the attic cold and hungry , with a tempest raging in [her]1016-she young breast , [Emily]27-emily 's stare seemed so vacant , [her]1016-she sawdust legs and arms so inexpressive , that [Sara]18-sara lost all control over [herself]18-sara . There was [nobody]622-nobody but [Emily]27-emily [no one in [the world]137-the world]1023-no one in the world . And there [she]1016-she sat .

" [I]1016-she shall die presently , "[1016-she] [she]1016-she said at first .

[Emily]27-emily simply stared .

" [I]1025-the poor child ca n't bear this , "[1025-the poor child] said [the poor child]1025-the poor child , trembling . " [I]1025-the poor child know [I]1025-the poor child shall die . [I]1025-the poor child 'm cold ; [I]1025-the poor child 'm wet ; [I]1025-the poor child 'm starving to death . [I]1025-the poor child 've walked a thousand miles today , and [they]2415-they have done nothing but scold [me]1025-the poor child from morning until night . And because [I]1025-the poor child could not find that last thing [the cook]2053-the cook sent [me]1025-the poor child for , [they]2415-they would not give [me]1025-the poor child any supper . [Some men]2417-some men laughed at [me]1025-the poor child because [my]1025-the poor child old shoes made [me]1025-the poor child slip down in the mud . [I]1025-the poor child 'm covered with mud now . And [they]2417-some men laughed . Do [you]27-emily hear ? "[1025-the poor child]

[She]1026-she looked at the staring glass eyes and complacent face , and suddenly a sort of heartbroken rage seized [her]1026-she . [She]1026-she lifted [her]1026-she little savage hand and knocked [Emily]27-emily off the chair , bursting into a passion of sobbing [Sara]18-sara who never cried .

" [You]27-emily are nothing but [a DOLL]2418-a doll ! "[1026-she] [she]1026-she cried . " Nothing but [a doll doll doll]2419-a doll doll doll ! [You]27-emily care for nothing . [You]27-emily are stuffed with sawdust . [You]27-emily never had a heart . Nothing could ever make [you]27-emily feel . [You]27-emily are [a DOLL]2418-a doll ! "[1026-she] [Emily]27-emily lay on the floor , with [her]27-emily legs ignominiously doubled up over [her]27-emily head , and a new flat place on the end of [her]27-emily nose ; but [she]27-emily was calm , even dignified . [Sara]18-sara hid [her]18-sara face in [her]18-sara arms . The rats in the wall began to fight and bite each other and squeak and scramble . [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec was chastising [some of [[his]1028-his family]2360-his family]1027-some of his family .

[Sara]18-sara 's sobs gradually quieted [themselves]1030-themselves . It was so unlike [her]18-sara to break down that [she]18-sara was surprised at [herself]18-sara . After a while [she]18-sara raised [her]18-sara face and looked at [Emily]27-emily , who seemed to be gazing at [her]18-sara round the side of one angle , and , somehow , by this time actually with a kind of glassy - eyed sympathy . [Sara]18-sara bent and picked [her]27-emily up . [Remorse]87-remorse overtook [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara even smiled at [herself]18-sara a very little smile .

" [You]18-sara ca n't help being [a doll]2418-a doll , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said with a resigned sigh , " any more than [Lavinia]30-lavinia and [Jessie]33-jessie can help not having any sense . [We]2422-we are not [all made alike]2423-all made alike . Perhaps [you]18-sara do [your]18-sara sawdust best . "[18-sara] And [she]18-sara kissed [her]27-emily and shook [her]27-emily clothes straight , and put [her]27-emily back upon [her]27-emily chair .

[She]18-sara had wished very much that [some one]539-some one would take [the empty house next door]1032-the empty house next door . [She]18-sara wished it because of the attic window which was so near [hers]18-sara . It seemed as if it would be so nice to see [it]1033-it propped open someday and a head and shoulders rising out of the square aperture .

" If it looked a nice head , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara thought , " [I]18-sara might begin by saying , ' Good morning , ' and all sorts of things might happen . But , of course , it 's not really likely that [anyone but under]2424-anyone but under [servants]963-servants would sleep [there]207-there . "[18-sara]

One morning , on turning the corner of [the square]259-the square after a visit to [[the grocer]1035-the grocer 's , [the butcher]1037-the butcher 's]1036-the grocer 's , the butcher 's , and [the baker]1038-the baker 's , [she]18-sara saw , to [her]18-sara great delight , that during [her]18-sara rather prolonged absence , [a van]1039-a van full of furniture had stopped before [the next house]1040-the next house , the front doors were thrown open , and [men in shirt sleeves]1041-men in shirt sleeves were going in and out carrying heavy packages and pieces of furniture .

" It 's taken ! "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " It really IS taken ! Oh , [I]18-sara do hope a nice head will look out of the attic window ! "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara would almost have liked to join the group of [loiterers who had stopped on the pavement to watch the things carried in]1042-loiterers who had stopped on the pavement to watch the things carried in . [She]18-sara had an idea that if [she]18-sara could see some of the furniture [she]18-sara could guess something about [the people it belonged to]1043-the people it belonged to .

" [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's tables and chairs are just like [her]22-miss minchin , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara thought ; " [I]18-sara remember thinking that the first minute [I]18-sara saw [her]22-miss minchin , even though [I]18-sara was so little . [I]18-sara told [papa]1809-papa afterward , and [he]1809-papa laughed and said it was true . [I]18-sara am sure [the Large Family]954-the large family have fat , comfortable armchairs and sofas , and [I]18-sara can see that [their]954-the large family red - flowery wallpaper is exactly like them . It 's warm and cheerful and kind - looking and happy . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara was sent out for parsley to [the greengrocer]1044-the greengrocer 's later in the day , and when [she]18-sara came up [the area]1045-the area steps [her]18-sara heart gave quite a quick beat of recognition . Several pieces of furniture had been set out of [the van]1046-the van upon [the pavement]478-the pavement . There was a beautiful table of elaborately wrought teakwood , and some chairs , and a screen covered with rich Oriental embroidery . The sight of them gave [her]18-sara a weird , homesick feeling . [She]18-sara had seen things so like them in [India]3-india . One of the things [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin had taken from [her]22-miss minchin was a carved teakwood desk [[her]22-miss minchin father]129-her father had sent [her]22-miss minchin .

" [They]2429-they are beautiful things , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said ; " they look as if they ought to belong to [a nice person]2430-a nice person . All the things look rather grand . [I]18-sara suppose it is [a rich family]2431-a rich family . "[18-sara]

The vans of furniture came and were unloaded and gave place to [others]1049-others all the day . Several times it so happened that [Sara]18-sara had an opportunity of seeing things carried in . It became plain that [she]18-sara had been right in guessing that [the newcomers]1050-the newcomers were [people of large means]1051-people of large means . All the furniture was rich and beautiful , and a great deal of it was Oriental . Wonderful rugs and draperies and ornaments were taken from [the vans]1052-the vans , many pictures , and books enough for [a library]1053-a library . Among other things there was a superb god Buddha in [a splendid shrine]1054-a splendid shrine .

" [Someone in the family]2432-someone in the family MUST have been in [India]3-india , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara thought . " [They]1050-the newcomers have got used to Indian things and like them . [I]18-sara AM glad . [I]18-sara shall feel as if [they]1050-the newcomers were [friends]1940-friends , even if a head never looks out of the attic window . "[18-sara]

When [she]18-sara was taking in the evening 's milk for [the cook]2053-the cook there was really no odd job [she]18-sara was not called upon to do , [she]18-sara saw something occur which made the situation more interesting than ever . [The handsome , rosy man who was [the father of [the Large Family]954-the large family]1057-the father of the large family]1056-the handsome , rosy man who was the father of the large family walked across [the square]259-the square in the most matter - of - fact manner , and ran up the steps of [the next - door house]1060-the next - door house . [He]1056-the handsome , rosy man who was the father of the large family ran up [them]1061-them as if [he]1056-the handsome , rosy man who was the father of the large family felt quite at [home]437-home and expected to run up and down [them]1061-them many a time in the future . [He]1056-the handsome , rosy man who was the father of the large family stayed inside quite a long time , and several times came out and gave directions to [the workmen]1063-the workmen , as if [he]1056-the handsome , rosy man who was the father of the large family had a right to do so . It was quite certain that [he]1056-the handsome , rosy man who was the father of the large family was in some intimate way connected with [the newcomers]1050-the newcomers and was acting for [them]1050-the newcomers .

" If [the new people]2434-the new people have [children]163-children , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara speculated , " [the Large Family children]2436-the large family children will be sure to come and play with [them]2436-the large family children , and [they]2436-the large family children MIGHT come up into [the attic]606-the attic just for fun . "[18-sara]

At night , after [her]18-sara work was done , [Becky]48-becky came in to see [[her]48-becky fellow prisoner]1065-her fellow prisoner and bring [her]48-becky news .

" It 's [a ' Nindian gentleman that 's comin ' to live next door]2438-a ' nindian gentleman that 's comin ' to live next door , [miss]2018-miss , "[48-becky] [she]48-becky said . " [I]48-becky do n't know whether [he]2438-a ' nindian gentleman that 's comin ' to live next door 's [a black gentleman]2440-a black gentleman or not , but [he]2438-a ' nindian gentleman that 's comin ' to live next door 's [a Nindian one]2441-a nindian one . [He]2438-a ' nindian gentleman that 's comin ' to live next door 's had a lot of trouble , an ' it 's made [him]2438-a ' nindian gentleman that 's comin ' to live next door ill an ' low in [his]2438-a ' nindian gentleman that 's comin ' to live next door mind .
