[Sara]18-sara laughed a little .

" [I]18-sara do n't believe [he]2438-a ' nindian gentleman that 's comin ' to live next door worships that idol , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said ; ' [some people]455-some people like to keep [them]455-some people to look at because [they]455-some people are interesting . [[My]0-i papa]2236-my papa had a beautiful one , and [he]2236-my papa did not worship it . "[2236-my papa]

But [Becky]48-becky was rather inclined to prefer to believe that [the new neighbor]1068-the new neighbor was " an ' eathen . "[1068-the new neighbor] It sounded so much more romantic than that [he]1068-the new neighbor should merely be [the ordinary kind of gentleman who went to church with a prayer book]1069-the ordinary kind of gentleman who went to church with a prayer book . [She]48-becky sat and talked long that night of what [he]1068-the new neighbor would be like , of what [[his]1068-the new neighbor wife]2370-his wife would be like if [he]1068-the new neighbor had [one]134-one , and of what [[his]1068-the new neighbor children]2361-his children would be like if [they]2361-his children had [children]163-children . [Sara]18-sara saw that privately [she]18-sara could not help hoping very much that [they]2361-his children would all be black , and would wear turbans , and , above all , that like [[their]2361-his children parent]1074-their parent [they]2361-his children would all be " ' eathens . "[18-sara]

" [I]18-sara never lived next door to [no ' eathens]2447-no ' eathens , [miss]2018-miss , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said ; " [I]18-sara should like to see what sort o ' ways [they]2361-his children 'd have . "[18-sara]

It was several weeks before [her]18-sara curiosity was satisfied , and then it was revealed that [the new occupant]1075-the new occupant had [neither wife]1076-neither wife nor [children]163-children . [He]1075-the new occupant was [a solitary man with [no family at all]1079-no family at all]1078-a solitary man with no family at all , and it was evident that [he]1075-the new occupant was shattered in health and unhappy in mind .

[A carriage]211-a carriage drove up one day and stopped before [the house]170-the house . When [the footman]1082-the footman dismounted from the box and opened the door [the gentleman who was [the father of [the Large Family]954-the large family]1057-the father of the large family]1083-the gentleman who was the father of the large family got out first . After [him]1075-the new occupant there descended [a nurse in uniform]1086-a nurse in uniform , then came down the steps [two men]1087-two men - [servants]963-servants . [They]1087-two men came to assist [[their]1087-two men master , who , when [he]1089-their master , who , when he was helped out of the carriage was helped out of [the carriage]977-the carriage]1089-their master , who , when he was helped out of the carriage , proved to be [a man with a haggard , distressed face , and a skeleton body wrapped in furs]1091-a man with a haggard , distressed face , and a skeleton body wrapped in furs . [He]1089-their master , who , when he was helped out of the carriage was carried up the steps , and [the head of [the Large Family]954-the large family]1092-the head of the large family went with [him]1089-their master , who , when he was helped out of the carriage , looking very anxious . Shortly afterward [[a doctor]1094-a doctor 's carriage]1095-a doctor 's carriage arrived , and [the doctor]1096-the doctor went in plainly to take care of [him]1089-their master , who , when he was helped out of the carriage .

" There is such [a yellow gentleman next door]2449-a yellow gentleman next door , [Sara]18-sara , "[31-lottie] [Lottie]31-lottie whispered at [the French class afterward]1097-the french class afterward . " Do [you]18-sara think [he]2449-a yellow gentleman next door is [a Chinee]2450-a chinee ? [The geography]2451-the geography says [the Chinee men]2452-the chinee men are yellow . "[31-lottie]

" No , [he]2449-a yellow gentleman next door is [not Chinese]2453-not chinese , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara whispered back ; " [he]2449-a yellow gentleman next door is very ill . Go on with [your]18-sara exercise , [Lottie]31-lottie . ' Non , [monsieur]311-monsieur . Je n'ai pas le canif de mon oncle . ' "[18-sara]

That was the beginning of the story of [the Indian gentleman]930-the indian gentleman .

11

Ram Dass

There were fine sunsets even in [the square]259-the square , sometimes . [One]134-one could only see parts of them , however , between the chimneys and over the roofs . From the kitchen windows [one]134-one could not see them at all , and could only guess that they were going on because the bricks looked warm and the air rosy or yellow for a while , or perhaps one saw a blazing glow strike a particular pane of glass somewhere . There was , however , one place from which [one]134-one could see all the splendor of them : the piles of red or gold clouds in the west ; or the purple ones edged with dazzling brightness ; or the little fleecy , floating ones , tinged with rose - color and looking like flights of pink doves scurrying across the blue in a great hurry if there was a wind . The place where [one]134-one could see all this , and seem at the same time to breathe a purer air , was , of course , the attic window . When [the square]259-the square suddenly seemed to begin to glow in an enchanted way and look wonderful in spite of [its]259-the square sooty trees and railings , [Sara]18-sara knew something was going on in the sky ; and when it was at all possible to leave [the kitchen]484-the kitchen without being missed or called back , [she]18-sara invariably stole away and crept up the flights of stairs , and , climbing on the old table , got [her]18-sara head and body as far out of the window as possible . When [she]18-sara had accomplished this , [she]18-sara always drew a long breath and looked all round [her]18-sara . It used to seem as if [she]18-sara had all the sky and [the world]137-the world to [herself]18-sara . [No one else]1829-no one else ever looked out of the other attics . Generally the skylights were closed ; but even if they were propped open to admit air , [no one]1828-no one seemed to come near [them]1108-them . And there [Sara]18-sara would stand , sometimes turning [her]18-sara face upward to the blue which seemed so friendly and near just like a lovely vaulted ceiling sometimes watching [the west]1109-the west and all the wonderful things that happened there : the clouds melting or drifting or waiting softly to be changed pink or crimson or snow - white or purple or pale dove - gray . Sometimes [they]1110-they made islands or great mountains enclosing [lakes of deep turquoise - blue , or liquid amber , or chrysoprase - green]1111-lakes of deep turquoise - blue , or liquid amber , or chrysoprase - green ; sometimes [dark headlands]1112-dark headlands jutted into [strange , lost seas]1113-strange , lost seas ; sometimes slender strips of [wonderful lands]1114-wonderful lands joined [other wonderful lands]1115-other wonderful lands together . There were places where it seemed that [one]134-one could run or climb or stand and wait to see what next was coming until , perhaps , as it all melted , [one]134-one could float away . At least it seemed so to [Sara]18-sara , and nothing had ever been quite so beautiful to [her]18-sara as the things [she]18-sara saw as [she]18-sara stood on the table [her]18-sara body half out of the skylight the sparrows twittering with sunset softness on the slates . The sparrows always seemed to [her]18-sara to twitter with a sort of subdued softness just when these marvels were going on .

There was such a sunset as this a few days after [the Indian gentleman]930-the indian gentleman was brought to [[his]930-the indian gentleman new [home]437-home]1119-his new home ; and , as it fortunately happened that the afternoon 's work was done in [the kitchen]484-the kitchen and [nobody]622-nobody had ordered [her]18-sara to go anywhere or perform any task , [Sara]18-sara found it easier than usual to slip away and go [upstairs]266-upstairs .

[She]18-sara mounted [her]18-sara table and stood looking out . It was a wonderful moment . There were floods of molten gold covering the west , as if a glorious tide was sweeping over [the world]137-the world . A deep , rich yellow light filled the air ; the birds flying across the tops of [the houses]1125-the houses showed quite black against it .

" It 's [a Splendid one]2455-a splendid one , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , softly , to [herself]18-sara . " It makes [me]18-sara feel almost afraid as if something strange was just going to happen . [The Splendid ones]2456-the splendid ones always make [me]18-sara feel like that . "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara suddenly turned [her]18-sara head because [she]18-sara heard a sound a few yards away from [her]18-sara . It was an odd sound like a queer little squeaky chattering . It came from the window of [the next attic]1126-the next attic . [Someone]1856-someone had come to look at the sunset as [she]18-sara had . There was a head and a part of a body emerging from the skylight , but it was not the head or body of [a little girl]133-a little girl or [a housemaid]631-a housemaid ; it was the picturesque white - swathed form and dark - faced , gleaming - eyed , white - turbaned head of [a native Indian man - servant]1130-a native indian man - servant " [a Lascar]2457-a lascar , "[18-sara] [Sara]18-sara said to [herself]18-sara quickly and the sound [she]18-sara had heard came from a small monkey [he]1130-a native indian man - servant held in [his]1130-a native indian man - servant arms as if [he]1130-a native indian man - servant were fond of it , and which was snuggling and chattering against [his]1130-a native indian man - servant breast .

As [Sara]18-sara looked toward [him]1130-a native indian man - servant [he]1130-a native indian man - servant looked toward [her]18-sara . The first thing [she]18-sara thought was that [his]1130-a native indian man - servant dark face looked sorrowful and homesick . [She]18-sara felt absolutely sure [he]1130-a native indian man - servant had come up to look at the sun , because [he]1130-a native indian man - servant had seen it so seldom in [England]4-england that [he]1130-a native indian man - servant longed for a sight of it . [She]18-sara looked at [him]1130-a native indian man - servant interestedly for a second , and then smiled across the slates . [She]18-sara had learned to know how comforting a smile , even from [a stranger]1131-a stranger , may be .

[Hers]18-sara was evidently a pleasure to [him]1130-a native indian man - servant . [His]1130-a native indian man - servant whole expression altered , and [he]1130-a native indian man - servant showed such gleaming white teeth as [he]1130-a native indian man - servant smiled back that it was as if a light had been illuminated in [his]1130-a native indian man - servant dusky face . The friendly look in [Sara]18-sara 's eyes was always very effective when [people]157-people felt tired or dull .

It was perhaps in making [his]1130-a native indian man - servant salute to [her]18-sara that [he]1130-a native indian man - servant loosened [his]1130-a native indian man - servant hold on the monkey . [He]1130-a native indian man - servant was [an impish monkey]1133-an impish monkey and always ready for adventure , and it is probable that the sight of [a little girl]133-a little girl excited [him]1130-a native indian man - servant . [He]1130-a native indian man - servant suddenly broke loose , jumped on to the slates , ran across [them]1135-them chattering , and actually leaped on to [Sara]18-sara 's shoulder , and from there down into [[her]18-sara attic room]1136-her attic room . It made [her]18-sara laugh and delighted [her]18-sara ; but [she]18-sara knew [he]1130-a native indian man - servant must be restored to [[his]1130-a native indian man - servant master]1137-his master if [the Lascar]88-the lascar was [[his]1130-a native indian man - servant master]1137-his master and [she]18-sara wondered how this was to be done . Would [he]1130-a native indian man - servant let [her]18-sara catch [him]1130-a native indian man - servant , or would [he]1130-a native indian man - servant be naughty and refuse to be caught , and perhaps get away and run off over [the roofs]1139-the roofs and be lost ? That would not do at all . Perhaps [he]1130-a native indian man - servant belonged to [the Indian gentleman]930-the indian gentleman , and [the poor man]1141-the poor man was fond of [him]1130-a native indian man - servant .

[She]18-sara turned to [the Lascar]88-the lascar , feeling glad that [she]18-sara remembered still some of the Hindustani [she]18-sara had learned when [she]18-sara lived with [[her]18-sara father]129-her father . [She]18-sara could make [the man]1143-the man understand . [She]18-sara spoke to [him]1143-the man in the language [he]1143-the man knew .

" Will [he]1143-the man let [me]18-sara catch [him]1143-the man ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara asked .

[She]18-sara thought [she]18-sara had never seen more surprise and delight than the dark face expressed when [she]18-sara spoke in the familiar tongue . The truth was that [the poor fellow]1144-the poor fellow felt as if [[his]1144-the poor fellow gods]1145-his gods had intervened , and the kind little voice came from [heaven]450-heaven itself . At once [Sara]18-sara saw that [he]1143-the man had been accustomed to [European children]1147-european children . [He]1143-the man poured forth a flood of respectful thanks . [He]1143-the man was [the servant of [Missee Sahib]21-missee sahib]1148-the servant of missee sahib . [The monkey]1149-the monkey was [a good monkey]1150-a good monkey and would not bite ; but , unfortunately , [he]1149-the monkey was difficult to catch . [He]1149-the monkey would flee from one spot to another , like the lightning . [He]1149-the monkey was disobedient , though not evil . [Ram Dass]89-ram dass knew [him]1149-the monkey as if [he]1149-the monkey were [[his]89-ram dass child]1151-his child , and [Ram Dass]89-ram dass [he]89-ram dass would sometimes obey , but not always . If [Missee Sahib]21-missee sahib would permit [Ram Dass]89-ram dass , [he]1143-the man [himself]1143-the man could cross the roof to [[her]21-missee sahib room]1957-her room , enter the windows , and regain the unworthy little animal . But [he]1143-the man was evidently afraid [Sara]18-sara might think [he]1143-the man was taking a great liberty and perhaps would not let [him]89-ram dass come .

But [Sara]18-sara gave [him]1143-the man leave at once .

" Can [you]1143-the man get across ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara inquired .

" In a moment , "[1143-the man] [he]1143-the man answered [her]18-sara .

" Then come , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said ; " [he]1143-the man is flying from side to side of [the room]189-the room as if [he]1143-the man was frightened . "[18-sara]

[Ram Dass]89-ram dass slipped through [[his]89-ram dass attic]1153-his attic window and crossed to [hers]21-missee sahib as steadily and lightly as if [he]89-ram dass had walked on [roofs]1154-roofs all [his]89-ram dass life . [He]89-ram dass slipped through the skylight and dropped upon [his]89-ram dass feet without a sound . Then [he]89-ram dass turned to [Sara]18-sara and salaamed again . [The monkey]1149-the monkey saw [him]1143-the man and uttered a little scream . [Ram Dass]89-ram dass hastily took the precaution of shutting the skylight , and then went in chase of [him]1149-the monkey . It was not a very long chase . [The monkey]1149-the monkey prolonged it a few minutes evidently for the mere fun of it , but presently [he]1149-the monkey sprang chattering on to [Ram Dass]89-ram dass 's shoulder and sat there chattering and clinging to [his]1149-the monkey neck with a weird little skinny arm .

[Ram Dass]89-ram dass thanked [Sara]18-sara profoundly . [She]18-sara had seen that [his]89-ram dass quick native eyes had taken in at a glance all the bare shabbiness of [the room]189-the room , but [he]89-ram dass spoke to [her]18-sara as if [he]89-ram dass were speaking to [the little daughter of [a rajah]1159-a rajah]1158-the little daughter of a rajah , and pretended that [he]89-ram dass observed nothing . [He]89-ram dass did not presume to remain more than a few moments after [he]89-ram dass had caught the monkey , and those moments were given to further deep and grateful obeisance to [her]18-sara in return for [her]18-sara indulgence . [This little evil one]1160-this little evil one , [he]89-ram dass said , stroking the monkey , was , in truth , not so evil as [he]89-ram dass seemed , and [[his]89-ram dass master]1137-his master , who was ill , was sometimes amused by [him]89-ram dass . [He]89-ram dass would have been made sad if [his]89-ram dass favorite had run away and been lost . Then [he]89-ram dass salaamed once more and got through the skylight and across [the slates]1162-the slates again with as much agility as [the monkey himself]1163-the monkey himself had displayed .

When [he]89-ram dass had gone [Sara]18-sara stood in the middle of [[her]18-sara attic]598-her attic and thought of many things [his]89-ram dass face and [his]89-ram dass manner had brought back to [her]18-sara . The sight of [his]89-ram dass native costume and the profound reverence of [his]89-ram dass manner stirred all [her]18-sara past memories . It seemed a strange thing to remember that [she]18-sara the drudge whom [the cook had said insulting things to an hour ago]1165-the cook had said insulting things to an hour ago had only a few years ago been surrounded by [people who all treated [her]18-sara as [Ram Dass]89-ram dass had treated [her]18-sara ; who salaamed when [she]18-sara went by , whose foreheads almost touched the ground when [she]18-sara spoke to [them]1166-people who all treated her as ram dass had treated her ; who salaamed when she went by , whose foreheads almost touched the ground when she spoke to them , who were her servants and her slaves , who were [[her]18-sara servants]1167-her servants and [[her]18-sara slaves]1168-her slaves]1166-people who all treated her as ram dass had treated her ; who salaamed when she went by , whose foreheads almost touched the ground when she spoke to them , who were her servants and her slaves . It was like a sort of dream . It was all over , and it could never come back . It certainly seemed that there was no way in which any change could take place . [She]18-sara knew what [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin intended that [her]18-sara future should be . So long as [she]18-sara was too young to be used as [a regular teacher]1169-a regular teacher , [she]18-sara would be used as [an errand girl]1170-an errand girl and [servant]1171-servant and yet expected to remember what [she]18-sara had learned and in some mysterious way to learn more . The greater number of [her]18-sara evenings [she]18-sara was supposed to spend at study , and at various indefinite intervals [she]18-sara was examined and knew [she]18-sara would have been severely admonished if [she]18-sara had not advanced as was expected of [her]18-sara . The truth , indeed , was that [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin knew that [she]18-sara was too anxious to learn to require [teachers]1172-teachers . Give [her]18-sara books , and [she]18-sara would devour them and end by knowing [them]1173-them by heart . [She]18-sara might be trusted to be equal to teaching a good deal in the course of a few years . This was what would happen : when [she]18-sara was older [she]18-sara would be expected to drudge in [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom as [she]18-sara drudged now in [various parts of [the house]170-the house]1175-various parts of the house ; [they]1172-teachers would be obliged to give [her]18-sara more respectable clothes , but [they]1172-teachers would be sure to be plain and ugly and to make [her]18-sara look somehow like [a servant]819-a servant . That was all there seemed to be to look forward to , and [Sara]18-sara stood quite still for several minutes and thought it over .

Then a thought came back to [her]18-sara which made the color rise in [her]18-sara cheek and a spark light itself in [her]18-sara eyes . [She]18-sara straightened [her]18-sara thin little body and lifted [her]18-sara head .

" Whatever comes , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , " can not alter one thing . If [I]18-sara am [a princess in rags and tatters]2459-a princess in rags and tatters , [I]18-sara can be [a princess inside]2460-a princess inside . It would be easy to be [a princess]2033-a princess if [I]18-sara were dressed in cloth of gold , but it is a great deal more of a triumph to be one all the time when [no one]1828-no one knows it . There was [Marie Antoinette]83-janet when [she]83-janet was in [prison]2463-prison and [her]83-janet throne was gone and [she]83-janet had only a black gown on , and [her]83-janet hair was white , and [they]2464-they insulted [her]83-janet and called [her]83-janet [Widow Capet]90-widow capet . [She]83-janet was a great deal more like [a queen]415-a queen then than when [she]83-janet was so gay and everything was so grand . [I]18-sara like [her]83-janet best then . [Those howling mobs of [people]157-people]2466-those howling mobs of people did not frighten [her]83-janet . [She]83-janet was stronger than [they]2466-those howling mobs of people were , even when [they]2466-those howling mobs of people cut [her]83-janet head off . "[18-sara]

This was not a new thought , but quite an old one , by this time . It had consoled [her]1178-her through many a bitter day , and [she]1178-her had gone about [the house]170-the house with an expression in [her]1178-her face which [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin could not understand and which was a source of great annoyance to [her]1178-her , as it seemed as if [the child]261-the child were mentally living a life which held [her]1178-her above the rest of [the world]137-the world . It was as if [she]1178-her scarcely heard the rude and acid things said to [her]1178-her ; or , if [she]1178-her heard them , did not care for them at all . Sometimes , when [she]1178-her was in the midst of some harsh , domineering speech , [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin would find the still , unchildish eyes fixed upon [her]1178-her with something like a proud smile in them . At such times [she]1178-her did not know that [Sara]18-sara was saying to [herself]18-sara :

" [You]22-miss minchin do n't know that [you]22-miss minchin are saying these things to [a princess]2033-a princess , and that if [I]18-sara chose [I]18-sara could wave [my]18-sara hand and order [you]22-miss minchin to execution . [I]18-sara only spare [you]22-miss minchin because [I]18-sara am [a princess]2033-a princess , and [you]22-miss minchin are [a poor , stupid , unkind , vulgar old thing]2470-a poor , stupid , unkind , vulgar old thing , and do n't know any better . "[18-sara]

This used to interest and amuse [her]1178-her more than anything else ; and queer and fanciful as it was , [she]1178-her found comfort in it and it was a good thing for [her]1178-her . While the thought held possession of [her]1178-her , [she]1178-her could not be made rude and malicious by the rudeness and malice of those about [her]1178-her .

" [A princess]2033-a princess must be polite , "[1178-her] [she]1178-her said to [herself]1178-her .

And so when [the servants]636-the servants , taking [their]636-the servants tone from [[their]636-the servants mistress]1183-their mistress , were insolent and ordered [her]1178-her about , [she]1178-her would hold [her]1178-her head erect and reply to [them]636-the servants with a quaint civility which often made [them]636-the servants stare at [her]1178-her .

" [She]1178-her 's got more airs and graces than if [she]1178-her come from [Buckingham Palace]11-buckingham palace , [that young one]2472-that young one , "[2053-the cook] said [the cook]2053-the cook , chuckling a little sometimes . " [I]2053-the cook lose [my]2053-the cook temper with [her]1178-her often enough , but [I]2053-the cook will say [she]1178-her never forgets [her]1178-her manners . ' If [you]2053-the cook please , [cook]2473-cook ' ; ' Will [you]2053-the cook be so kind , [cook]2473-cook ? ' ' [I]2053-the cook beg [your]2053-the cook pardon , [cook]2473-cook ' ; ' May [I]2053-the cook trouble [you]2053-the cook , [cook]2473-cook ? ' [She]1178-her drops 'em about [the kitchen]484-the kitchen as if [they]484-the kitchen was nothing . "[2053-the cook]

The morning after the interview with [Ram Dass]89-ram dass and [[his]89-ram dass monkey]1185-his monkey , [Sara]18-sara was in [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom with [[her]18-sara small pupils]1008-her small pupils . Having finished giving [them]1008-her small pupils [their]1008-her small pupils lessons , [she]18-sara was putting the French exercise - books together and thinking , as [she]18-sara did it , of the various things [royal personages in disguise]1188-royal personages in disguise were called upon to do : [Alfred the Great]91-alfred the great , for instance , burning the cakes and getting [his]91-alfred the great ears boxed by [the wife of [the neat - herd]1190-the neat - herd]1189-the wife of the neat - herd . How frightened [she]18-sara must have been when [she]18-sara found out what [she]18-sara had done . If [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin should find out that [she]18-sara [Sara]18-sara , whose toes were almost sticking out of [her]18-sara boots was [a princess]2033-a princess [a real one]1192-a real one ! The look in [her]18-sara eyes was exactly the look which [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin most disliked . [She]18-sara would not have it ; [she]18-sara was quite near [her]18-sara and was so enraged that [she]18-sara actually flew at [her]18-sara and boxed [her]18-sara ears exactly as [[the neat - herd]1190-the neat - herd 's wife]1194-the neat - herd 's wife had boxed [King Alfred]92-king alfred 's . It made [Sara]18-sara start . [She]18-sara wakened from [her]18-sara dream at the shock , and , catching [her]18-sara breath , stood still a second . Then , not knowing [she]18-sara was going to do it , [she]18-sara broke into a little laugh .

" What are [you]18-sara laughing at , [you]18-sara bold , [impudent child]2478-impudent child ? "[22-miss minchin] [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin exclaimed .

It took [Sara]18-sara a few seconds to control [herself]18-sara sufficiently to remember that [she]18-sara was [a princess]2033-a princess . [Her]18-sara cheeks were red and smarting from the blows [she]18-sara had received .

" [I]18-sara was thinking , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara answered .

" Beg [my]22-miss minchin pardon immediately , "[22-miss minchin] said [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin .

[Sara]18-sara hesitated a second before [she]18-sara replied .

" [I]18-sara will beg [your]22-miss minchin pardon for laughing , if it was rude , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said then ; " but [I]18-sara wo n't beg [your]22-miss minchin pardon for thinking . "[18-sara]

" What were [you]18-sara thinking ? "[22-miss minchin] demanded [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . " How dare [you]18-sara think ? What were [you]18-sara thinking ? "[22-miss minchin]

[Jessie]33-jessie tittered , and [she]33-jessie and [Lavinia]30-lavinia nudged [each other]156-each other in unison . [All the girls]1197-all the girls looked up from [their]1197-all the girls books to listen . Really , it always interested [them]1197-all the girls a little when [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin attacked [Sara]18-sara . [Sara]18-sara always said something queer , and never seemed the least bit frightened . [She]18-sara was not in the least frightened now , though [her]18-sara boxed ears were scarlet and [her]18-sara eyes were as bright as stars .

" [I]18-sara was thinking , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara answered grandly and politely , " that [you]22-miss minchin did not know what [you]22-miss minchin were doing . "[18-sara]

" That [I]22-miss minchin did not know what [I]22-miss minchin was doing ? "[22-miss minchin] [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin fairly gasped .

" Yes , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , " and [I]18-sara was thinking what would happen if [I]18-sara were [a princess]2033-a princess and [you]22-miss minchin boxed [my]18-sara ears what [I]18-sara should do to [you]22-miss minchin . And [I]18-sara was thinking that if [I]18-sara were [one]134-one , [you]22-miss minchin would never dare to do it , whatever [I]18-sara said or did . And [I]18-sara was thinking how surprised and frightened [you]22-miss minchin would be if [you]22-miss minchin suddenly found out "[18-sara]

[She]18-sara had the imagined future so clearly before [her]18-sara eyes that [she]18-sara spoke in a manner which had an effect even upon [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin . It almost seemed for the moment to [her]18-sara narrow , unimaginative mind that there must be some real power hidden behind this candid daring .

" What ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara exclaimed . " Found out what ? "[18-sara]

" That [I]18-sara really was [a princess]2033-a princess , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , " and could do anything anything [I]18-sara liked . "[18-sara]

Every pair of eyes in [the room]189-the room widened to its full limit . [Lavinia]30-lavinia leaned forward on [her]30-lavinia seat to look .

" Go to [[your]22-miss minchin room]2211-your room , "[22-miss minchin] cried [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin , breathlessly , " this instant ! Leave [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom ! Attend to [your]22-miss minchin lessons , [young ladies]184-young ladies ! "[22-miss minchin]

[Sara]18-sara made a little bow .

" Excuse [me]18-sara for laughing if it was impolite , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , and walked out of [the room]189-the room , leaving [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin struggling with [her]22-miss minchin rage , and [the girls]645-the girls whispering over [their]645-the girls books .

" Did [you]22-miss minchin see [her]22-miss minchin ? Did [you]22-miss minchin see how queer [she]22-miss minchin looked ? "[33-jessie] [Jessie]33-jessie broke out . " [I]33-jessie should n't be at all surprised if [she]22-miss minchin did turn out to be something . Suppose [she]22-miss minchin should ! "[33-jessie]

12

The Other Side of the Wall

When one lives in [a row of [houses]1202-houses]1201-a row of houses , it is interesting to think of the things which are being done and said on the other side of the wall of [the very rooms [one]134-one is living in]1203-the very rooms one is living in . [Sara]18-sara was fond of amusing [herself]18-sara by trying to imagine the things hidden by the wall which divided [the Select Seminary]399-the select seminary from [[the Indian gentleman]930-the indian gentleman 's house]1207-the indian gentleman 's house . [She]18-sara knew that [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom was next to [[the Indian gentleman]930-the indian gentleman 's study]1210-the indian gentleman 's study , and [she]18-sara hoped that the wall was thick so that the noise made sometimes after lesson hours would not disturb [him]930-the indian gentleman .

" [I]18-sara am growing quite fond of [him]930-the indian gentleman , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said to [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde ; " [I]18-sara should not like [him]930-the indian gentleman to be disturbed . [I]18-sara have adopted [him]930-the indian gentleman for [a friend]886-a friend . [You]2486-you can do that with [people]157-people [you]2486-you never speak to at all . [You]2486-you can just watch [them]157-people , and think about [them]157-people and be sorry for [them]157-people , until [they]157-people seem almost like [relations]2488-relations . [I]18-sara 'm quite anxious sometimes when [I]18-sara see [the doctor]1096-the doctor call twice a day . "[18-sara]

And when [I]96-mr. carrisford look into it [I]96-mr. carrisford seem to see [Crewe]19-captain crewe 's gay young face gazing back at [me]96-mr. carrisford . [He]19-captain crewe looks as if [he]19-captain crewe were asking [me]96-mr. carrisford a question . Sometimes [I]96-mr. carrisford dream of [him]19-captain crewe at night , and [he]19-captain crewe always stands before [me]96-mr. carrisford and asks the same question in words . Can [you]97-mr. carmichael guess what [he]19-captain crewe says , [Carmichael]97-mr. carmichael ? "[96-mr. carrisford]

[Mr. Carmichael]97-mr. carmichael answered [him]97-mr. carmichael in a rather low voice .

" Not exactly , "[97-mr. carmichael] [he]97-mr. carmichael said .

" [He]19-captain crewe always says , ' [Tom]102-tom carrisford , [old man Tom]2567-old man tom where is [the Little Missus]2568-the little missus ? ' "[97-mr. carmichael] [He]97-mr. carmichael caught at [Carmichael]97-mr. carmichael 's hand and clung to it . " [I]97-mr. carmichael must be able to answer [him]19-captain crewe [I]97-mr. carmichael must ! "[97-mr. carmichael] [he]97-mr. carmichael said . " Help [me]97-mr. carmichael to find [her]2568-the little missus . Help [me]97-mr. carmichael . "[97-mr. carmichael]

On the other side of the wall [Sara]18-sara was sitting in [her]18-sara garret talking to [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec , who had come out for [his]1257-his evening meal .

" It has been hard to be [a princess]2033-a princess today , [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said . " It has been harder than usual . It gets harder as the weather grows colder and [the streets]1982-the streets get more sloppy . When [Lavinia]30-lavinia laughed at [my]18-sara muddy skirt as [I]18-sara passed [her]30-lavinia in [the hall]187-the hall , [I]18-sara thought of something to say all in a flash and [I]18-sara only just stopped [myself]18-sara in time . [You]2572-you ca n't sneer back at [people]157-people like that if [you]2572-you are [a princess]2033-a princess . But [you]2572-you have to bite [your]2572-you tongue to hold [yourself]2572-you in . [I]18-sara bit [mine]18-sara . It was a cold afternoon , [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec . And it 's a cold night . "[18-sara]

Quite suddenly [she]18-sara put [her]18-sara black head down in [her]18-sara arms , as [she]18-sara often did when [she]18-sara was alone .

" Oh , [papa]1809-papa , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara whispered , " what a long time it seems since [I]18-sara was [your]1809-papa ' Little Missus ' ! "[18-sara]

This was what happened that day on both sides of the wall .

13

One of the Populace

The winter was a wretched one . There were days on which [Sara]18-sara tramped through snow when [she]18-sara went on [her]18-sara errands ; there were worse days when the snow melted and combined itself with mud to form slush ; there were others when the fog was so thick that the lamps in [the street]2034-the street were lighted all day and [London]1-london looked as it had looked the afternoon , several years ago , when [the cab]180-the cab had driven through [the thoroughfares]1260-the thoroughfares with [Sara]18-sara tucked up on [its]180-the cab seat , leaning against [[her]18-sara father]129-her father 's shoulder . On such days the windows of [the house of [the Large Family]954-the large family]1262-the house of the large family always looked delightfully cozy and alluring , and [the study in which [the Indian gentleman]930-the indian gentleman sat]1264-the study in which the indian gentleman sat glowed with warmth and rich color . But [the attic]606-the attic was dismal beyond words . There were no longer sunsets or sunrises to look at , and scarcely ever any stars , it seemed to [Sara]18-sara . The clouds hung low over the skylight and were either gray or mud - color , or dropping heavy rain . At four o'clock in the afternoon , even when there was no special fog , the daylight was at an end . If it was necessary to go to [[her]18-sara attic]598-her attic for anything , [Sara]18-sara was obliged to light a candle . [The women in [the kitchen]484-the kitchen]1268-the women in the kitchen were depressed , and that made [them]1268-the women in the kitchen more ill - tempered than ever . [Becky]48-becky was driven like [a little slave]1270-a little slave .

" ' Twarn't for [you]18-sara , [miss]2018-miss , "[48-becky] [she]48-becky said hoarsely to [Sara]18-sara one night when [she]48-becky had crept into [the attic]606-the attic " ' twarn't for [you]18-sara , an ' [the Bastille]52-the bastille , an ' bein ' [the prisoner in the next cell]2312-the prisoner in the next cell , [I]48-becky should die . That there does seem real now , does n't it ? [The missus]2024-the missus is more like [the head jailer]2579-the head jailer every day [she]2024-the missus lives . [I]48-becky can jest see them big keys [you]18-sara say [she]2024-the missus carries . [The cook]2053-the cook [she]2024-the missus 's like [one of [the under - jailers]2582-the under - jailers]2581-one of the under - jailers . Tell [me]48-becky some more , please , [miss]2018-miss tell [me]48-becky about [the subt'ranean passage [we]2585-we 've dug under the walls]2584-the subt'ranean passage we 've dug under the walls . "[48-becky]

" [I]18-sara 'll tell [you]18-sara something warmer , "[18-sara] shivered [Sara]18-sara . " Get [your]18-sara coverlet and wrap it round [you]18-sara , and [I]18-sara 'll get [mine]18-sara , and [we]2585-we will huddle close together on the bed , and [I]18-sara 'll tell [you]18-sara about [the tropical forest]2586-the tropical forest where [the Indian gentleman]930-the indian gentleman 's monkey used to live . When [I]18-sara see [him]2588-him sitting on the table near the window and looking out into [the street]2034-the street with that mournful expression , [I]18-sara always feel sure [he]2588-him is thinking about [the tropical forest]2586-the tropical forest where [he]2588-him used to swing by [his]2588-him tail from coconut trees . [I]18-sara wonder who caught [him]2588-him , and if [he]2588-him left [a family]2591-a family behind who had depended on [him]2588-him for coconuts . "[18-sara]

" That is warmer , [miss]2018-miss , "[48-becky] said [Becky]48-becky , gratefully ; " but , someways , even [the Bastille]52-the bastille is sort of heatin ' when [you]18-sara gets to tellin ' about it . "[48-becky]

" That is because it makes [you]48-becky think of something else , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , wrapping the coverlet round [her]18-sara until only [her]18-sara small dark face was to be seen looking out of it . " [I]18-sara 've noticed this . What [you]48-becky have to do with [your]48-becky mind , when [your]48-becky body is miserable , is to make it think of something else . "[18-sara]

" Can [you]18-sara do it , [miss]2018-miss ? "[48-becky] faltered [Becky]48-becky , regarding [her]18-sara with admiring eyes .

[Sara]18-sara knitted [her]18-sara brows a moment .

" Sometimes [I]18-sara can and sometimes [I]18-sara ca n't , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said stoutly . " But when [I]18-sara CAN [I]18-sara 'm all right . And what [I]18-sara believe is that [we]2594-we always could if [we]2594-we practiced enough . [I]18-sara 've been practicing a good deal lately , and it 's beginning to be easier than it used to be . When things are horrible just horrible [I]18-sara think as hard as ever [I]18-sara can of being [a princess]2033-a princess . [I]18-sara say to [myself]18-sara , ' [I]18-sara am [a princess]2033-a princess , and [I]18-sara am [a fairy one]2597-a fairy one , and because [I]18-sara am [a fairy]2598-a fairy nothing can hurt [me]18-sara or make [me]18-sara uncomfortable . ' [You]2599-you do n't know how it makes [you]2599-you forget "[18-sara] with a laugh .

[She]1272-she had many opportunities of making [her]1272-she mind think of something else , and many opportunities of proving to [herself]1272-she whether or not [she]1272-she was [a princess]2033-a princess . But one of the strongest tests [she]1272-she was ever put to came on a certain dreadful day which , [she]1272-she often thought afterward , would never quite fade out of [her]1272-she memory even in the years to come .

For several days it had rained continuously ; [the streets]1982-the streets were chilly and sloppy and full of dreary , cold mist ; there was mud everywhere sticky [London]1-london mud and over everything the pall of drizzle and fog . Of course there were several long and tiresome errands to be done there always were on days like this and [Sara]18-sara was sent out again and again , until [her]18-sara shabby clothes were damp through . The absurd old feathers on [her]18-sara forlorn hat were more draggled and absurd than ever , and [her]18-sara downtrodden shoes were so wet that they could not hold any more water . Added to this , [she]18-sara had been deprived of [her]18-sara dinner , because [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin had chosen to punish [her]18-sara . [She]18-sara was so cold and hungry and tired that [her]18-sara face began to have a pinched look , and now and then [some kind - hearted person passing [her]18-sara in [the street]2034-the street]1275-some kind - hearted person passing her in the street glanced at [her]18-sara with sudden sympathy . But [she]1272-she did not know that . [She]1272-she hurried on , trying to make [her]1272-she mind think of something else . It was really very necessary . [Her]1272-she way of doing it was to " pretend "[1272-she] and ' suppose " with all the strength that was left in [her]1272-she . But really this time it was harder than [she]1272-she had ever found it , and once or twice [she]1272-she thought it almost made [her]1272-she more cold and hungry instead of less so . But [she]1272-she persevered obstinately , and as the muddy water squelched through [her]1272-she broken shoes and the wind seemed trying to drag [her]1272-she thin jacket from [her]1272-she , [she]1272-she talked to [herself]1272-she as [she]1272-she walked , though [she]1272-she did not speak aloud or even move [her]1272-she lips .[1272-she]

" Suppose [I]1272-she had dry clothes on , "[1272-she] [she]1272-she thought . " Suppose [I]1272-she had good shoes and a long , thick coat and merino stockings and a whole umbrella . And suppose suppose just when [I]1272-she was near [a baker 's]2600-a baker 's where [they]2600-a baker 's sold hot buns , [I]1272-she should find sixpence which belonged to [nobody]622-nobody . SUPPOSE if [I]1272-she did , [I]1272-she should go into [the shop]236-the shop and buy six of the hottest buns and eat them all without stopping . "[1272-she]

Some very odd things happen in [this world]1277-this world sometimes .

It certainly was an odd thing that happened to [Sara]18-sara . [She]18-sara had to cross [the street]2034-the street just when [she]18-sara was saying this to [herself]18-sara . The mud was dreadful [she]18-sara almost had to wade . [She]18-sara picked [her]18-sara way as carefully as [she]18-sara could , but [she]18-sara could not save [herself]18-sara much ; only , in picking [her]18-sara way , [she]18-sara had to look down at [her]18-sara feet and the mud , and in looking down just as [she]18-sara reached [the pavement]478-the pavement [she]18-sara saw something shining in the gutter . It was actually a piece of silver a tiny piece trodden upon by many feet , but still with spirit enough left to shine a little . Not quite a sixpence , but the next thing to it a fourpenny piece .

In one second it was in [her]18-sara cold little red - and - blue hand .

" Oh , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara gasped , " it is true ! It is true ! "[18-sara]

And then , if [you]1280-you will believe [me]0-i , [she]18-sara looked straight at [the shop]236-the shop directly facing [her]18-sara . And [it]236-the shop was [[a baker]1282-a baker 's shop]1283-a baker 's shop , and [a cheerful , stout , motherly woman with rosy cheeks]1284-a cheerful , stout , motherly woman with rosy cheeks was putting into the window a tray of delicious newly baked hot buns , fresh from the oven large , plump , shiny buns , with currants in them .

It almost made [Sara]18-sara feel faint for a few seconds the shock , and the sight of the buns , and the delightful odors of warm bread floating up through the baker 's cellar window .

[She]18-sara knew [she]18-sara need not hesitate to use the little piece of money . It had evidently been lying in the mud for some time , and [its owner]1285-its owner was completely lost in the stream of [passing people who crowded and jostled each other]1286-passing people who crowded and jostled each other all day long .

" But [I]18-sara 'll go and ask [the baker woman]2603-the baker woman if [she]2603-the baker woman has lost anything , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said to [herself]18-sara , rather faintly . So [she]18-sara crossed [the pavement]478-the pavement and put [her]18-sara wet foot on the step . As [she]18-sara did so [she]18-sara saw something that made [her]18-sara stop .

It was a little figure more forlorn even than [herself]18-sara a little figure which was not much more than a bundle of rags , from which small , bare , red muddy feet peeped out , only because the rags with which [their owner]1288-their owner was trying to cover them were not long enough . Above the rags appeared a shock head of tangled hair , and a dirty face with big , hollow , hungry eyes .

[Sara]18-sara knew they were hungry eyes the moment [she]18-sara saw them , and [she]18-sara felt a sudden sympathy .

" This , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said to [herself]18-sara , with a little sigh , " is [one of [the populace]2056-the populace]2604-one of the populace and [she]2604-one of the populace is hungrier than [I]18-sara am . "[18-sara]

[The child]261-the child this " [one of [the populace]2056-the populace]2604-one of the populace "[261-the child] stared up at [Sara]18-sara , and shuffled [herself]261-the child aside a little , so as to give [her]261-the child room to pass . [She]261-the child was used to being made to give room to [everybody]270-everybody . [She]261-the child knew that if [a policeman]1291-a policeman chanced to see [her]261-the child [he]1291-a policeman would tell [her]261-the child to " move on . "[18-sara]

[Sara]18-sara clutched [her]18-sara little fourpenny piece and hesitated for a few seconds . Then [she]18-sara spoke to [her]261-the child .

" Are [you]261-the child hungry ? "[18-sara] [she]18-sara asked .

[The child]261-the child shuffled [herself]261-the child and [her]261-the child rags a little more .

" Ai n't [I]261-the child jist ? "[261-the child] [she]261-the child said in a hoarse voice . " Jist ai n't [I]261-the child ? "[261-the child]

" Have n't [you]261-the child had any dinner ? "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara .

" No dinner , "[261-the child] more hoarsely still and with more shuffling . " Nor yet no bre'fast nor yet no supper . No nothin' .[261-the child]

" Since when ? "[18-sara] asked [Sara]18-sara .

" Dunno . Never got nothin' today nowhere . [I]261-the child 've axed an ' axed . "[261-the child]

Just to look at [her]261-the child made [Sara]18-sara more hungry and faint . But those queer little thoughts were at work in [her]18-sara brain , and [she]18-sara was talking to [herself]18-sara , though [she]18-sara was sick at heart .

" If [I]18-sara 'm [a princess]2033-a princess , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara was saying , " if [I]18-sara 'm [a princess]2033-a princess when [they]2610-they were poor and driven from [their]2610-they thrones [they]2610-they always shared with [the populace]2056-the populace if [they]2610-they met one poorer and hungrier than [themselves]2610-they . [They]2610-they always shared . Buns are a penny each . If it had been sixpence [I]18-sara could have eaten six . It wo n't be enough for either of [us]2612-us . But it will be better than nothing . "[18-sara]

" Wait a minute , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said to [the beggar child]1293-the beggar child .

[She]18-sara went into [the shop]236-the shop . It was warm and smelled deliciously . [The woman]1295-the woman was just going to put some more hot buns into the window .

" If [you]1295-the woman please , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , " have [you]1295-the woman lost fourpence a silver fourpence ? "[18-sara] And [she]18-sara held the forlorn little piece of money out to [her]1295-the woman .

[The woman]1295-the woman looked at it and then at [her]18-sara at [her]1295-the woman intense little face and draggled , once fine clothes .

" Bless [us]2612-us , no , "[1295-the woman] [she]1295-the woman answered . " Did [you]1295-the woman find it ? "[1295-the woman]

" Yes , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " In the gutter . "[18-sara]

" Keep it , then , "[1295-the woman] said [the woman]1295-the woman . " It may have been there for a week , and goodness knows who lost it . [YOU]18-sara could never find out . "[1295-the woman]

" [I]18-sara know that , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara , " but [I]18-sara thought [I]18-sara would ask [you]1295-the woman . "[18-sara]

" Not many would , "[1295-the woman] said [the woman]1295-the woman , looking puzzled and interested and good - natured all at once .

" Do [you]18-sara want to buy something ? "[1295-the woman] [she]1295-the woman added , as [she]1295-the woman saw [Sara]18-sara glance at the buns .

" Four buns , if [you]1295-the woman please , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " Those at a penny each . "[18-sara]

[The woman]1295-the woman went to the window and put some in a paper bag .

[Sara]18-sara noticed that [she]1295-the woman put in six .

" [I]18-sara said four , if [you]1295-the woman please , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara explained . " [I]18-sara have only fourpence . "[18-sara]

" [I]1295-the woman 'll throw in two for makeweight , "[1295-the woman] said [the woman]1295-the woman with [her]1295-the woman good - natured look . " [I]1295-the woman dare say [you]18-sara can eat them sometime . Are n't [you]18-sara hungry ? "[1295-the woman]

A mist rose before [Sara]18-sara 's eyes .

" Yes , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara answered . " [I]1295-the woman am very hungry , and [I]1295-the woman am much obliged to [you]1295-the woman for [your]1295-the woman kindness ; and "[1295-the woman] [she]1295-the woman was going to add " there is [a child outside who is hungrier than [I]1295-the woman am]2613-a child outside who is hungrier than i am . "[1295-the woman] But just at that moment [two or three customers]1301-two or three customers came in at once , and [each one]1302-each one seemed in a hurry , so [she]18-sara could only thank [the woman]1295-the woman again and go out .

[The beggar girl]1304-the beggar girl was still huddled up in the corner of the step . [She]1304-the beggar girl looked frightful in [her]1304-the beggar girl wet and dirty rags . [She]1304-the beggar girl was staring straight before [her]18-sara with a stupid look of suffering , and [Sara]18-sara saw [her]1304-the beggar girl suddenly draw the back of [her]1304-the beggar girl roughened black hand across [her]1304-the beggar girl eyes to rub away the tears which seemed to have surprised [her]1304-the beggar girl by forcing their way from under [her]1304-the beggar girl lids . [She]1304-the beggar girl was muttering to [herself]1304-the beggar girl .

[Sara]18-sara opened the paper bag and took out one of the hot buns , which had already warmed [her]18-sara own cold hands a little .

" See , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , putting the bun in the ragged lap , " this is nice and hot . Eat it , and [you]261-the child will not feel so hungry . "[18-sara]

[The child]261-the child started and stared up at [her]18-sara , as if such sudden , amazing good luck almost frightened [her]18-sara ; then [she]18-sara snatched up the bun and began to cram it into [her]18-sara mouth with great wolfish bites .

" Oh , my ! Oh , my ! "[1304-the beggar girl] [Sara]18-sara heard [her]1304-the beggar girl say hoarsely , in wild delight . " OH my ! "[1304-the beggar girl]

[Sara]18-sara took out three more buns and put them down .

The sound in the hoarse , ravenous voice was awful .

" [She]261-the child is hungrier than [I]18-sara am , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said to [herself]18-sara . " [She]261-the child 's starving . "[18-sara] But [her]18-sara hand trembled when [she]18-sara put down the fourth bun . " [I]18-sara 'm not starving , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said and [she]18-sara put down the fifth .

[The little ravening London savage]1306-the little ravening london savage was still snatching and devouring when [she]18-sara turned away . [She]1306-the little ravening london savage was too ravenous to give any thanks , even if [she]1306-the little ravening london savage had ever been taught politeness which [she]1306-the little ravening london savage had not . [She]1306-the little ravening london savage was only a poor little wild animal .

" Good - bye , "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara .

When [she]18-sara reached the other side of [the street]2034-the street [she]18-sara looked back . [The child]261-the child had a bun in each hand and had stopped in the middle of a bite to watch [her]1306-the little ravening london savage . [Sara]18-sara gave [her]1306-the little ravening london savage a little nod , and [the child]261-the child , after another stare a curious lingering stare jerked [her]261-the child shaggy head in response , and until [Sara]18-sara was out of sight [she]18-sara did not take another bite or even finish the one [she]18-sara had begun .

At that moment [the baker - woman]1310-the baker - woman looked out of [her]1310-the baker - woman shop window .

" Well , [I]1310-the baker - woman never ! "[1310-the baker - woman] [she]1310-the baker - woman exclaimed . " If [that young un]2614-that young un has n't given [her]2614-that young un buns to [a beggar child]2615-a beggar child ! It was n't because [she]2614-that young un did n't want them , either . Well , well , [she]2614-that young un looked hungry enough . [I]1310-the baker - woman 'd give something to know what [she]2614-that young un did it for . "[1310-the baker - woman]

[She]1310-the baker - woman stood behind [her]1310-the baker - woman window for a few moments and pondered . Then [her]1310-the baker - woman curiosity got the better of [her]1310-the baker - woman . [She]1310-the baker - woman went to the door and spoke to [the beggar child]1293-the beggar child .

" Who gave [you]1293-the beggar child those buns ? "[1310-the baker - woman] [she]1310-the baker - woman asked [her]1293-the beggar child . [The child]261-the child nodded [her]261-the child head toward [[Sara]18-sara 's vanishing figure]1313-sara 's vanishing figure .

" What did [she]2614-that young un say ? "[1295-the woman] inquired [the woman]1295-the woman .

" Axed [me]261-the child if [I]261-the child was ' ungry , "[261-the child] replied the hoarse voice .

" What did [you]1295-the woman say ? "[261-the child]

" Said [I]261-the child was jist . "[261-the child]

" And then [she]2614-that young un came in and got the buns , and gave them to [you]261-the child , did [she]2614-that young un ? "[261-the child]

[The child]261-the child nodded .

" How many ? "[261-the child]

" Five . "[261-the child]

[The woman]1295-the woman thought it over .

" Left just one for [herself]2614-that young un , "[1295-the woman] [she]1295-the woman said in a low voice . " And [she]2614-that young un could have eaten the whole six [I]1295-the woman saw it in [her]2614-that young un eyes . "[1295-the woman]

[She]1295-the woman looked after [the little draggled far - away figure]1317-the little draggled far - away figure and felt more disturbed in [her]1295-the woman usually comfortable mind than [she]1295-the woman had felt for many a day .

" [I]1295-the woman wish [she]2614-that young un had n't gone so quick , "[1295-the woman] [she]1295-the woman said . " [I]1295-the woman 'm blest if [she]2614-that young un should n't have had a dozen . "[1295-the woman] Then [she]1295-the woman turned to [the child]261-the child .

" Are [you]261-the child hungry yet ? "[1295-the woman] [she]1295-the woman said .

" [I]1295-the woman 'm allus hungry , "[1295-the woman] was the answer , " but ' t ai n't as bad as it was . "[1295-the woman]

" Come in [here]1824-here , "[1295-the woman] said [the woman]1295-the woman , and [she]1295-the woman held open [the shop]236-the shop door .

[The child]261-the child got up and shuffled in . To be invited into [a warm place full of bread]1322-a warm place full of bread seemed an incredible thing . [She]1295-the woman did not know what was going to happen . [She]1295-the woman did not care , even .

" Get [yourself]261-the child warm , "[1295-the woman] said [the woman]1295-the woman , pointing to a fire in [the tiny back room]1324-the tiny back room . " And look here ; when [you]261-the child are hard up for a bit of bread , [you]261-the child can come in here and ask for it . [Sara]18-sara found some comfort in [her]18-sara remaining bun . At all events , it was very hot , and it was better than nothing . As [she]18-sara walked along [she]18-sara broke off small pieces and ate them slowly to make them last longer .

" Suppose it was a magic bun , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said , " and a bite was as much as a whole dinner . [I]18-sara should be overeating [myself]18-sara if [I]18-sara went on like this . "[18-sara]

It was dark when [she]18-sara reached [the square where [the Select Seminary]399-the select seminary was situated]1325-the square where the select seminary was situated . The lights in [the houses]1125-the houses were all lighted . The blinds were not yet drawn in the windows of [the room]189-the room where [she]18-sara nearly always caught glimpses of [members of [the Large Family]954-the large family]1329-members of the large family . On the contrary , there was a good deal of excitement going on . It was evident that a journey was to be taken , and it was [Mr. Montmorency]94-mr. montmorency who was to take it . A brougham stood before the door , and a big portmanteau had been strapped upon it . [The children]490-the children were dancing about , chattering and hanging on to [[their]490-the children father]1335-their father . [The pretty rosy mother]1336-the pretty rosy mother was standing near [him]1228-the gentleman she called mr. montmorency , talking as if [she]1336-the pretty rosy mother was asking final questions . 14

What [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec Heard and Saw

On this very afternoon , while [Sara]18-sara was out , a strange thing happened in [the attic]606-the attic . Only [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec saw and heard it ; and [he]1057-the father of the large family was so much alarmed and mystified that [he]1057-the father of the large family scuttled back to [[his]1057-the father of the large family hole]912-his hole and hid there , and really quaked and trembled as [he]1057-the father of the large family peeped out furtively and with great caution to watch what was going on .

[The attic]606-the attic had been very still all the day after [Sara]18-sara had left [it]606-the attic in the early morning . The stillness had only been broken by the pattering of the rain upon the slates and the skylight . [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec had , in fact , found it rather dull ; and when the rain ceased to patter and perfect silence reigned , [he]1057-the father of the large family decided to come out and reconnoiter , though experience taught [him]1057-the father of the large family that [Sara]18-sara would not return for some time . [He]1057-the father of the large family had been rambling and sniffing about , and had just found a totally unexpected and unexplained crumb left from [his]1057-the father of the large family last meal , when [his]1057-the father of the large family attention was attracted by a sound on the roof . [He]1057-the father of the large family stopped to listen with a palpitating heart . The sound suggested that something was moving on the roof . It was approaching the skylight ; it reached the skylight . The skylight was being mysteriously opened . A dark face peered into [the attic]606-the attic ; then another face appeared behind it , and [both]247-both looked in with signs of caution and interest . [Two men]1087-two men were outside on the roof , and were making silent preparations to enter through the skylight itself . [One]134-one was [Ram Dass]89-ram dass and [the other]1360-the other was [a young man who was [[the Indian gentleman]930-the indian gentleman 's secretary]1363-the indian gentleman 's secretary]1361-a young man who was the indian gentleman 's secretary ; but of course [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec did not know this . [He]1057-the father of the large family only knew that [the men]1364-the men were invading the silence and privacy of [the attic]606-the attic ; and as [the one with the dark face]1366-the one with the dark face let [himself]1366-the one with the dark face down through the aperture with such lightness and dexterity that [he]1366-the one with the dark face did not make the slightest sound , [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec turned tail and fled precipitately back to [[his]1057-the father of the large family hole]912-his hole . [He]1057-the father of the large family was frightened to death . [He]1057-the father of the large family had ceased to be timid with [Sara]18-sara , and knew [she]18-sara would never throw anything but crumbs , and would never make any sound other than the soft , low , coaxing whistling ; but [strange men]1368-strange men were dangerous things to remain near . [He]1057-the father of the large family lay close and flat near the entrance of [[his]1057-the father of the large family home]925-his home , just managing to peep through the crack with a bright , alarmed eye . How much [he]1057-the father of the large family understood of the talk [he]1057-the father of the large family heard [I]0-i am not in the least able to say ; but , even if [he]1057-the father of the large family had understood it all , [he]1057-the father of the large family would probably have remained greatly mystified .

[The secretary , who was light and young]1370-the secretary , who was light and young , slipped through the skylight as noiselessly as [Ram Dass]89-ram dass had done ; and [he]1370-the secretary , who was light and young caught a last glimpse of [Melchisedec]73-melchisedec 's vanishing tail .

" Was that a rat ? "[1370-the secretary , who was light and young] [he]1370-the secretary , who was light and young asked [Ram Dass]89-ram dass in a whisper .

" Yes ; a rat , [Sahib]21-missee sahib , "[89-ram dass] answered [Ram Dass]89-ram dass , also whispering . " There are many in the walls . "[89-ram dass]

15

The Magic

When [Sara]18-sara had passed [the house next door]874-the house next door [she]18-sara had seen [Ram Dass]89-ram dass closing the shutters , and caught [her]18-sara glimpse of [this room]1976-this room also .

" It is a long time since [I]18-sara saw [a nice place from the inside]2674-a nice place from the inside , "[18-sara] was the thought which crossed [her]18-sara mind .

There was the usual bright fire glowing in the grate , and [the Indian gentleman]930-the indian gentleman was sitting before it . [His]930-the indian gentleman head was resting in [his]930-the indian gentleman hand , and [he]930-the indian gentleman looked as lonely and unhappy as ever .

" [Poor man]2675-poor man ! "[18-sara] said [Sara]18-sara . " [I]18-sara wonder what [you]930-the indian gentleman are supposing . "[18-sara]

And this was what [he]930-the indian gentleman was ' supposing " at that very moment .[930-the indian gentleman]

" Suppose , "[930-the indian gentleman] [he]930-the indian gentleman was thinking , ' suppose even if [Carmichael]97-mr. carmichael traces [the people]1985-the people to [Moscow]13-moscow [the little girl [they]1985-the people took from [[Madame Pascal]38-madame pascal 's school in [Paris]7-paris]2516-madame pascal 's school in paris]1390-the little girl they took from madame pascal 's school in paris is NOT the one [we]1392-we are in search of . Suppose [she]1390-the little girl they took from madame pascal 's school in paris proves to be quite [a different child]1393-a different child . What steps shall [I]0-i take next ? "[0-i]

[Sara]18-sara went and found the bread . It was old and hard and dry . [The cook]2053-the cook was in too vicious a humor to give [her]18-sara anything to eat with it . Really , it was hard for [the child]261-the child to climb the three long flights of stairs leading to [[her]18-sara attic]598-her attic . [She]18-sara often found them long and steep when [she]18-sara was tired ; but tonight it seemed as if [she]18-sara would never reach the top . The truth was that [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde did not know anything of the sometimes almost unbearable side of life in [the attic]606-the attic and [she]40-ermengarde had not a sufficiently vivid imagination to depict it for [herself]40-ermengarde . [Her]40-ermengarde visits partook of the character of adventures ; and though sometimes [Sara]18-sara looked rather pale , and it was not to be denied that [she]18-sara had grown very thin , [her]18-sara proud little spirit would not admit of complaints . [She]18-sara had never confessed that at times [she]18-sara was almost ravenous with hunger , as [she]18-sara was tonight . [She]18-sara was growing rapidly , and [her]18-sara constant walking and running about would have given [her]18-sara a keen appetite even if [she]18-sara had had abundant and regular meals of a much more nourishing nature than the unappetizing , inferior food snatched at such odd times as suited the kitchen convenience . [She]18-sara was growing used to a certain gnawing feeling in [her]18-sara young stomach .

" [I]18-sara suppose [soldiers]1826-soldiers feel like this when [they]1826-soldiers are on a long and weary march , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara often said to [herself]18-sara . It was just at this minute that something happened at the skylight which [neither of [them]1430-them]1429-neither of them saw . [She]18-sara broke off in the middle of [her]18-sara words . [They]1433-they both heard the sound that checked [her]18-sara . It was not on the slates , but on the stairs below , and it was [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin 's angry voice . [Sara]18-sara sprang off the bed , and put out the candle .

" [She]22-miss minchin is scolding [Becky]48-becky , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara whispered , as [she]18-sara stood in the darkness . " [She]22-miss minchin is making [her]48-becky cry . "[18-sara]

" No . [She]22-miss minchin will think [I]18-sara am in bed . Do n't stir . "[18-sara]

It was very seldom that [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin mounted [the last flight of stairs]1434-the last flight of stairs . [Sara]18-sara could only remember that [she]18-sara had done it once before . The dream was quite at an end . The last spark had died out of the paper in the grate and left only black tinder ; the table was left bare , the golden plates and richly embroidered napkins , and the garlands were transformed again into old handkerchiefs , scraps of red and white paper , and discarded artificial flowers all scattered on the floor ; [the minstrels in [the minstrel gallery]1470-the minstrel gallery]1469-the minstrels in the minstrel gallery had stolen away , and the viols and bassoons were still . [Emily]27-emily was sitting with [her]27-emily back against the wall , staring very hard . [Sara]18-sara saw [her]27-emily , and went and picked [her]27-emily up with trembling hands .

But [she]27-emily did not look up . [She]27-emily sat with [her]27-emily little black head in [her]27-emily arms for some time . [She]27-emily always sat like that when [she]27-emily was trying to bear something in silence . Then [she]27-emily got up and went slowly to the bed .

" [I]27-emily ca n't pretend anything else while [I]27-emily am awake , "[27-emily] [she]27-emily said . " There would n't be any use in trying . If [I]27-emily go to sleep , perhaps a dream will come and pretend for [me]27-emily . "[27-emily]

[She]27-emily suddenly felt so tired perhaps through want of food that [she]27-emily sat down on the edge of the bed quite weakly .

" Suppose there was a bright fire in the grate , with lots of little dancing flames , "[27-emily] [she]27-emily murmured . " Suppose there was a comfortable chair before it and suppose there was a small table near , with a little hot hot supper on it . And suppose "[27-emily] as [she]27-emily drew the thin coverings over [her]27-emily ' suppose this was a beautiful soft bed , with fleecy blankets and large downy pillows . Suppose suppose " And [her]27-emily very weariness was good to [her]27-emily , for [her]27-emily eyes closed and [she]27-emily fell fast asleep .[27-emily]

[She]27-emily did not know how long [she]27-emily slept . But [she]27-emily had been tired enough to sleep deeply and profoundly too deeply and soundly to be disturbed by anything , even by the squeaks and scamperings of [[Melchisedec]73-melchisedec 's entire family]1471-melchisedec 's entire family , if [all [his]1473-his sons]1472-all his sons and [daughters]1474-daughters had chosen to come out of [[their]1471-melchisedec 's entire family hole]1475-their hole to fight and tumble and play .

When [she]27-emily awakened it was rather suddenly , and [she]27-emily did not know that any particular thing had called [her]27-emily out of [her]27-emily sleep . The truth was , however , that it was a sound which had called [her]27-emily back a real sound the click of the skylight as it fell in closing after a lithe white figure which slipped through it and crouched down close by upon the slates of the roof just near enough to see what happened in [the attic]606-the attic , but not near enough to be seen .

At first [she]27-emily did not open [her]27-emily eyes . [She]27-emily felt too sleepy and curiously enough too warm and comfortable . [She]27-emily was so warm and comfortable , indeed , that [she]27-emily did not believe [she]27-emily was really awake . [She]27-emily never was as warm and cozy as this except in some lovely vision .

" What a nice dream ! "[27-emily] [she]27-emily murmured . " [I]27-emily feel quite warm . [I]27-emily do n't want to wake up . "[27-emily]

Of course it was a dream . [She]27-emily felt as if warm , delightful bedclothes were heaped upon [her]27-emily . [She]27-emily could actually FEEL blankets , and when [she]27-emily put out [her]27-emily hand it touched something exactly like a satin - covered eider - down quilt . [She]27-emily must not awaken from this delight [she]27-emily must be quite still and make it last .

But [she]27-emily could not even though [she]27-emily kept [her]27-emily eyes closed tightly , [she]27-emily could not . Something was forcing [her]27-emily to awaken something in [the room]189-the room . It was a sense of light , and a sound the sound of a crackling , roaring little fire .

" Oh , [I]27-emily am awakening , "[27-emily] [she]27-emily said mournfully . " [I]27-emily ca n't help it [I]27-emily ca n't . "[27-emily]

[Her]27-emily eyes opened in spite of [herself]27-emily . And then [she]27-emily actually smiled for what [she]27-emily saw [she]27-emily had never seen in [the attic]606-the attic before , and knew [she]27-emily never should see .

"[27-emily] [She]27-emily knew it MUST be a dream , for if [she]27-emily were awake such things could not could not be .

Do [you]1479-you wonder that [she]27-emily felt sure [she]27-emily had not come back to [earth]2695-earth ? This is what [she]27-emily saw . In the grate there was a glowing , blazing fire ; on the hob was a little brass kettle hissing and boiling ; spread upon the floor was a thick , warm crimson rug ; before the fire a folding - chair , unfolded , and with cushions on it ; by the chair a small folding - table , unfolded , covered with a white cloth , and upon it spread small covered dishes , a cup , a saucer , a teapot ; on the bed were new warm coverings and a satin - covered down quilt ; at the foot a curious wadded silk robe , a pair of quilted slippers , and some books . [The room of [her]27-emily dream]1481-the room of her dream seemed changed into fairyland and [it]1481-the room of her dream was flooded with warm light , for a bright lamp stood on the table covered with a rosy shade .

[She]27-emily sat up , resting on [her]27-emily elbow , and [her]27-emily breathing came short and fast .

"[27-emily]

The Visitor

Imagine , if [you]1485-you can , what the rest of the evening was like . How [they]1484-they crouched by the fire which blazed and leaped and made so much of itself in the little grate . How [they]1484-they removed the covers of the dishes , and found rich , hot , savory soup , which was a meal in itself , and sandwiches and toast and muffins enough for both of [them]1484-they . The mug from [the washstand]1486-the washstand was used as [Becky]48-becky 's tea cup , and the tea was so delicious that it was not necessary to pretend that it was anything but tea . [They]1484-they were warm and full - fed and happy , and it was just like [Sara]18-sara that , having found [her]48-becky strange good fortune real , [she]48-becky should give [herself]48-becky up to the enjoyment of it to the utmost . [She]48-becky had lived such a life of imaginings that [she]48-becky was quite equal to accepting any wonderful thing that happened , and almost to cease , in a short time , to find it bewildering .

" [I]18-sara do n't know anyone in [the world]137-the world who could have done it , "[18-sara] [she]18-sara said ; " but there has been [someone]1856-someone . It can not be denied that as [they]1484-they sat before the blazing fire , and ate the nourishing , comfortable food , [they]1484-they felt a kind of rapturous awe , and looked into [each other]156-each other 's eyes with something like doubt .

" Do [you]18-sara think , "[48-becky] [Becky]48-becky faltered once , in a whisper , " do [you]18-sara think it could melt away , [miss]2018-miss ? Had n't [we]1484-they better be quick ? "[18-sara]

The sleepy comfort which at length almost overpowered [them]1484-they was a heavenly thing . It was the drowsiness of happy , well - fed childhood , and [they]1484-they sat in the fire glow and luxuriated in it until [Sara]18-sara found [herself]18-sara turning to look at [her]18-sara transformed bed .

There were even blankets enough to share with [Becky]48-becky . The narrow couch in [the next attic]1126-the next attic was more comfortable that night than [its occupant]1490-its occupant had ever dreamed that it could be .

" If it ai n't [here]1824-here in the mornin ' , [miss]2018-miss , "[48-becky] [she]48-becky said , " it 's been [here]1824-here tonight , anyways , an ' [I]48-becky sha n't never forget it . "[48-becky] [She]48-becky looked at each particular thing , as if to commit it to memory . " The fire was THERE "[48-becky] , pointing with [her]48-becky finger , " an ' the table was before it ; an ' the lamp was there , an ' the light looked rosy red ; an ' there was a satin cover on [your]2018-miss bed , an ' a warm rug on the floor , an ' everythin ' looked beautiful ; an ' "[48-becky] [she]48-becky paused a second , and laid [her]48-becky hand on [her]48-becky stomach tenderly " there WAS soup an ' sandwiches an ' muffins there WAS . "[48-becky] And , with this conviction a reality at least , [she]48-becky went away .

Through [the mysterious agency which works in [schools]1493-schools and among [servants]963-servants]1492-the mysterious agency which works in schools and among servants , it was quite well known in the morning that [Sara Crewe]18-sara was in horrible disgrace , that [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde was under punishment , and that [Becky]48-becky would have been packed out of [the house]170-the house before breakfast , but that [a scullery maid]2101-a scullery maid could not be dispensed with at once . [The servants]636-the servants knew that [she]48-becky was allowed to stay because [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin could not easily find another creature helpless and humble enough to work like [a bounden slave]1498-a bounden slave for so few shillings a week . [The elder girls in [the schoolroom]269-the schoolroom]1499-the elder girls in the schoolroom knew that if [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin did not send [Sara]18-sara away it was for practical reasons of [her]22-miss minchin own .

" [She]18-sara 's growing so fast and learning such a lot , somehow , "[33-jessie] said [Jessie]33-jessie to [Lavinia]30-lavinia , " that [she]18-sara will be given classes soon , and [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin knows [she]18-sara will have to work for nothing . " [I]22-miss minchin got it out of [Lottie]31-lottie . [She]31-lottie 's such [a baby]302-a baby [she]31-lottie did n't know [she]31-lottie was telling [me]22-miss minchin . " What were [they]2817-they doing when [Miss Minchin]22-miss minchin caught [them]2817-they ? "[33-jessie]

" Pretending some silly thing . [Ermengarde]40-ermengarde had taken up [her]40-ermengarde hamper to share with [Sara]18-sara and [Becky]48-becky . " If [she]18-sara was turned out where would [she]18-sara go ? "[33-jessie] inquired [Jessie]33-jessie , a trifle anxiously .

" How do [I]30-lavinia know ? "[30-lavinia] snapped [Lavinia]30-lavinia . [Sara]18-sara went into [the scullery]643-the scullery . [Becky]48-becky was violently scrubbing a kettle , and was actually gurgling a little song in [her]48-becky throat . [She]48-becky looked up with a wildly elated face .
